title: Babygirl December 2020
body: I‚Äôve been using the what to expect App. The first 5months of my 3rd pregnancy and it‚Äôs also been a good App. But I found this one when it popped up in my emails and I LOVE it!! It‚Äôs very detailed and very informational, it‚Äôs more detailed then the WTE App and it has all kinds of good videos to watch about all kinds of things you will go through during pregnancy, I have to say I like it better than the other one and it goes day by day with my baby‚Äôs growth, not week by week only, it‚Äôs much more detailed and has way more information on it for all of us expecting moms to read and I like to watch the videos and see all the pictures so that‚Äôs a very good thing about it too! It‚Äôs a definite MUST HAVE!! I would recommend this App to any expecting moms, new moms or women trying to get pregnant, it will teach you a lot and it‚Äôs a great way to watch your baby grow and get a sense of what she looks like at this time in your belly, I use this App. Everyday or every other day, there is always something to me reading or watching and it never gets old to me! Thank you for making this App.!!! I love it and recommend to anyone expecting!üíñ Good Luck to all the new mommy‚Äôs out there!!

title: Not correct and keeping track of date and more very disappointed with the app
body: I just downloaded this app to track size and the right days and weeks so can keep close eye on how far I am to my due date of March 26, 2021 as of yesterday aug 4, 2020 I was 6 weeks and 4 days I got on it today to see if it is calculating correctly and yet it still had aug 4th when today is aug 5th and so I tried to refresh it wouldn‚Äôt then I went to feedback and settings and back to home page it did end changing the date to correct date which is aug 5th but still states I‚Äôm 6 weeks and 4 days when the correct number of weeks and days for aug 5th would be 6 weeks and 5 days not 4 days for that was yesterday I know I went to my doctor yesterday so it should refresh every day and state correct date as well as correct week and day of how far along I are if nothing gets done about this I‚Äôll recommend others to use an different app and not this one for it lacks right information and doesn‚Äôt refresh like should or when move page up to refresh and I will delete and find an better working app that is correct and works great and does refresh and has correct date and right weeks and days as well as days left til due date too for that effects things like baby weight size growth information and etc if isn‚Äôt correct on weeks days nor the right date and doesn‚Äôt refresh and lacks on the app and it is very important for people expecting to know the correct things

title: first pregnancy & looking for a support group? this is the app!
body: I‚Äôm 16 weeks pregnant currently & especially with what‚Äôs going on, you can‚Äôt really be in groups and find a great support system. This app makes me feel like I am surround with so many women who are going through what I am going through.

title: Growth Guide
body: Since I was pregnant until now, nearly five years ago, and two kids later. I‚Äôve been using this app. The amount of knowledge I‚Äôve gained is so valuable to me, I always share it with my husband and friends. Its made me a more confident in rearing my children and finding what works for us best. I don‚Äôt freak out about much in their development either, because I know what‚Äôs coming. Most of the time my mommy-gut feeling about a growth spurt is on point! However, knowing what behaviors accompany those developmental milestones helps you evaluate what‚Äôs ‚Äúnormal‚Äù and feel at ease. Baby Center has helped me understand what my kids are going through and how to help them get through the transition. And most importantly- why I shouldn‚Äôt get so frustrated with them, as its not so easy on the LOs or us. I‚Äôve used this app religiously since they were born, and will continue to for as long as you provide info on their age. I look forward to your emails in my inbox and I try not to skip any, otherwise I feel like I‚Äôm missing out on a gem about my own child. Love you Baby Center, keep up the good work!!!

title: 1 Bro, 1 Sis, and Twins!!
body: I have been using this app/site for all of my pregnancies. My son (3), my daughter (1) and my up and coming addition. I have become reliant on the information that is provided (even after knowing what to expect) and attached to the support chat rooms. I have found virtually all of the information that I needed with the exception of this....

title: GREAT APP (1st time pregnant)
body: We are first time pregnant/parents! I really thought this app was great! The milestones that I would personally hit during my pregnancy were pretty spot on according to the week by week notifications! I found it very cute and exciting to be able to see her growth compared to vegetables and fruit during our pregnancy! We had a lot of fun with it! Our daughter was born 2 days after her due date, so we were able to see where we were at each week on this app! I‚Äôm not a huge book person, so this was a much easier way to stay in tune to what already happened or what we could expect to happen! Sometimes we were like, oh that already happened last week or two weeks ago! Other times we would be excited and what was going to happen soon! I thought it was also very helpful because it gave us an idea on what to expect and gave ideas of what to ask the OBGYN doctors and nurses! I have been using it even since she was born and we are going on five months old now! Very helpful app!!! We will definitely use this app for our next pregnancy!

title: Free & better than other apps
body: Free App, better than the others that charge. I downloaded 5 pregnancy apps and of all of them this one was my favorite AND free. I put it on the home screen while the rest I‚Äôve been checking to see if there‚Äôs anything different and you‚Äôre not missing out on important info by paying for the other ones. I think the information on this app is more positive and correct. I notice other apps like ‚ÄúWhat To Expect‚Äù especially is behind on the latest data and feeds the inner victim/negative expectations around pregnancy that I feel is a marketing tool more than a helpful thing. Things I knew before being pregnant like nail polish is hormone/reproductive disruptive, What To Expect was WAY off on the safety of that and other things and clearly didn‚Äôt do their research when the ingredients are right there for their ‚Äúexperts‚Äù. So I dropped them and went with this app which was the most accurate, positive, informative, and easy to use/navigate. Doesn‚Äôt pop up with annoying ‚Äúupgrade‚Äù prompts either!

title: Miscarriage Support
body: I had a miscarriage and I had to delete my pregnancy from your app. 1- it‚Äôs horrible that the app doesn‚Äôt have any miscarriage support like my other apps do and you can‚Äôt even use the app unless you log that you are currently pregnant. Once you delete a pregnancy it just kicks you out.

title: Perfect pregnancy app
body: I absolutely love this app!! This app includes a detailed insight of your pregnancy week by week as well as a picture of what your child looks like in your womb. Also, it includes dos and don‚Äôts, milestones during your pregnancy and for your child, and information on any topic that may pertain to your pregnancy, lifestyle, and even your child. I was a first time mother who had just delivered her first child in April 2021 so this app was beyond insightful on everything that I needed to know so and there is even multiple group chat threads that you can ask another mother out there a  or you may just have information that you think other mothers should know without there being any judgement. Even after I had my child, every week I was informed about milestones and information that my child may be experiencing. This app literally has everything that I needed to know so it was the only app I used during my pregnancy, which I was glad about it, and even after I had my baby I continue to use it.

title: Great app, bad ads.
body: My baby turned one year old yesterday. I turned in the app, excited to read some more but it was still on page 11 month, 4 weeks. No further information, no celebratory message for growing with them for a year, no recommendation for the years to come, no farewell message, nothing. You'd think, if everything comes to an end on the app, that they would maybe give us an ending of some sort? I guess I'll just delete it now. Thanks for being an almost daily visit for nearly two years. Byyye...

title: Better than other baby apps
body: I did my research before downloading a baby app. I'm on my 3rd child and I still found useful info in this app that helped me gain a better understanding of my baby before and after birth. The amount of knowledge that is at your finger tips just within this app is amazing. They really did their research. Everything I was feeling or questioning would pop up as a post right when it should. It was like a mind reader. Really helped me be more confident during my pregnancy. So glad I got this app. My sister had another top rated app and I convinced her to try BabyCenter. She loves this app way more. DOWNLOAD NOW! No regrets.

title: Excellent source of information
body: This app has been a Godsend for me throughout my pregnancy and during the first part of my baby's life. There is so much information and articles for just about any question I have. I am thankful for resources like this one and wonder how people functioned without them! I appreciate how positive and encouraging the articles are. Particularly the ones about problems. For example, my baby had jaundice when he was born. Reading the article about jaundice on this app was extremely informative and also encouraging. My hospital experience regarding jaundice was not so calm, so having something to read to tell me everything would be ok was very helpful. I also love the polls. It's interesting to see what others are experiencing that use this app. My only piece of criticism is that I wish that the app did not repeat articles so much. Some of the same articles I read during my first trimester popped back up in the third trimester. This is just a minor annoyance though!

title: Eh
body: This is my first pregnancy so I‚Äôm interested in all advice and knowledge. I also like seeing what my baby looks like daily. This a personal preference and this app doesn‚Äôt really show images of what the baby looks like daily other than a video you can click on here and there. Also, the forums are confusing, they aren‚Äôt laid out self explanatory. I work in a technology store I‚Äôm actually a mobile expert and the way the forums are set up in the app are confusing. It says start a baby club where you can essentially talk to others, but there is no set button to do so and if you do find where to post it just prompts you to post and you have no idea where exactly that post is going. There are forums on top of forums and really only places to reply to people who have already posted somehow. Idk the interface and display wasn‚Äôt really satisfying to me, i had the app for two days and deleted. I downloaded another app that shows beautiful digital images of what the baby can look like daily and also get advice and talk to others. This app has a good concept but doesn‚Äôt really seem well thought out, user friendly wise.

title: Absolutely Recommend
body: This app saved my life.  I was 30 weeks pregnant and I read an article about things to look for and call your doctor.  Mainly about things that may be dangers during pregnancy and call doctors immediately. Well the article talked about swelling and preeclampsia, etc. I had noticed some swelling before and planned to talk with my dr on the next visit.  I was at work and my hands started swelling like the Nutty Professor. Called the Doc, they told me to come in, sent me for some blood work and the next day I was admitted to the hospital.  The article was right I had developed preeclampsia.   I had my baby 2 months early and that was emotionally exhausting but we are both doing well!   I love this app because it is informative and helps get parents ready for baby, explain what you may be going through and helps with questions you may have about your body.  It even prepares you to understand what the dr is talking about.  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS APP!

title: The creators of this tried...
body: The women on this app are brutal and extremely rude and insulting and board owners take part in the harsh words as well (they should be neutral and just oversee things, not actually contribute). Wish it was monitored to create a community of support, instead it seems to function more like Facebook for high schoolers because the women feel the need to attack the others (I don‚Äôt have Facebook for this reason). Lots of close minded individuals on here that don‚Äôt know when to keep their one track mindedness to themselves. Besides from the participants of the site, it‚Äôs structured to be a bit more old school in medical information and advice. Not really giving the most accurate info but I guess its based on generalizing anyway in an attempt to appeal to more moms. If your a non vaxer... good luck to you on here. No info is provided about that aspect, only pro vaccine and if you bring it up, the other moms attack. Not really the most pleasant app but I see the good intent and that‚Äôs why I keep it. Good for tracking how far along you are in your pregnancy (which I guess you can use a calendar for). It‚Äôs a good app, but could most definitely use more work.

title: Mom of 4 who‚Äôs forgotten everything ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
body: Let‚Äôs be real for a second.

title: Helpful info!
body: I have to say I do love this app. It makes me happy that have something to look at everyday for info. (I look forward to it so much every morning that I force myself not to look at the next days content, so I have something for everyday of the week). And getting to see where the baby is in development each weak is nice.

title: Single new mom with no parents to guide me
body: This is exactly what I‚Äôve needed my whole pregnancy, labor, training etc. I was scared at first when I found out because I don‚Äôt have any parents to teach me to parent and I haven‚Äôt had much of a good influence. I basically just learned what not to do my whole life. But this app really changed that. my son is already 8 months old and he‚Äôs a perfect baby all thanks to this app. Everyone around me says he‚Äôs the happiest baby they‚Äôve seen... Also thanks to this app.... my pregnancy wasn‚Äôt all that scary... Everytime I felt horrible or different I‚Äôd look it up and it‚Äôd tell me it‚Äôs heartburn which means my baby has hair now or some crazy cool fact that made it less terrifying to change in a way like this. It‚Äôs much harder to google things based off of feeling especially when there‚Äôs a handbook for each day right here. Thank you for all your help.

title: I never leave reviews
body: dude i love this app. i love learning week by week what our little one is up to in there. this is my first child so i really utilize all the tools, articles, tidbits, and fun facts to be more aware of the little person im growing. i get so excited reading what vegetable or fruit our baby is likened to during that week in terms of size. ive made it a weekly treat for me to wait until the day of each new week to look at the baby's stats and it helps keep me motivated and informed and excited about what to expect! easy to navigate, countless publications from experts and moms, and fun to use. today im 37 weeks (im not crying, you are) and looking back from when i first downloaded BabyCenter, i really appreciate this app. it's actually gotten me through some tough times throughout my pregnancy by reminding me what a blessing and triumph and miracle it is to become and to be a mom. super duper grateful :,) go moms! we're superheroes and dont let anyone make you feel differently!

title: The Comment Section‚Ä¶
body: I really enjoy this app. It has a ton of great Articles, Tip and tricks for First Time mother‚Äôs and mother‚Äôs Overall. It‚Äôs very informative and Provides me with a Comfortable feeling where I Can relate to other Women and hear they‚Äôre stories and experiences. I do like how you can make your own Post and comment on others to spark up a Good conversation‚Ä¶ BUT The comment section is confusing. If I want to reply to someone‚Äôs comment on my post or vise versa it‚Äôs hard to tell which person I‚Äôm replying to. They duplicate a lot of the replies on the same post and I have to constantly scroll through the pages to try and Find the user I was previously commenting with just a few minutes before. They should simplify to a basic Post and have all Replies underneath. That way if I, or anyone else, would like to comment they can just go down and choose to reply to someone specific or on the Post itself. Something similar to what Facebook has would rate this app 5 out of 5 for me!

title: What to Expect from Baby Center
body: When I became pregnant I immediately visited the App Store, eager to plug in my estimate due date.  I downloaded three applications: Baby Center, What to Expect and Sprout.  Baby Center was by far my favorite and eventually the only one I used mainly because the search feature was the easiest to use.  The articles feature up to date information based on the latest science based research.  You can also dabble on the more opinion based side and connect with moms around the world.  What to Expect also had these features but I found it difficult to search for information and Baby Center has better SEO so I was often redirected to the app when searching outside of the app using Google and other search engines.  Sprout has a cool graphic of a 3D baby and a nice journal feature (except it will delete your journal in error!) but not worth paying for and it lacked the community.

title: This is THE one!
body: It was hard to decide which pregnancy and baby app to go with. Baby Center has clearly been the right choice. It has taken me successfully through pregnancy and early parenthood, so far. The articles and information are always right on time, according to what I‚Äôm experiencing and wondering about, each week. I love knowing exactly what was going on with my baby and body throughout pregnancy. And now, the benefit of knowing what to expect and easing concerns about my baby from day 1, has been immeasurable. Knowing what skills to expect to emerge each week has really allowed me to support and foster my baby‚Äôs development in a powerful way. Even the chat room for my birth month club has been so very helpful as we explore and vent and share experiences and are reminded that we‚Äôre not alone. If you‚Äôre looking for a phenomenal, all-inclusive app for pregnancy and parenthood, look no further. This is it!!!

title: Awesome Pregnancy App
body: I love watching the baby grow part of it and how it compares baby to a food and tells you the main things that are happening on the inside with baby that week. I also love all the different articles that you can read everyday. Some of them are very helpful. One this I wish this app did have would be a check list of some sort for new moms that suggests when you should do things by certain time that someone may want to do like take a prenatal class or have a hospital bag packed. I know they have articles and videos on that but an actual checklist where someone can see what is left to be done would be nice. Possibly a baby item checklist too. I keep trying to write out lists of what we need and forgetting where I put them or forget certain things to put on the list. But overall I love this app and I would recommend it to anyone who is trying or already is pregnant if they want to learn more about pregnancy.

title: My second partner during my journey
body: My husband (and first partner) and I love this app. It has been extremely helpful, giving us great information and even peace of mind when needed. Tracking my progress as I go along and providing detailed descriptions and visual effects of my baby as he/she is growing week by week. We love this app and would happily use again in any future pregnancies. The access and connection with other mothers proves helpful and eases my worries. I was able to find helpful links for the registries and sign up for various amenities like blood cord registry and free breast pump through insurance!

title: Not well organized and hacked
body: It gets two stars because I like the community but it‚Äôs not well organized. It‚Äôs hard to follow threads and it‚Äôs hard to find different groups and it‚Äôs hard to go back and see a comment that you made. It doesn‚Äôt show you your comments. It just shows original posts that you‚Äôve made. It won‚Äôt let you erase notifications. That would be helpful so you can delete the reminders if there was a TROLL on one of your boards. Oh it also doesn‚Äôt consider photos of discharge as inappropriate. In glow they require the poster to mark the photo sensitive so those who WANT to help the person out and view the photo can click on it. But in baby center you‚Äôre forced to look at it which stinks because sometimes you have to scroll past to find an old comment. I also think it‚Äôs hacked. Fake ATT winning spree things keep popping up INLY in that app then shut down everything I was working on. I have an iPhone. It‚Äôs pretty well protected and I don‚Äôt have that issue with any other app or even online. So that needs to be fixed. The app needs A LOT of help

title: Horrible app DO NOT GET!!!!
body: This app is not good. Cyber bullying is encouraged on here!!! The actual baby center community guidelines are not followed and the group owners since they are not paid will pick and chose who to support even if another member literally harasses you and attack you. And even when they admit or see violations by these bully‚Äôs they literally do nothing about it. They allow the exact same ones to bully the ladies here and they go back and forth to different month boards bullying others on those too. Nothing is done about it. Their customer service will ignore you and your concerns and only responds with a short reply when you end up having to resend email over and over. Horrible customer service and horrible set up and a horrible place for moms who need support as they end up getting harassed, torn down, belittled, insulted, judged by the bully‚Äôs baby centers support and back up. I will be sharing this info on my social media as well to warn others not to get. I will be using other pregnancy apps to support my pregnancy with fair guidelines and not ones that are made to treat others with discrimination and unfair treatment.

title: Insightful baby development tracker
body: I read every update each week for my pregnancy and for my toddler.

title: one of the best baby-parent apps out there
body: I got so encouraged with what I had grasped through this app with my first ever parenting experience that I‚Äôm now planning to develop something similar for Azerbaijani mothers (that‚Äôs where I‚Äôm from) in a native language so first time moms and pregnant women know how to take care of themselves both for the sake of their own and their to-be-born babies‚Äô health. sometimes hearing the stories of women who didn‚Äôt know they needed to be putting more effort to calcium or high in fiber food intake and are now struggling either with bone weakness or hemorrhoids - is making me appreciate what people at baby center  (and text for baby organization which sends couple of text messages with important info throughout pregnancy) do! thank you all so very much for helping all of us stay knowledgeable, healthy and happy and contribute to giving birth to and raising a successful baby with sound health!

title: Glitch with Bumpie (Update)
body: *I did contact babycenter customer service, however their reply was not sufficient and did not help troubleshoot where to find my bumpies. Instead, they provided the same things I‚Äôve already tried. I still have not been able to locate my bumpies. I left another message for the developer and I am still waiting for a reply.

title: Good App- Negative people
body: The app itself is very good for Moms who like to read information about their baby and pregnancy. It‚Äôs very helpful. And even after you have your baby they continue to help you and give you updates on your newborn and as your child progresses up until they‚Äôre 1 year old. The only thing I would say steer clear from are some of the forums/groups. A lot of them do tolerate bullying/ harassment and the Admins don‚Äôt seem to care. The Admins literally take side with the bullies and ‚Äúkick out‚Äù the person that is being harassed. If you post something in a group that isn‚Äôt necessarily of the ‚Äúnature‚Äù of what the group is meant for , they will all shun you and tell you that your question/ post is dumb and that it doesn‚Äôt belong in their group, and they basically berate the other person completely to the point where if the poster defends themself they start getting very nasty. I do not recommend this app for a first time mom-to-be in a sense of getting advice from other moms. Be very careful or you could become one of their victims.

title: Very informative
body: I like this app and the weekly alert I get on the progress of my baby‚Äôs growth. The tools in this app are awesome, the Name Finder is my favorite. I haven‚Äôt had to use it yet, but I‚Äôm sure the Kick Tracker will come in handy later. I love that you can save your baby names that you love and see them all together without going to a separate file. The many different lists of name categories and their rankings are also handy to me. It‚Äôs where I found my girl name (and I love that it‚Äôs very unpopular). But I should say, while the name is ranked with a popularity number, when compared to the US social security website, the rank number is quite different. I‚Äôm assuming Babycenter is ranking based on Babycenter User‚Äôs name choices, and not the actual US population. If the popularity of a name is important to you, I‚Äôd check the SS website for truer numbers.

title: Phenomenal App
body: I absolutely adore this app!

title: A great resource
body: Before our baby was born my wife and I were feeling pretty overwhelmed with the shear number of baby books and what seemed like a daunting amount of information we needed to learn, however, after finding Baby Center and getting their week by week updates, it really helped condense things so we could understand what was happening each week without getting too far ahead of ourselves. At each stage of our pregnancy and our baby‚Äôs development we have felt informed and confident and have started really looking forward to reading about what‚Äôs going on each week so that we can adjust our parenting accordingly. Additionally, the parents forum is a great resource any time we have any questions or concerns, especially since it is broken up so we can read posts from parents with babies the same age as ours.

title: FTM
body: I really like this app. The week by week information is really helpful and I like the fruit comparisons. One of my favorite features are the ‚Äútools‚Äù. That helped me with my birth plan, and kick counts, plus who doesn‚Äôt like to look back and watch their tummies grow?! It‚Äôs also really nice that it transitions over to after the baby is born. I think a lot of FTM‚Äôs have a lot of questions. At least I do! I have a suggestion. I have quite a few apps for pregnancy but not one of them has the option for a preemie. I had to be induced at 34w so my son is 6w premature. All of these apps including this one just gives newborn information. It would be helpful to have the option to see how things progress for preemies. I understand everyone‚Äôs situation is different but a general idea or at least links for articles would be nice. Also, can you add more stickers for the photos?

title: The ONLY APP you need for pregnancy & baby!
body: JUST DOWNLOAD THIS APP NOW!! I absolutely LOVE BabyCenter!! I use it daily and it honestly brings me so much assurance & sanity during these hectic months of being a new mom. I initially downloaded it to learn about the different stages of pregnancy I was going through. It‚Äôs extremely informative and helpful. I enjoyed taking and creating weekly baby bump pictures through their baby bump tracker. Now that my baby is here, and I‚Äôm a first time mom, I‚Äôve found the community of women on this app INCREDIBLE!! I LOVE having a ‚Äòbirth group‚Äô of women who had children the same month I did so we can ask each other questions about anything (I didn‚Äôt realize his vital this was until having my son!). The amount of expert content and articles is great as well. It‚Äôs a well rounded app and really all that you need to stay informed and have support! Thanks BabyCenter!

title: Right on time advice and guidance
body: From the time my first daughter was born, as a FTM, by myself most of the time, babycenter was faithful and always delivered the greatest insight week after week. what made it all the more helpful was that it truly seemed like was literally right on time‚Äî The very thing I would be dealing with would correlate with what baby centers development email would be talking about for that week. From topics like their health, general developmental abilities (fine motor skills, milestones, temper any, things to possibly expect, appetite ideas, how to prepare for potty training, you name it. And although now that I have 3+ kids, I‚Äôm not able to read the daily mail weekly, I still look back to them for insight form time to time, because they‚Äôve proven themselves true, and foundational for moms who need all the ‚Äúsolid‚Äùinformation and help they can get.

title: Little bugs that could use fixing
body: I appreciate the tips and articles from baby center, seeing the progress of baby‚Äôs growth, and the conversations with other expectant moms. However, there are a few irritating problems with the app. For example, if you reply to someone‚Äôs comment on a conversation thread, it boots you all the way to the end of the comments. So then you have to go back and try to find where you were if you want to read anyone else‚Äôs comments that came after the one you commented on. Another problem I‚Äôve encountered is that it‚Äôll say that I have new notifications, but when I open the list of notifications none of them are showing new comments. EVER. Even when there really are new comments on the conversations I‚Äôm following. So that‚Äôs annoying.

title: BabyCenter App Five Star!
body: I love baby center! I used this all throughout my first pregnancy and now I‚Äôm pregnant again and I‚Äôm so excited! The website is very informative and keeps you up to date with the progression of your pregnancy. I love the daily updates of where my baby is growth wise. The groups are great and I enjoy the community. You can join a birth group for your due date and talk with other women who are due the same month as you! It‚Äôs awesome to have when you need to talk to other women going through the same situation. There‚Äôs a ton of other groups to join and there‚Äôs so many different options on this website and app! You can even take pictures of your bump and the babycenter app has a section for you to keep track of your bump growth along with cute little stickers you can add to your photos!

title: 2nd Pregnancy using App.. Not thrilled with changes
body: I used BC during my 2019 pregnancy and loved it! But with this pregnancy, it seems they have made changes with the forums that makes using the app really frustrating.

title: Why do I have to login every time time??
body: I really like the info on this app, but honestly the fact that I have to log in every time, drives me crazy. Don‚Äôt understand why it can‚Äôt keep me logged in like any other normal app. What information on this app can possibly be that sensitive that it requires a login every time? Sometimes don‚Äôt even bother which is sad cause as I say the info is usually interesting but have other apps with similar info.

title: Helpful, but annoying to use.
body: I love the BabyCenter community, it‚Äôs fun and really helpful. The app has a lot of great features, but it feels so outdated. It‚Äôs not fluid. It seems like I‚Äôm on a mobile version of the website, instead of what should be an easy, beautiful app experience. These problems are mostly within the ‚ÄúBirth Group‚Äù area and forums. It‚Äôs not easy to go back and forth between posts, it makes a separate window pop up when I go to the second page, and from there I have to carefully remember to press the back button, instead of the X in order to not jump back to the beginning. Finally, if I make a comment on a thread that has multiple pages of comments, I‚Äôm brought back to the first page of comments even when I wasn‚Äôt done reading through them. It‚Äôs just overall annoying. I‚Äôm only staying for the people in the community. But honestly, what‚Äôs different from the app and going on the website from safari on my phone? Nothing.

title: Bumpies are gone!!
body: All of my bumpiest are gone!!!! From every week of my pregnancy! I feel like crying cause I didn‚Äôt save them in my phone, only the app. üò≠ I couldn‚Äôt log into the app because everytime I tried it said ‚Äúyour session has timed out.‚Äù I had never logged out of it so I don‚Äôt know why it wouldn‚Äôt let me log back in and I know me email and password were correct. Well it finally let me log in and I don‚Äôt know why but it thought that I had my baby already and just switched to newborn mode! It showed my due date was my birthdate?? Like what???!! Cause I‚Äôm still pregnant at 40.5 weeks. Anyway so I tried fixing it and deleted my due date cause thought that was the problem and checked my bumpies and now they‚Äôre all gone. All 40 weeks worth of pictures. I wish I had saved them on my phone, but I didn‚Äôt and now can‚Äôt get them back! It even lost all the baby names I had saved and my birth plan sheet. I am currently not happy with this app at all.

title: Yayyy!
body: I‚Äôve been using Baby center for the last few weeks as I am a first time mom seeking the best information. I felt like I wanted a backup app maybe to compare and see if there‚Äôs better but upon reading reviews of other suggested pregnancy apps I am seeing people are satisfied with this one and I will stay!!! I love the week to week, daily updates (also via email) and all other helpful information/articles. I‚Äôm not too big on the communities as it‚Äôs a lot of chit chat and I don‚Äôt feel it‚Äôs organized but if you‚Äôre not into that and only into the information it‚Äôs great! I love the week to week ‚Äúbumpies ‚Äú/ selfies feature (make sure u save to phone in case of any glitches or switch of devices cuz they don‚Äôt transfer ). I‚Äôm only giving 4 stars right now because I‚Äôm 8 weeks in and there‚Äôs a longgg way to go so I hope I continue to stay satisfied!

title: Ladies...YOU WILL NEED THIS IN YOUR LIFE. Trust me!
body: This app is AMAZING ladies. I got this app when I found out I was pregnant at 6 weeks. It gives you so much information and also has group descussions. This part is important: Every week it tells you about different things and changes in your body and when I say they are spot on... Its so spot on that its scary. One day it would say that your gums may bleed a little more while brushing in the week your in. The day I read this... I went to brush my teeth and they bled for the first time! It was crazy. It made me feel so much better and at ease, being a first time mother. Pregnancy can be very weird and scary and this app will help you so much! After your baby is born, it is also spot on. Tells you all about your baby, feeding, diapering, changes, ect. Just give this app a try!

title: As Far So Good
body: Before choosing an app to use I read through many reviews like a typical first time mom. This app provided me with information beyond what I was expecting from videos, to pictures, to several articles and answers from doctors. It also has little fun surveys from other moms you can answer as well as a section to take pictures of your baby bump. :-) At 22 weeks this app has answered many questions for me and has been accurate in just about everything I have read. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who would like to monitor their pregnancy process.

title: Lifesaver & Everything you'll ever need
body: This app was the best find and am so thankful! Daily, monthly, weekly info was unbelievably organized and timed perfectly for every stage!

title: Love this app!
body: When I became pregnant, I downloaded this app because it was highly ranked. I remember going through the app as an African American and seeing a lack of representation for blacks. I sent what was probably a harsh email, complaining  about how this makes for a less than desirable experience for me to use the app. I‚Äôm happy to say that they responded in the way most companies do not these days. They put me, their client first. They responded extremely professionally and said they would put effort towards updating their stock images to help show more diversity. Since they I have seen a variety of moms and dads from all backgrounds and I love it. It is now an app that is representative of what America looks like. Truly thankful for this app because it has helped me enjoy seeing my baby girl grow. Keep up the great work!!!

title: Updates are great, except...
body: We are two weeks away from our first being born, we have used this app for many things, but mainly for the bumpies, every week we have put the little sticker that it defaulted to that shows the week we are at. Now, after the update, and only two weeks from the end, that is no longer an option, our slideshow of pictures will be different for the last two weeks because they just *had* to change stuff.

title: Even after baby is here, the app keeps giving!
body: I have 4 children, and this was the 1st app I‚Äôve ever used while pregnant with any of the kids. It was amazing up until the day I gave birth! (Which was July 2, 2020)

title: Tips Through Pregnancy and Beyond
body: I love the BabyCenter community! As a first time mom, I was so nervous about my pregnancy and then about raising a newborn baby. I had so many questions! But all of the updates from BabyCenter walked me through my pregnancy, plus I was grouped in a community of expecting moms with the same month Due Date, and I found a lot of support and guidance especially from other experienced moms. I really liked this community a lot better than the What To Expect app. Now that my baby is almost 5 months, I continue to get support and guidance, tips and tricks and milestones from the community! The only negative thing I can say is that some of the ladies on the forums can be a little mean sometimes, but it‚Äôs kind of expected when you put a bunch of hormonal or pregnant women in one room üòÇ

title: One stop shop for useful pregnancy information
body: I love this app!! I‚Äôve literally been using it everyday (sometimes multiple times a day) ever since I found out I was pregnant! It was recommended to me by my sister and I would highly recommend it to others. The information is relevant, timely, and very easy to understand. The articles and videos really help me understand what‚Äôs going on in my body, what to expect each week, and what I should and should not be doing to have a healthy pregnancy. I find the tips from real moms and experts to be most useful...it makes me feel like I‚Äôm part of a community and that I‚Äôm not alone in this journey. This is my first child so I was very overwhelmed and anxious but with the help of the app, I am more at ease and feel comfortable.

title: Good but needs fixing
body: I enjoy babycenter for helpful information and I love the discussion posts between all the moms out there. Tracking my babies development has been my favorite. However, I had an issue where I had to download the app all over again, which I didn‚Äôt think would be a problem considering I have my own sign on where all my personal information is kept. When I signed back on after re-downloading the app, every bumpie I had taken was gone. Everything else on my account was there, but none of the bump pictures. This was heartbreaking considering this is how I was tracking my bump pictures. I guess I trusted the app too much and should have documented each on my own also. Luckily I have most saved, but have no clue which week was which. Really disappointing, and not sure why that would have happened. Other than that I do really enjoy this app.

title: So helpful!
body: This site is so helpful for moms during and after pregnancy. Helps with learning where your little baby is at while they‚Äôre inside you, what‚Äôs developing, how big they are, helpful pregnancy symptoms tips so you know what you‚Äôre feeling is normal and remedies that may help. Then it helps you learn how tour new baby is doing developmentally, showing certain milestones to expect and helpful tips on things to help with colic and gas, and helping new parents know things will get better. They also have groups for parents to support one another, tracking systems to keep track of baby‚Äôs growth. Lullabies that will sing to your baby in those early morning hours when you‚Äôre tired and can just manage to rock them to sleep. There‚Äôs definitely something for everyone!

title: Moms attacking other moms
body: I really liked the app until recently. I think all of the baby information is great, and if you only use it for that I guess it‚Äôs pretty solid. I‚Äôve recently gotten into the ‚Äúbirth club community‚Äù where other moms post their questions/comments or are just looking for a safe space to vent. I‚Äôve noticed a lot of people putting others down/spreading judgment. I wish they had a way to clean up this sort of thing. There‚Äôs very specific women on here who‚Äôs names seem to pop up on EVERYTHING that seem to always be looking for a chance to knock others down, and it quickly becomes moms ganging up on other moms. Maybe that‚Äôs just the internet and I should get off, but I don‚Äôt think it needs to be this kind of environment. I specifically deleted social media for this reason and wasn‚Äôt aware that a baby app could possibly come with the same amount of drama.

title: Disappointed
body: I really loved this app and I think it gives some really great information. However I give it one start because when I logged out and logged back on, it completely deleted ALL of my Bumpies. I started taking them at 7 weeks and now being 24 weeks they‚Äôre all gone. It seriously broke my heart because now I have nothing.. not even one. I don‚Äôt get the purpose of making an account if the pictures will get deleted once you log off. I also tried contacting them through email and twitter and have received no type of reply. It‚Äôs honestly very frustrating and I‚Äôm so angry because I didn‚Äôt think to save them on my phone since I did have them on the app. I just wanted to warn other mommies to beware!!! Because this is really sad!

title: Love this app!
body: When I was pregnant with my 1st Child I didn‚Äôt know what to expect and I had so many questions so to help me get a better understanding about the journey I was about to face I went to my App Store and searched for an app to track my pregnancy journey and I am so glad it did! Once I downloaded this app I truly fell in love with it! Not only was I able to track my pregnancy and see how much my baby was growing from beginning to end but this app had so many answers to my questions. Also I love the fact that I was able to take pictures of my pregnant belly from 9 weeks pregnant up to 41 weeks pregnant. The transformation is truly amazing if I must say so myself! I totally recommend this app for first time moms and any expecting moms! Trust me you‚Äôll be glad you did!

title: Best Pregnancy App
body: This is my first child. So I downloaded about 10 pregnancy apps just to get a feel for which one had the best/most accurate information. I absolutely love Baby Center! There are so many videos and articles that really help throughout the entire pregnancy. My favorite part is the Bump Gallery. You can‚Äôt take a photo of your bump every week and upload it into the gallery to see them all together. I recommend this app compared to the others I have tried. However, I do use one more (Ovia Pregnancy) and that‚Äôs because they let you track your moods, weight, doctors appointments, and many more things that Baby Center doesn‚Äôt offer. However, if you just want the knowledge about your pregnancy then Baby Center is for sure the one to go with!!

title: Everyone Needs Help
body: Hello! I am a first time mom. All my friends have kids, so I kinda thought I had an idea. Turns out- they don‚Äôt tell you Everything- and then there are the.. I don‚Äôt really want to ask anyone that- or is this normal? So many questions and thoughts run threw the pregnant mind it makes a girl insane! I was so glad for this app. Keeps you in check with what‚Äôs going on. The changes. Feelings. And questions and comments from others!! So helpful to know I‚Äôm not the only crazy obsessed anxious person out there. lol. Thanks so much for helping me through my first pregnancy and baby! My boy just turned 1. And the app has all his info and things from even before we got pregnant! So cool to have all these memories. Thanks for the help and everything!

title: Recommend
body: It‚Äôs quite an informative app. There are many different resources such as videos explaining labor, week by week tips and preparation for what to expect during pregnancy, and much more. There‚Äôs an overall sense of guidance and motherhood connection that you can find in this app. With COVID, I had to hold off on labor preparation classes and couldn‚Äôt join a ‚Äúmom group,‚Äù and it was a lonely experience in that sense. I‚Äôm glad I was able to connect to other moms through this app. i think it‚Äôs so important to connect to other people that you can relate to. There‚Äôs an option to join a group depending on your estimated due date and you can post questions or concerns, or just start a post to get a conversation going with other moms. I recommend this app :)

title: Very comprehensive App
body: I downloaded the app in November 2019 when I found out I was pregnant. I was 5 weeks along at the time. I love how each week of pregnancy they explain to you what is going on with both you and baby - or babies in our case - we‚Äôre pregnant with twins. They also provide perfectly timed articles and to do‚Äôs for things you should be getting done during each trimester and tips/advice for things you may be experiencing. The only thing I would like to see added to the app is the ability to view and track a twin (or more multiples) pregnancy. They do have information on twins but not on a weekly basis. Otherwise, it‚Äôs very informational, well organized and I‚Äôve enjoyed checking in weekly to track my pregnancy.

title: Very good information and great experience
body: This has to be one of the best apps I have ever come across, as a first time father I can easily say there is loads and loads of information and guidance here. Even my wife loves all the tips and expectations provided.

title: Baby App Review
body: I have really enjoyed this app from the moment I downloaded it. It has been so helpful and I feel like I have been able to reflect on my worries, as well as, read up on important issues. I have had a great time tracking my baby kicks, working through the meaning of baby names, and checking in with Baby App.

title: Love it!
body: This app helped me throughout my whole pregnancy since I was about 11 weeks. It‚Äôs even more useful when I started to track the baby‚Äôs kicks and my contractions. The app has helpful guidelines and videos as well. I even recommended the app to a friend who just recently found out she is pregnant!

title: Very informative and timely!
body: This app has allowed me to enjoy my pregnancy, and be prepared for my delivery. It gave me a lot of information based on which I enjoyed every minute with my baby. My daughter is 16 months old now and I still receive notifications and articles on almost every topic related to baby‚Äôs age and stage. It‚Äôs making my journey more enjoyable and easier and less stressful. Baby center helps you understand children behavior and teaches how to manage it.

title: I love this app
body: I have been using this app since I learned I was pregnant. The readings that  it provides are very helpful to me as a FTM. The groups depending due date are very supportive and also provide insight towards symptoms and doubts any FTM would have. The interaction with other moms is a great network and easy way to meet other women that are going or have been through what I am feeling currently.. I love that it shows me how the baby is growing and the different changes we are both going through during pregnancy. it is so educational and allows me to connect with other moms to be and learned abo their current and previous pregnancy experience which helps ease my anxiety as a first time mom! I loved it so much that I recommended to my sister !

title: Great app
body: I love this app tracked all the way through my pregnancy. The best part though, is that it is tracked my little ones progress way past his first year and the trimesters of my pregnancy. The app is pretty well on track with what he is doing a daycare or at home. I have three other apps downloaded do the same thing in this is the only one that is thoroughly covered things that I hadn‚Äôt even thought about. ArticlesAbout emotional development, biting, temper tantrum‚Äôs, teeth coming in, weaning from breast-feeding, when it‚Äôs time to switch to Whole Foods! The ad covers for everything and I absolutely love it. The notifications come through my email and I can easily access the articles and updates directly from their app. This app is the best and I‚Äôm looking forward to using it with my next pregnancy

title: Must have especially  for us petrified First Time Moms!!!
body: Thank goodness for technology! I know being a first time mom I am probably a bit over board in the worry department and the wonder department  I just wonder what all is going on with baby as well as myself minute to minute, and I must say this app is so informative and helpful. I have noticed too that everything mentioned always Checks out as fact ( which I like ) definitely take the time to download this app besides it being a learning tool it also helps build the platform for you and your spouse to bond with baby together by keeping up with new developments each week and of course it helps us new mothers & those veteran mommy's bond  with our oh so precious baby!

title: Accurate
body: This app has helped me go through my pregnancy and the 1st year of my child. At the beginning I was amazed how accurate all the info is here- the growth of each body part, the symptoms, the advices and videos are all great. Then my son was born and again the information about his development stages and advices kept everything in tact for me. In all honesty, I followed my motherly instincts more than any advice but I had the piece of mind that I can get the information from a trusted site. At times motherhood could seem overwhelming but this app shares other moms‚Äô experiences, which shows you that you are not alone and helps you keep your sanity.

title: Backlash
body: If there was ever a time when you didn‚Äôt agree with something why wouldn‚Äôt you just walk away from it. If your an adult. This app has condoned several women to attack my inbox on my views constantly for 4 days about abortion. 45 notifications total. I was  clearly reflecting on my past decision NOT TO ABORT MY CHILD. There were a series of malicious words these women had when I only said why are you challenging someone‚Äôs integrity about something and being combative when you could just ignore the ignorance. More women reported my comments and keep inboxing me. I just gotten over horrible morning sickness and was fighting it for 2 weeks. Then I get on this app to have a little closure just seeing my comment that I didn‚Äôt kill my child. Then I get bashed for it. Don‚Äôt to get involved with these app Groups and discussions some people are not willing to take it but they can dish it. Altogether this was a disgrace to women everywhere I wish I would‚Äôve never downloaded it

title: Great App
body: I really enjoy this app. This is my second pregnancy using this app. It‚Äôs very informative and helpful. You can search just about anything from pregnancy questions to after birth tips, along with getting updates on milestones and tips for baby/ toddler. My only complaint is that there isn‚Äôt an option for a multiples pregnancy. This is my sixth pregnancy, so it‚Äôs nice to have as a reference, however this time is a twin pregnancy... so in a lot of ways it‚Äôs very different. It would just be nice to have that option to add 2 or more babies to help track weight and growth. Thankfully I have a great team of doctors to help with all of my questions as a lot of the information on the internet can be very scary when dealing with a multiples pregnancy.  For a single baby it‚Äôs definitely a great app!

title: So informational but not too overwhelming!
body: This app has everything you need to know and presents the information in a user friendly way. There are also videos that are just the right length (2 minutes) and is Q&A from new moms. There‚Äôs also an separate but connected app that helps you pick out baby names that I describe to friends and family as ‚Äútindr for baby names.‚Äù

title: Best Informational app for pregnancy!
body: It seems that through out this pregnancy of mine any questions, concerns, or thoughts BabyCenters moms have the answers I need.

title: Great app but...
body: The app does a great job of tracking your daily and weekly progress and what to expect. Has great articles to read and lots of interesting facts I never would‚Äôve known had I not read about it. Even the weekly notifications about what to expect that week is very helpful.

title: Great Website! App....is okay
body: I absolutely love this website. I don‚Äôt know how I would survive this treacherous infertility journey without the amazing group of girls I‚Äôve met.

title: Best Baby app ever
body: Being a first time mom I needed something that was quick and easy to use. The information provided was real, legit, and easy to understand. The groups you can join also provide great members that can answer any questions you have. Some members however can be a little not so great but its easy to block and report, so no hassle there. The tools within the app are so handy. For example, when keeping track of your pregnancy the app has all kinds of stickers that allow you to share/ show the growth of your little bundle. After your baby is born the app then helps keep track of your baby's age and and still provides developmental milestones as the child grows. It truly is the best baby app ever.

title: Baby center app
body: The app was perfect at first I loved it! It gives you all the information needed, baby measurements, what to expect for your baby‚Äôs development and your body, videos , others stories along with a poll which I found helpful to know that you wasn‚Äôt alone in some aspects... now they upgraded the app I don‚Äôt like it ! Everything use to be week by week and you scroll down daily and there is a bunch of different information along with videos etc, now after you make it to the next week of your pregnancy you see all the information on the first day than there‚Äôs nothing there the following days to scroll down and look at... I enjoyed looking every day to help pass time and be reassured now I have to wait every week or go ahead and look for the future weeks(which is no good because them them weeks of your pregnancy come you‚Äôve already saw it).

title: Best Pregnancy App!
body: Every week of your pregnancy you get articles related to that week full of info, an approximate size of the baby and a fruit/veggie to compare it to, and an update on how baby is developing that week.

title: Amazing
body: I really enjoy this app especially when I was pregnant. The community boards were a great place to talk to other moms especially about concerns and insecurities, it‚Äôs nice to know you‚Äôre not alone. And it‚Äôs been great post pregnancy too it has some great articles and a great search a fine for first time moms. I have the what to expect when expecting book and I‚Äôve definitely done more reading on this app than in that book. And it‚Äôs nice for picture tracking too unfortunately my phone broke 3/4 through my pregnancy and my photos didn‚Äôt back up on my icloud and I lost all of my bump pictures but it also has a feature to take monthly pictures of your baby as they grow which I really like.

title: 4 pregnancies all with this app
body: I love the updates! They remind me of symptoms that are normal and things to make sure I‚Äôm doing to get ready. Some people may think this is only for that first baby but I feel like the reminders have been just as helpful in the following pregnancies. I will have 4 kids under the age of 5 come September so the more helpful tips and reminders the better haha. The mom group is awesome! They keep updating you as your child grows and those mom groups that were expecting at the same time as you are now raising kids the same age as yours and struggling through potty training with you which has been awesome. I highly recommend this app it‚Äôs been so great, I can‚Äôt say enough good things.

title: Love the content
body: The content of the app was very helpful throughout my pregnancy and is proving to still be helpful now that I‚Äôve given birth. The only negatives I would say are the structure of the discussion section and the polls. The discussion section is full of so many ads that scrolling through a conversation is a little annoying. I prefer the discussion section on the ‚ÄúWhat to Expect‚Äù app. While the polls are very helpful and a nice feature, I find that the majority of the time, the app freezes when I try to answer a poll and I have to restart it only to find that sometimes my answer was recorded, other times it wasn‚Äôt. Other than that a great resource for expectant and new moms. Would highly recommend.

title: BabyCenter killed off my baby...!
body: I have used this app throughout pregnancy, and to track milestones for my 7 month old son. I used it to take week by week pregnancy photos, and as a generally enjoyable tool to learn about all kinds of baby related things.

title: A must have
body: From day 1 of the pregnancy countdown to day 1 of motherhood this app is there for you. Ive learned so many exciting things during my pregnancy. I've tried other apps but this one has always been the best. Every week you get videos and tips for your new little one. Theres a mom center where everyone gathers and shares advice or answers questions you have, you can ask literally anything because someone else is going through or has gone through something similar. It's great to have the support and advice from res doctors, plus it‚Äôs full of tons of ideas. Absolutely love how much this has helped me with my first baby, I‚Äôll use this as long as it‚Äôs available to me

title: Helps me be a better mother
body: BabyCenter was recommended to me when I was pregnant with my first. I asked my OB‚Äôs office which app I could trust, they said BabyCenter and I haven‚Äôt turned back since. This website and other mothers who use it have been my go to for information for my children and myself for both of my pregnancies and one miscarriage. I continue to use it and feel it‚Äôs very important to keep up with developmental stages for my almost 3 year old and 4 month old. I was paying for access to work out videos until I realized BabyCenter offered a wonderful series of videos for the post partum body. I would highly recommend this app and am not sure how others get by without.

title: Absolutely love this app!
body: By far this app has more helpful articles than any other baby/parenting app I‚Äôve tried. I love that the articles are short and to the point, and each one is has their source cited. I can literally search any subject and there‚Äôs videos, testimonies, charts and medical studies right at my fingertips. I rely so much on this app for those articles as well as the interactive features like the calendar! It‚Äôs my electronic baby book. I also love the growth chart tracker that I can fill it at each pediatrician appointment. I absolutely recommend this app to any new family, or those expecting their little love! I can always rely on this app for have the answers I‚Äôm looking for in one place.

title: Before and after
body: I found this app 10 years ago when I first got pregnant with our oldest. I loved reading about our baby all thru my pregnancy. Lots of helpful information. Then 8.5 years later I used it again for our second baby. This time I showed and taught my first born all about babies. She loved watching the videos over and over. She would ask every week, what fruit or vegetable her baby sister was (it was a never ending joke to her, saying I was having a leek or a squash etc). She went to Dr appointments with me knowing exactly what was going on and what to expect and now that ‚Äòher baby‚Äô is one, they are the best of friends. This app helped start a beautiful relationship between my girls.

title: Amazing App
body: When trying to get pregnant for two years, I used many apps, but this one was the most accurate on the dates.  It was also a great resource to refer back to with the million appointments asking when the last missed period and other dates were.  It was also great to refer back to, to see what the symptoms should be during each week. It has so much information and other mothers to help to solve the worries that may come up. Now my baby is 3 months, and it tells me the baby milestones now.  It is so nice to read what I can expect! I definitely would recommend this app to anyone that would just like the extra info and sources to help when trying to conceive.

title: Do not download!
body: There are much better pregnancy apps. And if you do, by all means, never join the message board. It is such a mean negative space. My account was blocked for defending another mom who was being bullied about her race by saying my account was blocked and they are ignoring my requests to remove my information off the site.

title: Don‚Äôt read articles by their ‚Äúexperts‚Äù
body: The app is good for keeping track of where you are in your pregnancy, and has some useful tools like the contraction timer, but the articles are basically useless. Anything on there that has anything to do with nutrition is both laughable and maddening. I don‚Äôt know how many I‚Äôve perused about baby and toddler nutrition that are still pushing you to feed your baby a low fat diet. It‚Äôs no wonder childhood obesity is such a problem in this country. Then they have geniuses like Kate Marple, one of their ‚Äúexperts‚Äù, who also wants you to put your toddler on a low fat diet, but also sneakily tries to convince you they need to be vegetarian as well, while advocating for super high sugar meals consisting of nothing but frozen vegetables and ‚Äúwhole grain pasta‚Äù. The other health related articles are not much better, but these nutrition ones are absolute garbage, and only helping to ensure that half this country remains diabetic and pre-diabetic.

title: So awesome!!
body: My sister used this app for her pregnancy and now I am currently using it for mine! We were able to see the size of the baby click on the pictures with the little ‚Äú+‚Äù symbol and learn so much about what‚Äôs going on inside during the pregnancy. It also gives us amazing articles to read that are full of information and tips to help you throughout your pregnancy. Articles on how what start planning for, what are the right things to eat and what aren‚Äôt. This app literally has so much information that it makes you feel really good about knowing what is happening inside of you and what to expect throughout your pregnancy! I LOVE IT. 10/10 recommend to others!

title: Perfect Pocket Resource
body: I have used the baby center app through each stage of my pregnancy, and am still using it as my 6 month old son continues to grow.

title: Step by step Guidance As to What To Expect
body: Babycenter is very informative. It provides weekly status updates of your pregnancy from conception to the third trimesters. Also, from newborn to 10 years old. I always look forward to the weekly topics for your baby/child developments. Also, it has tips/advices from other parents to help new parents i.e. what you really need for the baby during the first year, Q&A, how to take care of yourself, how to make time for you and your partner. Plus the additional tools available to track your pregnancy pictures, capture baby moments, growth, weight etc. Thus, this is by far the best baby guideline a new parent can ever ask for.

title: This app saved my life.
body: I used this app during my first pregnancy. About 10 days from my due date I was feeling weird. But I thought I was just being a wuss and kept on going. In the checkout line at Walmart, I was waiting and browsing the app. I read about the symptoms of preeclampsia and started making the connection. I called the on call nurse who told me to go to labor and delivery and have my blood pressure checked. It was so high they padded the bedrails in case I had a siezure. They induced, and I had a healthy baby boy. It took about two weeks for my blood pressure to get back to normal, but I can't imagine what would have happened if I hadn't had the information from this app. Thank you Baby Center!

title: Great education and go to for baby!
body: I love this app. When I was expecting it was great to read how my baby was growing and excellent information on the growth of my baby in the womb and all kinds of info on for me as an expecting mother. When my baby was here it flipped to a tracker for his growth! I loved that and I love to read age milestone expectations, how other moms are handling parent life through the articles and so many go tos for feeding, what to expect coming up and all of the concerns when things don't seem normal. Even the ads aren't bad at all. Well done Baby Center! I have recommended this app to so many parents - expecting first time and second and third baby and they love it. You will too.

title: Love the app, logging in every time is kinda getting old
body: Pros: This app has the best pictures for the pregnancy and I have a couple of friends who like it for after the baby comes too! The tools are easy to use and the navigation is intuitive. The articles are pretty helpful and the videos are fun. (One note on that, text is a little small for cellular devices, still readable but sometimes I have to pause and squint)

title: Great so far
body: I just downloaded the app yesterday. I appreciate the various features, especially the Birth Class tool! It was informative of the  choices that we can make with our care. I like the Birth Preference feature, you just check off options and it makes a pdf to give to your doctor. I also like the baby size tracker. It‚Äôs exciting to hear about my baby‚Äôs development.  I found that the baby names feature seems a little strange, there were some strange names listed and some were the opposite gender names. I haven‚Äôt gotten to explore all the features yet, but they seem useful. Overall, I think it‚Äôs a great app for being totally free! So I give it 5 stars.

title: Excellent App - must need for every new parent
body: My first go to app for every stage of baby development details is undoubtedly baby center. This app gives me precise week by week development details for tracking. I can‚Äôt talk for everyone but for a first time parent like me, this app is a boon from day 1.

title: Very informative and easy to use
body: I tried multiple pregnancy apps in the beginning of my pregnancy (this is my first child) and this one was immediately my favorite after downloading and seeing how the app worked, I‚Äôm being induced in just 12 days and I loved learning information about my sons development by week and watching him grow! I also love the in app tools they have along with the information pages that can basically answer any questions you might have. And the tools such as kick tracking, the bump gallery and more were helpful and fun and easy to use. The app runs very smoothly, if your a soon to be mom I would HIGHLY recommend this app!!

title: Awesome advice and information
body: As a first time mom, I think this app is very informative and helps you with almost everything from keeping track of your baby to giving you the space to ask question openly to other parents who are either new or experienced mothers as well. I also like how you can get access to so much in one place rather then looking all over the internet when you have late night curiosity or just a wondering mind and you don‚Äôt have a doctor on stand by to ask questions to. This app has helped me a lot and calmed my nerves more then once...which is a big plus since you don‚Äôt want to be stressing when pregnant.

title: I love it!
body: I've used this app through two pregnancies as well as post birth. It has the answers to motofmy questions before I have a chance to ask them. It gives me insight to what I should expect as normal. The app has changed a lot in the past 5 years and now offers tools for feeding, sleep, a growth tracker, as well as a sort of mile stone picture album so you have everything in one spot! I love it. If you are still pregnant I also highly recommend Growth Tracker, it's for more detailed info that hospitals will beg you to track. Also the app Full Term, is really really great for tracking contractions. These three apps keep me feeling much more comfortable about momming!

title: I‚Äôm the husband/Father üòÅ
body: So this app is AMAZING! My wife and I are on child number two and I have used this app for both children. The accuracy of the app is out of this world literally when it said we should expect to feel flutters and kicking we did, when it said my wife‚Äôs nausea and morning sickness should start to subside or dissipate it did. So since my wife is experiencing the pregnancy first hand the app helps me feel more involved and gives me great advice and ideas to ease my wife‚Äôs pregnancy... So on a a scale of 1-10 where 10 would be the highest score my wife and I give the BabyCenter app a 10! Thanks for all the great advice along this journey.

title: Love this app! / UPDATE
body: This is my first time being pregnant. I haven't gone to the doctors to see how far along I am, which is why I gave it 4 stars. I do plan on giving it five stars if the app is accurate with how far along I am. It's been perfect so far, I love the updates and the videos along with it. So many articles that have given me a big heads up of what's to come. Awesome app I completely recommend it! / UPDATE: I have gone to the doctors to find out I am having twins! I wish I could add that to this app.. and have added information about twins. Also the app said today I am 8 weeks, come to find out I was 8 weeks about 2 days ago. But that's no biggie. The app is good but definitely should have a section for twins

title: Amazing and helpful
body: The Baby Center App is just wonderful. I have used it to track 2 pregnancies and am now still using it as my son is 8 months old. I actually didn‚Äôt realize that the Baby Center app keeps sending you updates and awesome articles about your baby within his or her first year! But this app is super helpful to track pregnancies and learn about them each week as your body and baby grows and also after baby is born, tracks and has helpful articles about your first year with your baby. I would recommend this app to anyone. I have used it since 2014, and have not had any major bugs or issues with this app.

title: My family loves this app
body: This app has given my family the chance to take part in and enjoy this pregnancy just as much as I do. The kids love seeing the video each week and I send them to my husband so they can see what‚Äôs going on inside this mysterious belly! They get to see the baby‚Äôs progress and learn neat facts about development. The videos have lifelike animations, so they feel like they get to see ‚Äúour baby‚Äù. There are also lots of other great links each day to read on lots of different topics regarding pregnancy. This way, I don‚Äôt have to commit to a book, but I‚Äôm learning a ton of great information in quick little articles. It has helped me a lot.

title: Can‚Äôt say enough good things!
body: Not only do you get videos and pictures of what‚Äôs happening in your pregnancy weekly, but you get multiple articles for each day of your pregnancy! This is both informative and takes some of the edge off while I sit here and wait to meet my little one! Plus, there‚Äôs all sorts of tools to monitor your baby‚Äôs kicks, make a list of names, remind you of doctors appointments, make your birth plan, and more! Not to mention the social aspect you gain by joining groups of other moms in the same birth month. This app in particular also has a facet for trying to conceive, which can be so helpful for those struggling. Everything is great!

title: üëéüèΩüëéüèΩüëéüèΩüëéüèΩüëéüèΩ
body: I thought this was an app that you can share your experiences on and reach out to other mothers about concerns during and after pregnancy but when I make a post about what‚Äôs going on in my life, the people in charge of the app flag and remove it. That‚Äôs really heartless and inconsiderate and they really don‚Äôt have to worry about me using the app anymore, I will be deleting my profile while also spreading the word about what they‚Äôve done, more than once at that. People were loving my posts until the creators or whoever it is behind the scenes removed them. If the community doesn‚Äôt have a problem with what I said why do they? They just don‚Äôt want to see anyone spreading any positivity, it‚Äôs always the posts that make you scared of pregnancy and giving birth that they leave up but delete the ones trying to help make a difference in someone‚Äôs life.

title: Lovely & so helpful !
body: I recently became pregnant last year in 2018, I no clue what to read up on or things I should do while pregnant. This is my first child and I wanted an app that would be helpful along my pregnancy journey. A friend recommended I download this app. I was only about 4-5 weeks when I did but there is so much you don‚Äôt know about pregnancy until you become pregnant yourself ! Great app üëçüèº Thumbs up üëçüèº

title: Really like it besides one thing
body: I‚Äôve been really enjoying this app-I recommended it to every pregnant woman I know. One thing that I don‚Äôt like is that it asks me to log in each time I go on the app. I really wish there was an option to ‚Äúremember me‚Äù and not have to put in my login info each time I go on the app. I tried to search in the settings, but couldn‚Äôt find the option. I would really appreciate if you fixed this little inconvenience. Update: It seems like it was fixed:) now I am able to use the Face ID to log in. Same thoughts on the app-very convenient with tons of useful information. Highly recommend üëåüèªüíØ

title: Update erased all my information
body: I have been using this app since I found out I was pregnant with my first daughter who will be 3 in september. I have loved using all the features, tracking development during pregnancy and after birth. However, maybe I relied on it too much because I used it to store info on growth for both of my daughters and when I logged in after the most recent update, all my information was gone. I don‚Äôt have this info stored anywhere else and I‚Äôm so disappointed/heartbroken to have lost it all. I went on to log my youngest daughters size today because it is her first birthday, and the app doesn‚Äôt even show her on my account at all, like it reverted back to when I was pregnant and hadn‚Äôt named our oldest daughter yet. I‚Äôm hoping this is a bug that will be fixed and my info isn‚Äôt lost for good.

title: A new mom‚Äôs sidekick
body: I am beyond amazed by this app. During my pregnancy I was comforted by all the information and support and could find answers to any questions I had. After the birth of my daughter I still have used soo much useful information from this app. I rave about it to my friends who may use other sources and I also made my mom and mother in law download it to keep up with my daughter and to just learn about pregnancy and beyond since they never had this much info at their fingertips. I am sooo grateful for this app and the hard work getting all this data and resources for us users. Love it and will never take it off my phone.

title: Love the app - super helpful in pregnancy and beyond
body: I signed up for the app early in my pregnancy, and it was cool to learn along with my growing bump what was going on biologically. It was fun to share with my spouse too- he got a kick out of learning about fetal development and how our little baby was progressing.

title: Good info, no diversity
body: I like the information on BabyCenter and generally find it helpful, although the majority of it is very basic and can be found in any pregnancy book or website. It is fun getting weekly updates.

title: Greats tips!
body: This is a great tool especially for new moms who want to do things different from what they were taught. It teaches the different ways of discipline, and learning. It also tells you the different things to expect as your child gets older. I‚Äôm more prepared for my child's actions before she does them. It takes the load off of wondering whats next when you can already know. The experience of being a parent is fun when you have the baby center giving you updates every month. I say download it and keep it for every kid you have especially if all their zodiac signs aren‚Äôt the same. Happy Parenting!!

title: True Baby Center
body: Being a first time mom you have tons of questions! I downloaded 4 different apps to make sure I could soak in as much information as I could and after realizing I only/ always referred to this one I just deleted the others! They have everything on this app from breathing exercises, keeping track of how far along you are, days until birth, sex questions, baby size comparisons, polls (I like this feature so I can see how common my answers are to other mothers. It just makes your state feel more relatable). I seriously could stay on this app all day, there‚Äôs so much to learn. This app is truly a baby center!

title: People are leaving since last update
body: If you want a simplified version of What to Expect, great.  If you want community features, which used to be this app‚Äôs major selling point, AVOID THIS APP.  The last update gutted everything we need to get value out of the app.

title: Bumpie photos portion doesn‚Äôt work great
body: I‚Äôve been using this app since I found out we were expecting and started uploading and taking photos in the ‚Äúbumpie‚Äù section which I thought was so fun!
