Then it started deleting my photos and showing an error message for that weeks photo and won‚Äôt allow you to click on it or anything else, just frozen. So that‚Äôs unfortunate I was relying on a fun portion of the app for my progress photos and now it‚Äôs all jumbled and missing photos. Also not very user friendly if you need to edit them or want to adjust the order of photos. Other than that the information on this app has been great and helpful. Learned my lesson to save the photos to my phone also instead of solely relying on the app.

title: Amazing and Very Useful
body: I started using this app when I was 6 weeks pregnant, and I‚Äôm still using the app and learning new things every day with my almost 3 month old son.

title: Amazing App for FTM!
body: I‚Äôm a FTM and this app has helped me with so many things. The daily reads has taught me so many things that I didn‚Äôt know! The BabyCenter has helped me with any questions I had and answers from other parents! The baby tracker also helped me keep track on how big my baby is and what is expected of him! This app is amazing, I love it! The only downside for it is sometimes it glitches and won‚Äôt let me go back to the previous page and I would have to scroll all the way back or turn the pages.. Overall, this app is amazing and I‚Äôll continue to use it until my baby is able to talk to me properly!

title: Great app for tracking pregnancy and early childhood
body: This app is great for tracking pregnancy, labor and delivery, as well as early childhood. The only thing I didn't like is comparing a fetal size to esoteric vegetables I couldn't relate to- wish they would use more common household items. Otherwise, the tips and suggestions were right on cue. The contraction timer was absolutely fabulous, and we used it extensively during labor. It included a ‚Äútime from last contraction‚Äù, so we could anticipate the next one. Knowing the length of contraction allowed us to anticipate the peak and resolution of each one- a godsend. Now we're expiring the early childhood component of it. So far, so good.

title: I love it ü•∞
body: I love this app! I didn‚Äôt even know that I had any signs for preeclampsia until this app suggested that I check if I had symptoms. They listed the symptoms and I realized I had all of them! My doctors didn‚Äôt even know that and I‚Äôve been complaining for weeks! Actually it‚Äôs been about a month and a half! I am now 37 weeks pregnant and this could‚Äôve ended in disaster had I not been made aware and been able to Let my healthcare professionals know that I needed to be checked for it. Now they are about to do a Cesarion to get my daughter out so that the symptoms will go away and she will be out of the water. I think this app for that!

title: Overall good app
body: There are lots of great features of this app, like the group chats, the tools to find out if it is safe, the weekly videos telling you what is going on, and the articles. The only reason I did not give it full stars is because the due date calculator leaves a little to be desired. You should be able to calculate your due date using you ovulation date, or be able to enter the date of your last cycle and how long your cycle is. It would help more with accuracy. Though you can change the due date manually, it is annoying none the less. Overall would recommend this app to anyone trying to conceive, pregnant or post pregnant.

title: Great app!!
body: I am in my 1st trimester and recently downloaded this app. The ease of use and navigation is amazing. It is as good as using the website with all the information handy and available your phone. The pregnancy and baby tools like contraction timer and birth classes seem very useful. The best feature though is the birth club which you can use to communicate with other moms.

title: Great for anyone looking after a child
body: This app has so much info and for a first time mom like me, it offers knowledge on topics that I didn‚Äôt even know existed. I wish I could save posts without having to send an article or link to my fb messenger. Please add this feature to the app so I can get access to those posts way faster and for easy access.

title: Outstanding Review
body: I have nothing but nice things to say about BabyCenter. I will strongly recommend this app to my own family members and friends. It has help me as a first time mom really understand the changes that my body, and mind are going threw when they are going threw it! Amazing 3D footage of the fetus at multiple stages of the pregnancy along with the best information and advise filled every day of the week! Weekly photos called Bumpies which can be edited with available options or by you. This can be turned into a slide show later. The list only continues with everything they have to offer.

title: Best baby app!!
body: My boss actually recommended babycenter because she used it with her second child and loved it and I‚Äôm so glad she told me about it. I love that anything you might have a question about whether it‚Äôs food you‚Äôre able to eat or skin care products you should stay away from it lets you know every single thing you can or cannot use while you‚Äôre pregnant and also it‚Äôs great that you can track the baby‚Äôs development week by week.  This is my first baby and this app definitely made me feel more comfortable about being pregnant. I‚Äôll definitely be using BabyCenter for my second pregnancy.

title: Amazing and Informational App
body: Love how they show you a related size each week of your baby‚Äôs growth and breaks down what to expect in that week for their development. Equally love the different articles and videos they give each day and related ones as you read and have questions. It‚Äôs very helpful, comforting, and you don‚Äôt feel alone or lost especially for a first time mother to be. Me and my partner love it and both have the app so we stay updated and educated together when ever we personally feel to look. Equally I love the updates they give you of your babies development after birth it‚Äôs so interesting and insightful!

title: Highly surprised
body: I found this app during my 8th month of pregnancy, I was looking for a contraction timer and it gave me this. When I logged into the app I found a whole world of information about baby. I plugged in due date and every week this app gives me tips of what to expect about my pregnancy and after giving birth. I get weekly reports on what to expect from my baby and suggestions too. It tells you vaccination schedule for the child, it has a component to where you form a question the baby center community and you can get feedback in real time from.  This app is amazing and I‚Äôm in love to this day.

title: Mean girls club
body: I was excited to find an app with such an active community because I‚Äôm a first time mom and I don‚Äôt have many girl friends. As far as general content this site provides comparable articles, measurements and info week by week. The boards are overly full so unless you have no life and can catch up on hundreds of comments on the cite posts like sharing bumpies you‚Äôll get lost in the shuffle. If you happen to ask questions be ready for 1 or 2 helpful comments, a ton of ‚Äúcall your dr‚Äù comments ( DUH, waiting for her to call back) and then tons of rude, judge mental, passive aggressive, demeaning or belittling comments. It‚Äôs not an inclusive community and  I won‚Äôt bother sharing or asking for advice anymore because I don‚Äôt need to validate my feelings of lack of knowledge when I‚Äôm trying to reach out for it.

title: Amazing app!
body: BabyCenter is great! I can personalize my page by adding my baby‚Äôs name and due date. There‚Äôs a bunch of fun tools that help capture & record the whole process, such as baby bump photos and a contraction timer. Other cool things about the app are that it counts your weeks & gives you information on what‚Äôs happening for the week you are in for your pregnancy such as baby‚Äôs length and comparable sizes to real life things. You‚Äôll get info on your body and the changes as the weeks go by. There‚Äôs tons of helpful articles & chat circles you can talk to other pregnant women in! I‚Äôll keep this app until my beautiful baby arrives ü•∞

title: Okay App - needs updates
body: The articles are nice and helpful as well as the videos and recommendations. I also like the clear depictions of baby‚Äôs size at a certain week. The app itself just looks outdated and it only goes up to 39 weeks of pregnancy. Being 40 + 6 weeks, it feels a little discouraging. At least go to 42 weeks and have the option to say when baby arrived if past full term. The average for first time moms is 41.3 weeks so I don‚Äôt know why you wouldn‚Äôt go further than that. A lot of people believe that need to have baby at 39 weeks and don‚Äôt know that they can safely go up to 42 weeks (without medical issues). Allowing people to be more informed instead of jumping right into Newborn would be nice and more considerate.

title: App Update?
body: I loved the app but I think there was an update and now not so much. The pictures in the app advertisement is what I am accustomed to and it had information laid out in a way that was very helpful and everything on the page always loaded. I deleted the app after what I thought was a miscarriage but turns out I didn‚Äôt so I downloaded the app again. The layout is different (baby dashboard information appears in a four block grid in stead of ‚Äúslideshow‚Äù) and the page never fully loads. The links to the articles don‚Äôt work when I click them and I feel like there isnt as much information available as before. Prior to all this I loved the app and found it very useful  Was there an update or do I need to update my app?

title: I Love This App üòç
body: I‚Äôve been keeping up with my baby on this app and I truly do love it . They give great advice, answer most of my questions and have been accurate with mostly everything I read about the baby or babies needs. I don‚Äôt have anything negative to say about them. There app is pretty basic and not too flashy like others that make it more for one gender only. It even has videos In case reading a lot information isn‚Äôt for you . I‚Äôm currently 8 months and I started using it at 2 months after watching a Baby Center Video of a Baby developing . I would definitely recommend it to new moms.

title: A few additions then perfect I think!!
body: Would love to see somewhere on here how to keep track of your weight to make sure not gaining or losing too much pre pregnancy weight  to current and through term for all trimesters. Also a log or something to kept track of milestones:  Pregnancy test positive, when found out pregnant or date of 1st ultrasound. Things like that. First time pregnant and those are important to me. Possibly even a part on calendar for dr appts for baby.

title: Pregnancy/mommy essential!!
body: We have so many questions as worried pregnant woman and moms, even just the curiosity of what‚Äôs going on and why were feeling the way we‚Äôre feeling including baby. This app is full of ton of useful information! Giving you and your baby week to week updates up until he or she are born. Then what I love about it the most is that it doesn‚Äôt stop there it then turns to your baby week to week giving you each week the change in their growth and development along with baby center articles and support groups with other moms! Just download it!! You won‚Äôt regret you did.

title: Great Information
body: I really enjoyed getting all the updates of how my children were growing inside me and how they should be growing on that month. I also enjoyed that I could text message my family the articles and have them on board with what the grandchildren looked like on that month.

title: The bumpie feature changed
body: Overall love the app. However after using it for years, with my now 6 year old during that pregnancy, in 2017 during pregnancy for next one and now while expecting twins, I have found the content very repetitive. In addition two features seemed to have recently change. The bumpie feature used to have a shape for you to outline yourself and make sure you have the same pose/distance when you opened your camera. This week it disappeared and now it‚Äôs a lot harder to replicate the same distance for each pose.  In addition using the app compared to two years ago, the articles are pretty much all the same and you can‚Äôt get content specific to having twins.

title: Love this app
body: I loved tracking my babies development with this app. I was so excited when I found out about my little one I wanted to see right away where he was in his development. I immediately went online to find a pregnancy tracker and after downloading two previous apps, eventually settled on this one because the user interface was so intuitive, and I loved how detailed the development descriptions were. Over the course of my pregnancy I found the other features of the app to be so helpful too including: the Bumpie Photo Album, the ‚Äúis it safe‚Äù dictionary, the kick tracker, and the contraction timer.

title: Amazing app!
body: For airheads like me, it‚Äôs so nice to be able to click and see how far along our little nugget is. The fruit comparisons are strange sometimes, but I guess the app has taught me a few fruits I‚Äôve never heard of too.. ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

title: Best baby app!
body: I‚Äôve had this app since the day I found out I would be having a baby and it‚Äôs positive reminders and outlook on pregnancy has gotten me through this hard time in my life when sometimes I didn‚Äôt have anyone else! Thank you so much!

title: If I could give 0 stars, I would
body: This is my first pregnancy and I had no idea what to expect. I downloaded this app for updates and information as the baby grows and develops. There are several group message boards that are categorized very specifically, but when you try utilize these boards with general questions or any issues you may or may not be having, there is SO MUCH negativity from the other women.

title: Love the app except for the ‚Äúcount down‚Äù feature
body: I used this app to track all three of my pregnancies.  It works well but the developers assume all moms will to 40 weeks- which is not true.

title: You‚Äôve changed my entire pregnancy
body: Every week I look forward to taking a bumpie, reading the super helpful articles and getting the updates about my baby that week. Your forums have helped me with my unplanned pregnancy and making me not feel so alone. When I have a question, I look to see what other moms on Baby center have said and gone through. I feel so much more confident in what‚Äôs happening with my body and of all of the baby growth apps I have used, you have been most helpful. I seriously cannot thank you enough. Wonderful app. I have no complaints, only love for you guys.

title: Makes my day
body: Baby center helps me get through the long periods of pregnancy when I just can‚Äôt wait to meet my baby and feel like it‚Äôs taking forever! The updates remind me to pause and reflect upon each little milestone. They also give accurate developmental information at all stages of life (as far as I have seen). As a person with a master‚Äôs degree in early childhood education, it is exciting to see relevant and important milestone information shared through this app for parents who may not already know the significance of each step or how to help facilitate their child‚Äôs healthy development.

title: I‚Äôve been using this app for a year
body: I first downloaded this app when I found out I was pregnant. My baby is 5months and 3weeks now. I still love it. It‚Äôs very informative and keeps me up to date with my child‚Äôs developmental progress. I always felt like their updates were so accurate that they were writing specifically to me lol. I also like the fact that I can engage with other parents. It‚Äôs nice to know there are others out there with the same questions and concerns and even better to be able to find those answers coming from the people who learned through experience.

title: Love this app!
body: Love how interactive it is showing you what you and your baby are doing, going through, or are about to go through. Great support and information!You can even search for topics you want info on and it will give you scholarly articles to read. I thoroughly enjoy this app and love that it continues with you and your baby even after birth!! My Little one is almost a year and I love getting the weekly updates of how he‚Äôs growing/ developing! Info on nursing, health, development, play, and general baby knowledge/ troubleshooting. This app has been so much fun and a super helpful resource!! I highly recommend it!

title: L-O-V-E
body: I love this app!! It‚Äôs so awesome to be able to track your baby‚Äôs weight and size with just one click and also being able to read about all the changes happening through out your pregnancy and they are pretty much spot on! It definitely helps you to not worry about preggy symptoms you maybe have not had before or for the first time and aren‚Äôt sure if it is normal or not.

title: Replaced my mom with this app!
body: The accuracy of everything in this app is amazing. It was the first app I got to track my baby‚Äôs development with my first baby and it was a huge help. I loved getting weekly updates of my baby‚Äôs growth! I love everything about this app. As a new mom you worry about everything! So instead of calling my mom about everything little thing I‚Äôd just look it up on my baby center app! Huge relief!!!!!!!!!!  It‚Äôs every mommy‚Äôs must have baby app! Expecting my second baby and I‚Äôve found out that I can track my toddlers progress and my new baby‚Äôs progress from the same app!!!!!!! LOVE IT!!!!!!!

title: My favorite pregnancy app
body: I have used this app with both of my pregnancies and I love it. I love the tools tab where I can take my bump photos and the ‚Äúis it safe‚Äù tab is great. The fact that they add you to a mommy group that is filled with moms that are due the same month as you, and can ask any question to other moms across the world and get multiple opinions if you need it, just need to rant, or talk about anything baby related and get answers from all types of moms is great! I love the growth updates and all the images it gives you to understand the week you are in. This is 100% my favorite app! (:

title: THE BEST
body: This app literally helped SO MUCH!! It helped me realize I was definitely on labor with the contraction tracker with BOTH of my kids! AND has helped me with everything from breastfeeding tips, knowing that‚Äôs it‚Äôs ok that it didn‚Äôt work for me long term but short term was ok too. Helped me get my kids on a schedule (feeding and napping), helped remind me when they can start eating solids remind me to take their monthly pics (bc I know lots of tired mommas forget ü§∑üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è everyday runs together lol) helped me with my picky eaters. Helped me with my PPD.  EVEN helped me put the spark back in my relationship The articles go on and on! Definitely the best download!

title: Great resource
body: Just want to say Thank you . I appreciate all your help, guidance, and  resources. The community is supportive , positive and interactive. I have been here for 10 years but it stops at age 8. We still need help!! Haha would like to see the advice continue through teenage years. There is no rule book for parenting but to be able to know what your experience is not ‚Äúcrazy or far out there‚Äù is SO reassuring. Again thank you for getting me through the stages!

title: Baby number 2
body: I used this app 8 years ago when I was pregnant with my daughter and I loved the updates. I love how if I have any questions about my symptoms of what might be going on with me it helps me find solutions. With baby number 2 it was the same way and it has helped me so much because there is literally so much I had forgotten about what I did 8 years ago when she was a baby. It‚Äôs like a new learning experience and this app has yet again helped me find solutions and keep track of my growing baby! Will definitely use in the future again and again with my future babies.

title: Every question or concern answered!
body: I love ‚Äòbaby center‚Äô. I use it mainly for the message boards. Even as a third time mom I still find myself with questions and concerns about my little girl. I just home on her birth message board and either get answers or someone who has gone through the same thing or similar. It has really helped me along the way and I learn so much. I love getting advice for new products before I go spend money on something that could be a fluke. I‚Äôve used baby center for three pregnancies and three babies now and will continue to use it until I don‚Äôt need to anymore!

title: Huge help!
body: After finding out I was pregnant I downloaded a bunch of baby apps to see which would help the most.  This app has exceeded my expectations!  It had articles and discussions on topics that would be helpful to me depending on how pregnant I was.  And then our LO came and it has been a big help guiding us as to what to expect, suggestions on things to do.  It's great.  Best part is it's free.  Only downside is sometimes there are helpful video tips but they won't play.  Or I'm trying to watch while breastfeeding but there aren't any captions so I can't watch it to after.  But by then I've forgotten about it.

title: Great place for information
body: While I was pregnant with my daughter and after having her when I had a question it seemed that one of the top websites for answers was this app. There is a lot of useful information here for questions and just things that I didn‚Äôt know. It was fun using it while I was pregnant to see how the baby was growing. I encourage people to use the apps inside the app like the growth tracker and the bump gallery. It was nice to see how my daughter was measuring up once we started taking her to her wellness visits. I have recommended this app to other pregnant women I know and they have all liked it.

title: Great informative app
body: This app has been updating me ever since the middle of my pregnancy. My baby is now 10 months old and I feel like every week I know a little bit better how to challenge her and I learn a little bit more about what she might be going through. It‚Äôs nice to eliminate the guessing game when it comes to why she might be fussy, or what activities I should be doing with her. I also learned a lot about different milestones, And a lot of my questions were answered about feeding and solids before I even had to ask anyone. This app is a must for anyone who‚Äôs pregnant, and raising a baby!

title: First time mom approved!
body: I am a first time mom and I downloaded this app when a friend suggested it to me. It was so informational and made my pregnancy go so much smoother. It has great information that really applies to worries or concerns that you have during pregnancy. It also has great articles, tips/tricks, and advice as you go along in your pregnancy. The contraction timer is wonderful and this is the one thing that made me realize we needed to head to the hospital!!

title: Used to be the best app before updating
body: I used this app three years ago with my first pregnancy and just downloaded it again for my second. Shortly after entering my data, the app was updated and has a completely different format. Everything fun has been taken away from it- all of the fun polls and informational articles that I would be so excited to read everyday. Now the app has barely any info on it, other than the size of your baby week by week, which you can only check once a week, obviously. The app crashes on me all the time now and has locked me out several times. Such a bummer. This was my favorite app the first time, now I barely check this one and I‚Äôve had to download other apps to get the same sense of excitement and info for this second baby. Please go back to the original!!

title: Great app, just not many changes from my first baby in 2013 to now in 2019
body: Love this app and it‚Äôs helpful information! Love the update alerts when I hit a new week. Also the community board is awesome with lots of helpful information. Only thing I wish is that it had more updates so that it‚Äôs not like I‚Äôm reading the same thing from 6 years ago when I was pregnant with my son. Now on my third baby it would be nice to offer a bit more. I don‚Äôt think much has changed in the 6 years. I used it with all three of my kids in 2013, 2015, and this year. But I have to say I‚Äôve tried other apps and for a free app this one is the best in my opinion.

title: I truly love this app
body: It‚Äôs been tracking the development of my baby since I conceived. It let me know what to expect during my pregnancy as it progressed and it tracked the progress of my babies growth in the womb as well. It answered questions about my daughter‚Äôs development before I even asked them. It kept up with her age and told me what I should expect as each month passed even after I already had her. She is now 7 months old and I couldn‚Äôt imagine not having this app. I wake up to a monthly development report on what to expect from my baby according to her current age. Nothing but love.

title: Gave me what to expect step by step!
body: I LOVE this app! I learned more from it than my OBGYN and this app gave me such piece of mind. I was able to find out what symptoms were normal and which ones to be concerned about (as much as possible with how different pregnancies are) as well as educating myself on the birthing process and other helpful tips given by the app!

title: Very educational
body: I‚Äôve been using this app for almost 7 years since the birth of my first baby. I‚Äôve since had a second and I still find this app helpful. The weekly emails are just right to keep me up to date on each of my kiddos‚Äô development.

title: Glitchy
body: When I found out I was pregnant, I was thrilled. I found this app and signed up, put in my projected due date, and loved all the information and tips that this app gave me. Unfortunately I had a miscarriage, so I choose the option of "loss of child." Since then, I cannot go back into the app. When I open the app, a prompt comes up for new child - I can either choose a due date or click trying to conceive. I click trying to conceive as I am not currently pregnant, and the app closes itself out. I tried deleting the app and redownloading it, but it does the same thing. It's annoying because I want the advice and articles, etc. on TTC and other things. Guess I'll just stick with The Bump App.

title: I can‚Äôt imagine a better app.
body: Held my hand from when I found out my wife was pregnant until 4 months after birth (and seemingly beyond). I thought the pregnancy tracker and associated advice was great, and figured it would end once our son was born. I was pleasantly surprised when the app converted to a child development tracker that presents great advice and information.

title: Hilarious content/Snarky non pregnant lifers
body: Pretty good app. What really gets me is the awful name suggestions and can‚Äôt be real articles like ‚ÄúHow to name baby in 64 easy steps ‚Äú. 64 steps? Easy? üòÇ

title: Stop searching: this is the app you want
body: The app is fantastic. I used this for my first pregnancy and it was great. If you‚Äôre scouting out apps, this one is user friendly and you can stop your hunt. The community and questions that other moms have made me feel part of a ‚Äúmom tribe‚Äù and included; I was not going through it alone. I asked questions and received supportive answers (specifically struggled with hemorrhoids, pelvic dysfunction, even info on a pillow cover for my preggy pillow and got fantastic recommendations, guidance and responses) The weekly updates (baby/mama) are spot on and something to look forward to.

title: Lee-Lee‚Äôs pregnancy
body: I‚Äôm in love with the baby center I was 42 yrs old when I got pregnant for the 6th time my last pregnancy was 10 years ago so I was scared and not just confused but I wanted to make sure because of my age I was having a healthy pregnancy and baby the symptoms I was having the baby center helped me to be content with I had my baby at age 43 he is a month old now and I still use the baby center he‚Äôs healthy and strong and the baby center is still helping me now he‚Äôs here I can‚Äôt wait to use this app for my child until I can‚Äôt I do love it and recommend it to the world thank you üòäüòòüíïü•∞üòéüòçüôèüèæ

title: Not what it used to be
body: This app is not what it used to be and I am frustrated enough to write a review.

title: Great features (contraction counter, kick counter, etc.)
body: This app is really amazing. I love all the information you can get that is all backed by legitimate sources or clearly labeled if it is written by a parent contributor. The tools are my favorite part.

title: The app that has everything
body: I started only using this app to gain knowledge of how my baby was growing and his development in the the womb as well as what changes I could expect along the way. It has so much more though! I was able to keep track of my ‚Äúbump photos‚Äù and create a sweet slideshow super easily through the app, there was a kick tracker, contraction timer and a simple brith plan maker that had you answer questions about your birth plan and make any comments that it compiles into a pdf for you! Love this app so much-it‚Äôs easy to use and multi functional. So glad I found it!

title: Amazing App!
body: I love this App! It give simple but free at information for mamas. I love that each we during my pregnancy it updated me with information and tips. When I first found out I was pregnant I was overwhelmed by all of

title: Infant loss awareness
body: I love the app. It‚Äôs perfect.. But I had lost my daughter back in September at 21 weeks and I had a hard time deleting it I just couldn‚Äôt do it. But This is the time she was supposed to be due an I wish I had the option to put on here that we lost her. Maybe put an option to set something for mother‚Äôs who have lost one & give them information on how to go on with life after losing a baby and etc.. . Instead of coming on here to see what you‚Äôre baby should be at üò¢üíî someone like me couldn‚Äôt delete the app I still want to keep an remember the memories of being pregnant with her.  But others might have a hard time. But other than that this app is great thank you.

title: Love it!!
body: This app was really useful during my pregnancy. It was very easy to use and understand, the articles were helpful and informative, and I liked that it had polls that you could participate in so you knew if other moms were going through the same thing. The articles and the polls were really reassuring especially since this is my first baby and I wasn't quite sure what was normal and what I should be worried about. I also liked how it told you how the baby is growing AND how your life is changing every week. All in all I loved this app! Definitely great for first time moms!

title: Best app for Pre, during, and post pregnancy.
body: This app contains all the information that I need. I relied on it several times for information. It helped me to track my pregnancy, how far a long I was, what I was possibly going through, get ready for what was coming ahead. Even after pregnancy, there is a sequence to this app. What to expect for the first year appointments (what you‚Äôll be ask at the appointment, vaccines baby will be needing), what to do when baby is not feeling well and possible reasons, how to prepare your baby‚Äôs bag supplies, how to burp your baby, how to nurse, etc., etc., etc., it goes on.

title: 1st time mom -8 months in!
body: I absolutely love reading the articles that Baby Center has available. Whenever I have a question and unable to get to my pediatrician b/c after hours, I login to my BabyCenter app and just search up what I am looking for. The video clips are brief and informative which I like especially if I am in need of a quick answer or the little one requires my immediate attention. Great job app developers and editors with the flow and appearance of the information. You have really assisted me in these several months of my baby‚Äôs life and during my pregnancy too! Thank you!

title: App itself is Great. But not supportive AT ALL.
body: This app is awesome! But only for the Information about your baby weekly. I love the weekly growth scale and how it show what your body is doing. But for anyone looking for a supportive group of people to answer First time mom questions and so on I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS APP. Most of the people on here are Very rude and so quick to judge on questions of other people. They are very option driven and seem to only have one sided beliefs. Coming from a young first time mom I was scared to even ask anything on this app due to most the people comments on others being extremely rude and judgement driven. Not everyone one believes the same and a different variety of questions should be ok.

title: First time mom , Great app , Very Relatable
body: Any Questions about being a new mother or the things that I was experiencing, I was able to find answers and actually give feedback from this app from mothers just like me who either have done this before or who are in a later stage of their pregnancy who already had the answers that I‚Äôm looking for is just a big community of women who get together and encourage each other every day about their pregnancy and who support each other through everything that they go through pertaining to pregnancies and I really appreciate that.

title: Obsessed
body: This app is so amazing. I‚Äôm a first time mom and had no idea what I was doing or where to start. It‚Äôs very informative and sends me updates everyday. Also being able to see how my baby is growing and being able to compare it to fruit etc is cool too. It shares the do‚Äôs and do nots. Has a place where you can write down notes so you remember for your doctor. I love this app and so does my husband. My husband loves it because he learns cool tips for himself and can read along and get to know more with me. They have sections for me, for him, and if you‚Äôre having TWINS. Overall great app, plus it‚Äôs free!

title: Best pregnancy app
body: I have tried other apps for tracking ovulation, pregnancy and postpartum needs. This one is, by far, my fave. Love how organized it is- very easy to find the information you are looking for. They have a section where you can keep all your bump pictures and put little stickers with the fruit/vegetable for that week.

title: Absolutely love this app
body: Being a first time mom, I was extremely nervous. I have no idea what I‚Äôm doing. Honestly I‚Äôm winging it half the time. Having this app through my pregnancy and continuing to use it even after my daughter was born has help me so much. When I‚Äôm unsure about something I look it up in the app. The app gives frequent updates on what babies around your child‚Äôs age does. And if we decide to have more than one child it allows you to add more kids. If you‚Äôre unsure just download it and give it a try. There are so many different features that come in handy.

title: 4th times a charm
body: Love this app, I have used it with each of my pregnancies/children and am using it now on my fourth pregnancy. It is easy to follow and keep track of the weeks going by. It even helps me remember to schedule things as I go, especially with multiple kids sometimes things fall through the cracks so a reminder is nice to have! Also reminders of what‚Äôs ok and what‚Äôs not during pregnancy is great too. I love sending screenshots of the little updates to my husband occasionally. Solid app, I wouldn‚Äôt use anything else for pregnancy tracking that is for sure.

title: Age of my kids
body: I have two kiddos and am currently pregnant. When I click on my daughters name (Paris) who is one years old, it says her birthday is listed as June 8th. I‚Äôve already corrected it to June 3rd, she just turned a year old. It keeps saying June 8th at the top and is saying she is 11 months and 4 weeks. When I click on my daughter Addys profile, it displays Paris‚Äô age but the accurate birthday.. The only one that is accurate is the pregnancy profile.

title: This is for you
body: This app was for me when I was pregnant with my first kid, it's for me now on my second, it'll be for me on my third as well. I get excited when I get to a new week and any question I have or anything I want to vent about to other people experiencing the same things, this app helped me get free offers and samples from different sites I never knew about, this app got me a free car seat AND breast pump through my insurance! I absolutely love baby center, the kick tracker is awesome, the contraction timer is amazing to have, and it even has a place to take selfies with you and your bump :)

title: Love this app!
body: As a FTM I am super excited to be pregnant and having this app has made it feel a lot more real for me. I really like that everyday you see 4 or 5 articles or facts about your baby so you know exactly what's happening in every stage of your pregnancy. I also loved the Birth Club part of the app, I joined and was able to talk to lots of great people whose due date was the same month as mine. It's nice to have people that can relate to whatever you're going through and to answer all of the questions you have. Would definitely recommend this app to any expecting mom!!

title: BabyCenter App
body: Awesome little daily updates. I wasn‚Äôt really looking forward to having a baby even after I found out I was pregnant. This app has helped me to become a little more excited, and understand what exactly is going on with the changes in my body. I‚Äôm just really hoping it‚Äôs a boy now. Either way I pray to God I have a healthy baby!

title: Love it.
body: This app has made my first pregnancy fly by so quickly and easily. I can get on and read about my pregnancy weekly, and daily! Usually whatever I‚Äôm struggling with other pregnant mothers are too! And there are options here that allow you to chat with other mothers about the SAME thing you‚Äôre going through or feeling! And what a comfort that is when I don‚Äôt exactly know what I‚Äôm expecting while expecting. What a brilliant idea for an app!

title: 5 stars!
body: This app was so helpful during my pregnancy by giving me a play by play of what was going on with me (internally & externally) & with my growing baby. The pictures, videos, tips, & information about the entire process was beneficial to my learning as a first-time Mom & to my husband.

title: Great app but the newest update loses desired features
body: I love this app for tracking pregnancy. It is so nice to get information and to just have a tracker to see where you are in your pregnancy.

title: Loved the app before the update
body: Great information. Love the group chats and all the valuable information. Really lets you know a lot of the things you experience are normal or odd and everyone is different but alot of the stoires and things they have for daily reads are really cool. Only thing i dont like is that there is a lot pf repetitive information.

title: Baby #3! After 8 years üòç
body: I love using this babycenter app! Especially since we‚Äôre having baby number 3 after 8 years! Our first 2 are 15 months apart 9 yr old and an 8 yr old so everything with our second kid was a breeze. You forget what to do and you forget how it is after such a long time, it‚Äôs like starting all over again. I get so excited when it‚Äôs the start of a new week and I get to see how my body is changing and how baby is growing. I would definitely recommend using this for first time mothers, even if this is your 3rd kid.

title: Don‚Äôt have a lot of free time so this is perfect
body: I don‚Äôt have a lot of free time so I live how quick and easy this is to use. Now I work in health care but OB has never been my area. So I love the quick highlights and key points. As someone who has to provide education to patients I think this app does a great job making it understandable for everyone. I also love the fact that it is pretty consistent with the information my OB office gives me. But because this app breaks down by weeks it pinpoints changes on a weekly basis versus my doctors office giving a monthly highlight.

title: Absolutely fantastic!
body: I love Babycenter!! I‚Äôve used it with all of my pregnancies and have enjoyed watching my baby grow to the size of the veggies and fruits they compare them too! They also have tons of amazing articles on every topic imaginable regarding babies, relationships, and everything in between! My favorite part is the discussion boards where you can ask questions and get answers from real moms experiencing the same things you‚Äôre going through and being able to provide answers to other moms that are worried or just checking up!

title: Best pre and post pregnancy app ever!!
body: Thank you to the founder and admins for your great job. When I discovered I was preggy last year, I added plenty of apps related to pregnancy and baby. Day by day I started deleting the rest and I kept only baby center and another app that helps tracks my breastfeeding/changing diaper/sleep time of my baby. When you have a baby you don't have so much time to read and fool around, baby center has short, clear articles and sometimes some videos too. Absolutely great and already recommended it to couples of my preggy friends. :-)

title: Great educational information!
body: I have loved BabyCenter's information from the very beginning. What grabbed my attention was when I saw a friend using it & I loved how it would show her comparisons of her fetus growing to fruits and vegetables. When I began my account I would love going to the grocery store to see how big my baby was getting each week. Also, I read a lot of helpful information and tips along with great educational videos. My baby is now 3 months old and I continue to appreciate & look forward to all the educational tips I can find within BabyCenter.

title: It‚Äôs perfect
body: This is the perfect app.. can‚Äôt complain about anything .. I highly suggest this app ESPECIALLY first time moms .. it has helped me ALOT and it‚Äôs very useful and helpful and it has so many tools and insights and can answer any questions you have .. it has bumpie selfie where u can see your belly grow by taking pictures every week it has kick counting, name options, tips, tracks ur pregnancy and shows u how big ur baby is every week it‚Äôs the best app I have found and it‚Äôs free .. completely free even in the app u don‚Äôt have to pay anything very thankful to have found this

title: Very informative for new mommies
body: I just started using the app a few days ago when I confirmed my pregnancy with my doctor and I‚Äôm no longer as scared as I was initially. I am so happy that I found this app. They have a variety of everything! They even have a forum for support groups for new mums ü§ç I‚Äôm able to track my baby‚Äôs growth/progress and even name my baby with them name pool they have. I‚Äôm so full & grateful!!! It‚Äôs almost like having a little automated helper. Between this and my affirmations app, I feel so much better about my pregnancy as a first time mom. Thank you BC üôèüèæü§ç

title: Great app!
body: This app is really cool! It gives you tons of information about pregnancy and what to expect. It tells you what symptoms you could be experiencing and how your baby is growing each week. I have not thought to try another app at all. The best part is that you get put into a group of people that are due the same month as you. It‚Äôs really fun to ask questions and relate to others. If you have any worries just text all the girls. People also respond really quick with their honest opinions. I love this app and everything it supplies! I HIGHLY Recommend it!

title: I‚Äôm STILL using this app!
body: My daughter is currently 3yrs old (going on 31) and I STILL use this app! Granted you get ‚Äúkicked off‚Äù the app once your child turns 1, BUT, that is Not where the knowledge and articles stop. I find myself constantly referring to this app/site whenever I have a question about my little one and Good or Bad there is an article about it! You have yourself a bitter? There‚Äôs an article about that, retrograding potty training, there‚Äôs an article on that, little one getting Sassy?? THERES A FREAKING ARTICLE ON IT! Not to add it helped me so much throughout my pregnancy. Best Baby App Hands down.

title: Very helpful & informative, especially new moms!
body: Everytime I‚Äôm thinking of what‚Äôs next with my baby, all I have to do is check my email and there it is, an article with so many helpful tips. It‚Äôs like this application knows what I‚Äôm thinking, sometimes before. It follows what my baby might need or is going through according to his age range. It has been very informative in basic & non-basic topics, it has also made me aware & knowledgeable of a variety of subjects to discuss with my baby‚Äôs pediatrician. I‚Äôve been already recommending to family & friends. This is GREAT!

title: Love it
body: I have used this app since 2012 when I got pregnant with my first child and I love it . I love how one can connect with other moms delivering around the same time , tracking and discussing baby growth before and after they are born . I love different groups and forums one can join based on their requirements and interest . I love the updates we get from the baby center app about baby‚Äôs growth . You have chances to win prizes from time to time when there are contest, lucky draws and such interesting stuff . In short I love everything about this app.

title: This was the best app for my pregnancy, and is the best for following my baby after birth!
body: The app followed my son throughout my ENTIRE pregnancy. It was awesome because it showed me how my baby, and how he was developing, what he looked like. It also gave me advice to read into about my pregnancy, birth, a birth plan, aftercare, everything. And now that my son is 9 months old; it still follows him and his development. It still gives me advice on milestones, and how to interact with him, how to help his development by playing with him in different ways, and how to introduce him to new things. I love, love, LOVE this app!!

title: The best for pregnancy and beyond
body: As a FTM, this has been a huge help for me as it helps me not get overwhelmed with all the things I need to know about the changes in my body and the growth of my baby. I  love that it gives me information relevant to each week. Being entertained while learning from other moms in the birth clubs is another thing. This is the only app I use all throughout my pregnancy and I plan to keep it even after giving birth to my dear child since it has more to it than just a weekly description of what the baby looks like.

title: Love it...but...
body: I have had this app my entire pregnancy this time around, and I love it...HOWEVER we are having twins and although it has a lot of articles/ideas for twin pregnancies-room ideas etc. things like where it asks what you are having and we are having one of each but that isn‚Äôt an option gets frustrating sometimes :/ I‚Äôve found this true about a lot of registries and such too, they only give you the option of choosing boy-girl-or don‚Äôt know/it‚Äôs a surprise...love the app but my suggestion would be to add where you can have more options for parents expecting multiples!!

title: Must have for all pregnant women and moms
body: This app provides informative videos and posts that are extremely timely. Throughout my pregnancy I will receive notifications a day or two before or after I‚Äôve noticed a change in my body and am wondering if it‚Äôs normal, related to the pregnancy or what‚Äôs going on.

title: Useful tips and articles
body: I love this app for a lot of reasons. As a healthcare professional I have been trained in child development but what I like about this is how it cues you week by week with some developmental guidelines as well as play that reinforces this development. It also provides great articles from reputable resources on a variety of topics from sleep to teaching/exposing your child to the good habit of brushing their teeth. It‚Äôs a nice tool and resource that helps and without being so long winded that you get lost in the articles etc. Speaking of long winded... :) just get the app!

title: Great App
body: I‚Äôve used this app for all four of my children and I love it! The daily info throughout pregnancy is helpful and keeps me excited about our sweet bundle on the way. I also like that the info doesn‚Äôt stop once baby is born. I get emails and updates about my children‚Äôs development and milestones that I enjoy reading. Sometimes it‚Äôs simple reminders to stop and smell the roses with your kiddos before they‚Äôre grown, sometimes it‚Äôs about psychological development, and sometimes it‚Äôs sweet activities to do with your little ones. I think it‚Äôs the best app out there.

title: Inlove with this app
body: Have no idea how I went through my first pregnancy without this app. I have been using this app for about a year now my baby girl is almost 2months. Love this app. Have questions or want to relate to others yes your in a group of women that are due the same month as you.

title: Lots of great information
body: The only things I‚Äôd change are

title: Great !
body: Okay so y‚Äôall have to get this app ! I‚Äôm only 7 weeks pregnant but I love this app so much ! It gives you information on what the baby looks like each week, what the baby looks like inside you, and it gives you symptoms it in tips how you can fix the symptoms like if you have morning sickness !So overall when I‚Äôm trying to say is I highly recommend this app for you to get if you‚Äôre going through any stage of pregnancy you just put in your due date and then boom in tracks your pregnancy and everything is just so great!

title: Best pregnancy tracker!
body: This is the second time I‚Äôm using this app for my pregnancy and I love it so much! They give you helpful tips and also provide pictures of how your little one is growing inside. I love that it keeps track of the week and days you‚Äôre on. It also counts down how many days you have left till your due date! I‚Äôm really bad with keeping track of things on my own so this app helped so much with keeping track on my pregnancy. I highly recommend using this app. It‚Äôs also very simple to use and well organized.

title: The latest update rendered this app unusable
body: I‚Äôve been a member of the website for over 15 years.  In the past, I accessed it through my web browser because that was more convenient for me.  After the ‚Äúupdate‚Äù, the site would no longer work on my browser, so I had to download this app to continue to have access.  The app is so slow and difficult to navigate, it is no longer worth it to try and use.  It drains my phone battery, so if I‚Äôm not plugged it, I can only use it for about 15-20 minutes.  It is painfully slow and many times takes you to a different link than the one you clicked on. There is no way to bookmark or save your place in threads you are reading, and it starts over from the beginning when you click out.

title: Excellent!
body: Great tips and info the whole pregnancy and after the baby is born. The layout is very nice and easy to navigate. I loved the kick counter and contraction tracking features. These came in so handy.

title: Best baby app ever
body: I love how it helps you track your pregnancy and have step to step different articles on the stages of each week. What you should more or less be feeling or what things will change for you and also ask for your opinion on surveys. Which is awesome because some people do feel like they are the only ones going through all these changes and they are not. Which is helpful to anyone and the best part it gives you an idea on how big your baby is growing and what is developing in the baby.

title: The easiest and most informative app
body: Thoughout my whole pregnancy this app has helped me with everything! From what to expect in each week of pregnancy and as well has lists that they have created for us moms to go over for us to prepare for our baby‚Äôs arrival. Especially since we can post on a wall about any questions or news we‚Äôd like to share with other moms who can definitely help out in either supporting or helping you with any questions or anything you have in mind. 100% recommend this app for all mommies ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Potential to illicit fear and make us over cautious
body: We have used this app each week to see how big our baby is, but that is about all I could handle. Each time I look on there, there are articles written by random people suggesting that we not take hot showers, listen to loud music, or do anything adventurous. I‚Äôve lived in fear for some of these months and gone straight to my doctors to ask about each one, which they squashed and gave us the truth about. This app is a sort of culmination of info making us over-protective and a place for everyone to share their own personal experiences and advice about everything (I won‚Äôt bother commenting on the Birth club). The intention to help moms is great, but some of this info made us paranoid.

title: A parents quick guide to babies
body: This app is amazing.  It has developmental information on your baby as they grow so that you will quickly know generalizations on what and when to expect behaviors.  There is quick information sent to you on a weekly basis and daily articles sent each day.  The app is smooth and I‚Äôve experienced no glitches.  I‚Äôve used this same app for all my pregnancies/babies.  Not to mention the camaraderie you gain when you join your birth month groups...  this app is extremely useful!

title: Good But Can Be Annoying
body: This App is very informative. However DO NOT opt In on the (free/discounted) emails. 9 times out of 10 it‚Äôs just junk and just spams up your email. The deals are never that great and so far I haven‚Äôt seen any emails for free products. Still this app has some nice features like a ‚Äúkick tracker‚Äù among other cool things. You can also ask questions and usually a few other moms will help give some pretty good advice. HOWEVER there are bugs in this App as in I open my app then it randomly closes out while I use it. It also has closed out on me EVERY time I try to add a picture of my kid on the app.

title: Helpful
body: I loved having this throughout my pregnancy and even now after having my baby! It was so nice to be able to see how my baby was growing week by week when I was pregnant and also the tips, tricks, symptoms that are common throughout pregnancy.

title: Great resource for new and veteran parents
body: The articles provided by baby center help new parents know and understand what to except with their baby. For old parents like me, it help me remember things that I forgot or actually never learned when I had my first child. My favorite part of the app is the community center. I am able to ask questions that I can‚Äôt ask my mom and intimate friends. Questions about intimacy with my spouse after delivery. Since the mother do not know me or my spouse their can provided honest and partial responses.

title: super helpful
body: This is my second pregnancy and as soon as I found out I downloaded the app. The first time around we used it to educate ourselves in addition to classes about our baby. We read the articles instead of books and I feel like we were very well prepared, if not more had we just read books. I like how it guides you week by week.

title: Amazing!
body: I am only on week 10 of my first pregnancy, with all of the uncertainty this app has been life changing!!!!! I feel like I have a friend that understands me üòä I also appreciate all of the education I‚Äôm learning about my body and baby. I had NO IDEA most of this. I think you are just so excited to get pregnant you don‚Äôt consider the other pieces until they are happening. This app has been my first resource in learning! I would recommend this to any mama on her pregnancy journey! I even share elements with my husband as he should know too üòÅ

title: Wonderful App
body: This has been a wonderful app to use. From trying to conceive (TTC), to having a miscarriage (MC), and then to getting my big fat positive (BFP) again! BabyCenter has so many support groups on here and women who have been through similar situations no matter what you‚Äôre going through. I love all the new features that help me keep up with this pregnancy as well! They have a selfie or ‚ÄúBumpie‚Äù for each new week you‚Äôre pregnant that helps you keep up with your body‚Äôs growth as well as weekly updates on your baby‚Äôs growth. Thank you BabyCenter!!

title: One Stop Shop Resource!
body: As a first-time mom-to-be, I have a zillion questions, and some I didn't even know I had until using this app.  I love the way it helps track my progress, and how I can see each week how my baby is developing. Between that, all the helpful articles and videos, and forums to either participate in or simply read, I really can't recommend this app enough.  When I miscarried earlier this year, the app even had a nice sensitive option to memorialize the child's profile, rather than delete it.

title: Deserves 5+ stars!
body: This app is incredible for all types of moms- new, experienced, young, single, etc.. When I got pregnant with my son, this app taught me so much that I never would‚Äôve known. Being pregnant at 18 was scary, but using this app to connect with other young moms made me feel better. When I found out I was pregnant with my daughter I immediately re-downloaded this app! I‚Äôve learned all kinds of new stuff this time around and I think that speaks volumes as to how great they are about updating it. Definitely a must have for any mom!! Thanks Babycenter!!

title: Glitchy
body: The information posted on the weekly updates on baby‚Äôs growth is alright. Some of the resources and tips are useful, so that part alone would be a 4 star. Some of the information is obvious or not very interesting. The forums are really buggy and have been for at least a month. There have been updates, but it seems only more problems arise. The community on the forums needs more censoring because some women use the app to pick on others, which gives Baby Center a bad reputation. The forums and glitches are so bad that I considered giving the app a 2 star. I agree with another who said the app is not formatted well for phones.

title: Gender specific
body: I‚Äôll be honest. It‚Äôs a great app. But what I find to be really annoying is that the articles are very gender specific. ‚ÄúSHE will grow like this‚Äù ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt let HER do that, SHE should be doing this instead.‚Äù Not all women give birth to little girls. The articles shouldn‚Äôt be gender specific. You could easily describe the child as ‚ÄúYour baby, They learn like this, they will reach this milestone...‚Äù it can make the articles more relatable. I have nothing against baby girls and I‚Äôm not being sexist but it does get kind of irritating that whoever writes the articles, doesn‚Äôt even consider having little boys in mind. Or how about this. Don‚Äôt be gender specific at all. Make the articles relatable to parents in general. Parents of little girls AND little boys.

title: My favorite site to recommend
body: This site is my favorite site to recommend to any parent. With the updates on our child‚Äôs development, coming from sound resources, I feel very on top of it as a mom. I have three kids, an 8 year old, 5.5 yr old and a newborn and i still find this site useful!!

title: Useful and great guidance
body: I enjoy using this app to help me get useful tips and tricks on how to care for my baby. As a single mom, I felt lost at times and that I wasn‚Äôt fit, but BabyCenter was able to help give me facts, information, articles, videos, and so much other resources that I was confident enough to feel and know that the tactics would work. Of course each baby varies, but most of them worked! I highly recommend to any new parent or even seasoned parents to download the app for guidance and new ways to care for your child!

title: Great App
body: Baby Center is the perfect app for ALL moms. Whether this is your first time, or it‚Äôs been some years since your last baby. Baby center will help in tracking milestones in your pregnancy and years after. The ability to connect with moms from all over the world is also a great plus to the app if someone is questioning anything other moms can chime in to offer help. The entire app is a great resource that isn‚Äôt too pushy and it has helped me for the last 5 years with tracking my oldest, to now tracking my 2020 baby!

title: Birth Month Boards Make a Great Community
body: The main reason I use this app is so that I can connect with moms around the world who are due the same month as me. Especially in the early days when it was too early to tell friends and family, I had a community to rely on who would celebrate the small but significant milestones with me. Especially during COVID, this app has allowed me access to making friends and bonding with other moms that I would not have safely been able to do otherwise. Download it. You won‚Äôt regret it.

title: Very informative!
body: Baby center was like the Duala I could not afford. This app was with me the entire Step of the way during my pregnancy and now as a mom it is still here for me. Every week/day I get a tip on how to aid in my child‚Äôs development from interactive games to simple texture observation. I absolutely appreciate Baby Center for having so much information for us new moms, old moms and soon to be moms! I truly don‚Äôt know if I would‚Äôve done as well transitioning into mother hood if it weren‚Äôt for the tips and live discussions you can have with other new moms.

title: Should be no stars for recent update
body: Love the community, have been using it for years as a support lifeline after baby loss. The recent update with font changes and then the Babycenter staff and programmers sticking with this horrible font is sad because I read how people can‚Äôt function while reading because it causes eye strain, migraines and other issues with people with disabilities. I myself don‚Äôt have problems immediately but I can‚Äôt spend as much time as I used to because the words start floating all over the page. People as mass leaving their groups, Group owners can‚Äôt monitor their groups because of the above problems and no one is making any strides in making changes to a different font. Please Babycenter, don‚Äôt erode my online support group!

title: The app is okay but community is a henhouse at best
body: If you‚Äôre looking for a forum for community support from other mothers or moms to be, you are better off asking a random toll booth worker than going to this mother‚Äôs forum site. It‚Äôs full of know-it-all women that have had kids and feel like they‚Äôre the authority on all things mother... with kind and helpful souls peppered in between. It‚Äôs mostly a sounding board for bored petty stay at home mothers that have nothing else better to do (though they could be somewhere offline seeing about their child) and would rather troll boards looking for new moms to harass. It‚Äôs an awful, unregulated by Baby Center Community board leaders and is a chicken coop at bestüôÑ. Save your time. Talk to yourself in the mirror or ask Siri, at least she might be polite. üëéüëéüëé

title: Mommy of two üíì
body: This was my first full term pregnancy & by surprise it was with twins. Being pregnant with one child was already an emotional thought but with TWO?! I felt overwhelmed & a tad bit fearful. I found this app which relieved me of every concern I could possibly think of as a new mother. Every article I came across was extremely informative & put my nerves to ease. It helped me throughout my entire pregnancy & even now that my babies are two months old. Definitely recommend for any new moms to be & even those who already have children!

title: Amazing app!! Love it
body: Gives great weekly updates about the growth of the baby. Also has plenty of helpful tips, healthy eating ideas/ habits, greatly detailed articles about the processes and changes your going through, helpful websites and sources for giveaways and the cheapest ways to get what you need to provide for your child. Has online forums to talk to other mums about your issues for advice and different tools such as a kick counter and a contraction timer as well. I love this app and it‚Äôs been so helpful throughout my pregnancy. 10/10

title: Great but the forums are catty!
body: I loved this app its so informative my advice would be if you download use it for the wonderful information and don‚Äôt bother with the forums! I‚Äôve seen new moms get attacked for asking ‚Äúdumb‚Äù questions I stuck up for one poster and got attacked lol on top of them taking advantage of how you report people misusing the app so i was reprimanded for it while for a month straight this woman was repeatedly bullied there‚Äôs definitely a mean girl forum going on and people seeking comfort shouldn‚Äôt have to deal with that! And I‚Äôd say to whomever monitors these posts do a better job at cracking down on rude people instead of singling out the people that tried to help I‚Äôm disgusted!

title: Great Pregnancy App
body: I have downloaded other apps to track my pregnancy and just find this to be the most practical and informative.  They have so much information you can find to help you along the way.  I haven‚Äôt even used it to the full extent and like that you aren‚Äôt prompted to do more or less.  I use it for me, but you can use it to find a community of people with your close due date, etc.  This app helps me find deals on baby items and tells me what to expect, plus more!  I highly recommend,

title: Love it
body: I‚Äôm a first time mom and I am one of the youngest in my family so I didn‚Äôt grow up around babies or women who were having babies. That being said I didn‚Äôt know WHAT I was supposed to to, what was normal, what wasn‚Äôt normal, etc so I downloaded this app. I love the tracking feature that goes day by day and it gives you new articles to read every week. For some reason it makes me feel like the time is going by faster, just doing a little research everyday, and they‚Äôre helping me to get prepared for my baby üòä

title: 4 kids later!
body: Since 2013, I have had four beautiful children & and Baby Center helped me as much or as little as I needed/ or have wanted. From the moment I became pregnant ( each time) to this date I get updates and milestone reminders for each of them. Through tears  and laughs from the articles and feedback from other moms, and my own obsessive charting  in baby center, I can say this tool has been one of THE best apps I have. Thanks for the time and effort you all put in to help parents from beginning and beyond!

title: AMAZING resource throughout pregnancy and baby‚Äôs 1st year
body: I highly recommend this app to parents‚Äîparticularly first time parent‚Äîand soon-to-be parents. Babycenter offers credible medical, social, emotional, behavioral, and adaptive skills information that can help you to make the most informed decisions for you and your baby. Although the week-by-week articles end at baby‚Äôs 1st year, information about children in the first 5 years (at least!) can be found in the indicated domains (e.g., medical, etc). I hope you all find this app as useful as I have üòÅ

title: Enjoying app, not the emails
body: Enjoying the app for the most part but I cannot believe how many emails I‚Äôve gotten. And yes, I unsubscribed but it took time. At anything before 20 weeks I don‚Äôt want to be bothered with registry info every day. Or cord blood. This might really overwhelm some first time moms. Enough is going on already.

title: LOVE!
body: I‚Äôm a first time mommy and my sister forced me to download it since it gives so much detail and now I‚Äôm obsessed with it! I always check it, it sends me notifications every time I gain a new week. I‚Äôm 21 so I‚Äôm still younger and it‚Äôs very clear about everything that‚Äôs happening to me and it helps me understand my baby more! I‚Äôm so glad I downloaded it! I love how it compares my babies size to everyday items and shows how my stomachs growing and gives articles that are short and help me with things im dealing with that week! Highly recommend!

title: This app is amazing!!!
body: I really have enjoyed using this app through my pregnancy. I‚Äôve had so many questions answered just by using this app instead of searching the web. I love how I can get an idea of what my baby may look like each week. This app is amazing!!! Thank you guys so much! From learning about symptoms, to packing my hospital bag, and even learning how to time my contractions I‚Äôve gained so much knowledge from all the great information you guys put into this app. I will definitely recommend this app to all of my pregnant friends.‚ò∫Ô∏è

title: Good to have, very informative
body: I‚Äôm using this app for my first pregnancy and all the information it gives is so great. I like how it has a section where you can ask and answer questions to other parents. However the videos don‚Äôt seem to load and I can‚Äôt watch them. I deleted the app and reinstalled it to see if that would work, but it didn‚Äôt. Not only it didn‚Äôt help, it deleted all my bumpie pictures and kick tracker recordings. Which I didn‚Äôt think would happen since I have a profile and I thought it would save onto my profile. It needs a little work but regardless I‚Äôd recommend this app to someone else.

title: I love this app!
body: Baby Center has reallyyyy been so helpful with any questions I have and to also help me track my baby‚Äôs growth and development. It‚Äôs made it a lot easier to be able to know we are on track. With being a first time mom it‚Äôs hard sometimes to know whether my baby is getting enough food or how much she needs or if she‚Äôs getting enough sleep. Baby center has made this journey easier by providing a database with a ton of easily accessible info to make this transition into parenthood soooo much easier.

title: Lots of resources
body: I‚Äôve used Babycenter to track 3 of my 4 pregnancies, and I absolutely love it!!  The information given is easy to understand and so helpful (my husband checks the tracker everyday so he can tell me something new about the baby)‚Ä¶ when we lost our 3rd to miscarriage the app gave us the option to finish that pregnancy and stopped sending those hurtful ‚Äúyou‚Äôre baby would be this big‚Äù type of updates that some other apps kept sending. I can‚Äôt say enough great things about this app‚Ä¶

title: Easy & Informative!
body: I told myself when I had a baby, I would not read bias blogs or advice pieces. I only installed this app & let me say well worth it! I can have all of my child‚Äôs stat for weight/height, sleep habits, eating, etc. it‚Äôs all in one place. I really enjoy the weekly email on where your child sits in their development based on their age. Quick to the point, a lot of great information from medical professionals, and tips on how to handle the basics with baby. If looking for a easy and insightful app on how to bring up baby- this is it!

title: Amazing
body: I love this app at the time of me posting this I am 18 weeks pregnant and it is filled with information!!

title: Love this app
body: I am a first-time mom of a beautiful 1 year-old girl.  This app is awesome. It gives the right information at every stage of our family life. I already know what is going to happen every week in my daughter‚Äôs development. Also, it talks about illnesses and what to look for and when to contact the doctor when the baby does get sick. This app makes me feel more prepared and confident in myself. I will definitely use it until my daughter grows up and even with other children. I highly recommend it.

title: Best for mom and baby!
body: I have used this app since I was pregnant with my son. Being that he is my first I needed all the help and insight I could get. The app helped me stay on track, get prepared for what was happening next, and helped explain what I was currently feeling. Now that my son is here it helps me stay on track with how he is developing, where he is at on the spectrum, and reminding me that everything is going to be okay and that most of the things that are currently happening are normal. As a first time mom, I highly recommend this app!

title: Forum is the mean girl club
body: I was excited to try this app and even more excited to to join the forums so that I can talk with other women who are trying to conceive. Being that this is the Baby Center, you would think that they would make it a support area and where you would WANT to join.....nope. The community board is full of immature rude women who have nothing better to do than kick emotionally stable women while they‚Äôre down. Sad part too is that is seems to be the same group of women. The Group owner‚Äôs do nothing about it, and women who are seeking advice end up just getting their post filled with unnecessary rudeness. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this app unless you liked to feel like your in an unwelcomed club.

title: A+++
body: I have used this app during my pregnancy and still am using it beyond  -it‚Äôs been amazing! it was one of six apps I tried and I just kept always going to it first...easy to use and all the info I thought I needed and THEN a lot more!! & especially when I got closer to labor, reading all the blogs from women was so helpful to know what to expect and to truly trust myself (FTM) in the unknown of the experience because all deliveries are so different-that kept me from making unnecessary/early trips to the hospital at least twice!!

title: Lots of useful information!
body: When my wife became pregnant I started asking my friends who had already gone through the experience about books to read to get information and almost everyone gave the same response of downloading the BabyCenter mobile app.

title: Love this app!
body: I downloaded this about halfway through my first pregnancy and it has been a sanity saver. The articles in my feed are customized, so all those concerns I was having every time something changed? There was a perfectly-timed article for that. And if not, the forum with your month‚Äôs birth club was full of moms, many going through the same thing. Now that my Little is here, the articles continue to offer me helpful information and now even suggest games and developmental activities. I highly suggest this app!

title: AMAZING pregnancy App
body: This app is filled with tons of great information and resources for almost anything you can think of, from educational facts on each week of pregnancy to videos on birthing and what to pack in your hospital bag, and SO much more! Not to mention this app helped me order a FREE breast-pump through my insurance and it was painlessly easy! You can take pictures of your baby bump and add facts about your baby from that week, review polls on popular subjects during pregnancy (ie: how many people circumcise their son, etc). It is simply great! Highly recommend!!

title: Perfect all over!
body: This app is simply awesome! I have learned so much through it starting from my pregnancy all the way until now, my baby is 1 month old. At first, I just wanted the app to track my baby‚Äôs growth during pregnancy. I didn‚Äôt think it would continue teaching me milestones on my baby after birth. Thanks to this app I didn‚Äôt feel so lost when my baby was born. Now, I can‚Äôt wait for the new information it will give me on my baby every week! I usually don‚Äôt write reviews but I really loved this app. ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Love the week by week updates!
body: When you‚Äôre expecting and once your baby comes, there is really no time to google everything that is happening with your developing baby, how to ensure your baby‚Äôs developmental milestones are being met, tips for what‚Äôs going on with your own mental health & physical health. This app complies all that information into one place! I love that I have weekly reminders about how my baby was developing in the womb and now where he is at as far as his age and where he should be in his developmental milestones.

title: Love this App
body: This app is great it helped me through out my pregnancy converting over to a baby app for when the baby was born. I must have forgotten about that feature but I really do Enjoy this app for all its different features it has!* I absolutely Love, Love this app. Not using it as much as I did during my pregnancy being my first one and at the very beginning of my child's birth I did use the app and it has helped me tremendously. I was at an aww once it converted over to baby app once my baby was born. Highly highly recommend it!!

title: My baby bump
body: I have an 18 and 15 year olds. I just married one year ago and we are expecting our second child after we lost the first to a partial molar miscarriage. My sister recommended this app to me and I‚Äôm in love. This app is life and joy for me. It prepares me, educate me, encourage me, and offer a support group, if I need more help. Yes I have older kids, but they almost grown and this is starting all over again. So I greatly appreciate this app. I definitely highly recommend it to all expecting moms. You will not be disappointed!! Thank you!

title: Love it
body: I love the app. A lot of baby apps you only can use during your pregnancy but this app you can use even after having the baby & it gives you lots of tips. There is even a ‚Äúbirth club‚Äù where your basically in a forum with other moms who have around the same due date as you and it is extremely helpful especially if you have questions about something, other moms can answer! Though there are some minor problems I would still definitely recommend!

title: Love it so far...
body: Love this app! I had the ‚ÄúWhat to Expect‚Äù app during my last pregnancy & while the info was fine I felt constantly bombarded by ads, not just in the app, they‚Äôd send me multiple emails a day trying to sell me things. I‚Äôm really enjoying Baby Center. Ads in app aren‚Äôt obnoxious or overwhelming, info is well presented & engaging and the emails I receive are actually relevant to my pregnancy & I look forward to getting the additional information, thanks so much! Will be using this (hopefully) again in the future.

title: Best Ever
body: App! It was a lifesaver and I was so sad at the end of the year when it stopped‚Ä¶ I wish it went beyond one year olds and continued the development articles. I love the way it breaks down information into daily and weekly articles that are so timely and help to digest a large quantity of information in a fun, accessible and reliable manner.

title: First time Dad and this is very helpful
body: This is a great app for first and even second time dads I‚Äôd assume. I used it since my wife was about a month pregnant.  We followed his development throughout, read the articles to get ready and the app still goes even after the baby is born. Our little one is 2 months, 3 weeks and I still enjoy receiving the emails and updates letting me know what stage he is in, what to expect this week and what milestones may be coming up. Great app and I would highly recommended to anyone.

title: It‚Äôs an ok app.
