Im only in my second trimester so i havent been able to use everything on the app but im sure i wont be disappointed when the time comes.

title: A brilliant app
body: I been using this app since the day I found out I was pregnant. It has many aspects I like about, the top one being that it follows you throughout ur whole journey of motherhood. From conception, pregnancy, birth, and so forth. It groups with other mom who due date is close to yours in the forums, you‚Äôll make lots of pen pals due to having similar experience for 9+ months. Also most of my googled questions links me back to this app. Highly recommend

title: 9 year Client of 4 children
body: I‚Äôve used BabyCenter, for 9 years with the 4 of my children that are now ages 8, 6, 2, and 3 weeks. This app has made pregnancy, and post-pregnancy so comfortable for me. Literally every question or concern I had I followed through with BabyCenter. I still receive information on my 8 year old through BabyCenter and I completely love this app for the guidance throughout the years of motherhood. Thank you for your blessings, this app means so much to me.

title: Bad update
body: The new update is terrible! Glitchy and difficult to use. This is my second pregnancy with the app, loved it the first time....this time, the community boards received a giant overhauling update that changed how to entire platform functions. Everyone is irate. Too many adds. Slow load times. Inability to bookmark. Getting bumped back to the start of the main board after you look at a post every single time. Ugh. Notifications super glitchy. I even downloaded What to Expect again (which I had previously deleted because I preferred this one) because using the app now is so difficult.

title: The app is wonderful
body: Honestly I do love the app. One of my favorite things about the app is the realistic progression of the child(ren). I always check the app and match it with what my doctor says and the information never was wrong for me. I wish it had a feature for multiples. Especially because I would love to see how multiples grow in a women‚Äôs stomach versus watch a singleton. I think that should be added on for the mommas. Other than that the app is really great, really easy to use and is all things about baby.

title: Helpful
body: Love this app. I like how it tracks my pregnancy to the current age of my baby. Every week and months are different and I learned what I need to know about the baby growth during pregnancy and how the baby develops physically and personality. It‚Äôs easy to search for more info that you‚Äôre not sure of like when your child have rashes or not well, suggestions to handling purple cry and so on. I highly recommend this app to all parents and parents to be.

title: I like it- but there‚Äôs glitches
body: The birth club is where you can connect with other pregnant women to get information and advice. However, the same conversation threads are repeated on the home screen and it always seems like it takes forever to update new posts to be shown. So I‚Äôm scrolling through the same thing over and over again. Once I‚Äôm in a conversation, the screen has been going blank and I have to exit out. Bummed and kinda annoying when you‚Äôre wanting to look through advice and comments and it glitches out.

title: Perfect application for first time mummies
body: This application helped me a lot in discovering all the details of the pregnancy. I live in the US with my husband far from my mom and mother in law. And we have time difference with our home country. So when I need to find answer to any disturbing me question, Baby Center helps me without having to search a lot. And every week I get detailed info about my baby‚Äôs progress. Love it and recommend it to every woman. Thanks

title: So thankful!
body: Since I downloaded this app during my pregnancy, I couldn‚Äôt be happier. All the articles, videos and tips were on point, and made me feel very comfortable, calm and integrated. Now my baby is 2 weeks old, and still, I often read everything out there related to what my baby and myself are going through at this moment. For every doubt I have, I always find an answer from Baby center. I am just very thankful!!

title: I love this app.
body: I‚Äôve used this app during my pregnancy and now I use it for my newborn. I checked it every week during pregnancy, and still do for newborn articles. I look forward to reading the articles based on my baby‚Äôs age. The app is user friendly, nicely designed and has little ads. It has helpful articles, tools and forums. I recommend it to anyone expecting or with a newborn. Thank you for everything, keep up the great work!

title: Love the updates and extra information
body: I have only been using the app for about a two weeks. Thus far it has been great! BabyCenter updates me with the size and growth of my little one every week and they also provide me with information about what‚Äôs healthy to eat and other do‚Äôs and don‚Äôt while pregnant. There are other perks that I have not taken advantage of yet but as time goes by I will. Thank you for creating this app.

title: 2nd time using and I love it
body: This is my second pregnancy I‚Äôve tracked with this app and it love it. I still have access to the post I made from my last pregnancy 6 years ago and it‚Äôs nice being able to look back on my symptoms and feelings and compare them to this pregnancy. The app sends me notifications each week with my weekly baby update or small tips for my stage in pregnancy. I have no complaints. I think you‚Äôll enjoy this app.

title: As a grandma I want to follow my daughter‚Äôs 1st pregnancy
body: As a grandma I want to follow my daughter‚Äôs 1st pregnancy and this app keeps me updated as well as give me information to make sure she doesn‚Äôt overlook! She miscarried right directly prior to this pregnancy. The name she hoped for was wonderful. This time She gave it the name œÑŒ≠œÅŒ±œÇ which is Greek for monster! LOL I guess to survive we must find humor! But I enjoy following along on all the size changes and I nick name it that weeks size! It‚Äôs been to long for me to remember all the details and she is 27 and new to this!

title: Great App
body: Awesome app. Tells you affordable and high end options of baby care products. Has posts from other and all types of women on what they‚Äôre going through that makes gives you a kind of comforting feeling if you‚Äôre a first time mom and not sure about what‚Äôs happening to your body/if something is normal. It would always tell me a weight that was wayyyyyy lower than my son, and I didn‚Äôt like that, but no ultrasound is 100% on fetus weight either so it really didn‚Äôt bother me that much.

title: Love it!
body: BabyCenter app made me change my mind about baby apps! It kept me informed about everything going on in every trimester and reassuring me the whole way through. I really loved the small jokes made in the app as well! It made me feel like I wasn‚Äôt reading plain ol‚Äô information but made me excited to be pregnant and learn about the cute and exciting things about being a mom! The polls involving other mommy‚Äôs to be was cute and fun. I definitely recommend this app!

title: Isn‚Äôt this supposed to be about pregnancy?
body: If anyone wants a baby app that is about PREGNANCY and not politics and race, PREGNANCY+ Is the baby app you need!! It‚Äôs sooo much better than this crap!! I liked this app when I first got it. I didn‚Äôt know it was gonna be used as a platform for politics and what‚Äôs going on in the world. I thought it was supposed to be all about pregnancy. I‚Äôm disappointed. Everywhere I look I see news stories and ads about racism and what‚Äôs going on in the world I didn‚Äôt need a baby app to shove all the negativity into my face too. I came on this app to find something positive to look forward to, my baby. My pregnancy. Thanks for being another news platform baby center.

title: Very informative, would be better if days of the week are accurate
body: Love this app, very informative and tracks the amount of months/ weeks until your due date although, the date keeps pushing back on its own on the days of the week which would be better if it was fixed. Does not always show the current date of the week. Always need to adjust my due date then Input it right back to get the accurate day of the week

title: Disappointed
body: I loved this app at first, we took a bumpie starting at 5 weeks so we could document the beautiful change in me. Word of caution!!! If you get a new phone or your iPhone accidentally deletes your apps like they like to do all of your bumpie pictures will be gone!! I lost my whole first trimester of pictures and I am devastated. I emailed customer service and said if you get a new phone or the app is deleted your pics will be gone unless you have backed them up. Please back them up to your camera roll. I can‚Äôt get them back. I don‚Äôt understand why they won‚Äôt stay, even the baby names I saved are there but not the pics. So disappointed that they do this.

title: Great app!
body: This is my first pregnancy and this app informs you of where you are at in your pregnancy. It updates you daily with insightful articles and tips to help you along your pregnancy. I had my husband download the app and he gets all the updates I do, so he is on the same page as me on learning everything we need to know before the baby comes. This is an excellent app that is easy to navigate and I highly recommend to anyone!

title: Best app ever!
body: Life is busy and when you add a newborn and sleep deprivation to life, the important little things can be forgotten or missed. I highly recommend this app to all mom's. Offering everything from charts of detailed time logs that include feeding(breast or bottle), sleep, and diapers to meds, and even milestones. It's absolutely amazing! I love being able to present my pediatrician with detailed facts. Thank you to the creators and people behind the creation of such a valuable tool for any parent!

title: Life of an Expat Made EASY
body: This app helped me when I was pregnant and continues to help with my baby as she grows. We are currently living in Italy and so it helped me bypass cultural norms to do what I thought was best without having the doubt about my "strange" ways. Because the doctor and pediatrician visits are in Italian this app also helped me know what to expect. I recommend it to all my expecting friends! The only thing I wish it had is the language availability in Italian too.

title: Awesome app
body: It‚Äôs a lot more descriptive and informative and organized than the usual pregnancy apps. This one looks at changes with mom, baby and the whole process. I love the ability to capture pictures of baby during the many stages of pregnancy. It‚Äôs really helpful in terms of connecting with baby in the womb. I appreciate the clean and non cumbersome esthetics of the website as well. This is a message from an aspiring father, married to an expectant mother. Thank You.

title: First time baby!
body: I love using this app. I used it when I was pregnant and now I‚Äôm still using it as my little one grows! I‚Äôve learned so much about my babies development with this app. I loved how the app told me how big my baby was in my belly. It is so helpful with many subjects that nobody really talks about but are still important. I love this app and will most likely use it for any other pregnancy in the future and will definitely recommend! 10/10

title: Awesome app! Much improved!
body: This is the app you want.

title: Helpful App with Great Information
body: I absolutely love this BabyCenter App. I am a first time mom and it gave me soooo me helpful tips as before, during, and after my pregnancy. I knew what and what not to eat... why certainly problems occurred just EVERYTHING!!! It also helped me learn everything about my baby and what milestones he should be meeting and when. And it‚Äôs better than any app that you have to pay for. This is definitely a great app for both mom and baby!

title: Terrible ‚ÄúCommunity‚Äù
body: If you are Christian or pro-life (and feel strongly enough about either one to even mention it on here), go elsewhere for information/community or prepare to have your comments deleted or attacked by the ‚Äúdon‚Äôt shove your beliefs down by throat‚Äù women who...well, do nothing but shove their opinions down people‚Äôs throats. It wouldn‚Äôt be so bad if moderators weren‚Äôt quick to declare a pro-life comment as a community violation whereas comments encouraging a woman who was considering aborting her baby (because the baby MAY have Down syndrome) that she should think of her other kids and not put that strain on her family is somehow perfectly acceptable on here. Really, it‚Äôs just kind of sickening.

title: Love this app
body: Wish they would tell you how many months you are. I like knowing how many days you have left and weeks but it makes your time being pregnant seem so much longer. I do love this app. I like seeing how big the baby is and watching the videos. when it comes time to delete the app I will cry. It makes the end of pregnancy for real. Having the baby makes it real but this app is a big part of your pregnancy.

title: Love it!
body: Got this app as a recommendation from my sister. So far, it's great! Wonderful photos, lots of helpful articles. The app runs well. Love how the site gives you to-do lists, what's safe for pregnancy, registry, what you need during the pregnancy and after. I also LOVE the bumpie. Definitely using that as I advance in my pregnancy. Has answered all of my questions and allows me to look ahead to future weeks and see what lies ahead. Highly recommended!

title: Loved it.
body: I had my son 5/8/19, although he came early everything was on target and still is for development. This app had me soooooo ready to meet this little guy and he was everything I hoped for and more. The baby center helped ease my inquisitive overthinking mind about little things, gave very detailed descriptions on size and everything. I loved how it tracked his brain development as well. I will definitely use this again for my next pregnancy.

title: Happy mommy
body: Baby Center app help me with my pregnancy, BabyCenter app track my pregnancy each month. How my baby being developed. App gave me peace of mind (especially during the pandemic) BabyCenter kept me informed about my progress each month, I know what to expect each month. What type of questions to ask the doctor. When my little bundle of joy arrived, BabyCenter app gave helpful tips. What to expect when you bring your baby home and development stages.

title: The best pregnancy and postpartum app
body: This got me through my pregnancy every step of the way. It told me everything I needed to expect. It also has a community feature so you can ask other mommas questions and have a support system. Now that I am postpartum it helps too! I can read what to expect with the baby and even my body. I also still have a community and support system all through the app! I highly suggest it!

title: An app I actually use every week!
body: From the time I found out I was pregnant until now when my baby is almost 6 months old I am still reading this app every week. I love that it tells me the highlights of every milestone and what to expect. Always such helpful information. I‚Äôm comforted by the fact that I can always check Baby Center to get an idea of what is going on with my baby. Worth its weight in gold!

When I first got pregnant this app helped me understand what was actually happening inside of me and how big the baby was getting week by week I always looked forward to check the app to see how big my baby was or what size fruit she was. After I had my baby I didn‚Äôt realize that the app would still give me information month by month about all my babies milestones. I absolutely recommend this.

title: Love this app!!!!
body: I love how it keeps me informed every step of the way. It‚Äôs easy and I love how it also shows you great offers to get for baby. I get to see how my baby is growing week by week and I get to learn about symptoms and how my body is changing. This is my 5th baby and I‚Äôve used this app for all of my pregnancy‚Äôs. I love how even after you have the baby it still tracks there growth and helps you with articles about there stages. Thank you.

title: Hopeful mommy!
body: I used baby center years ago when I was having my first child. I started showing symptoms of being pregnant again, so I decided to create another profile so go along with it. According to this tracking, I am 3 weeks pregnant and I am bloated, cramping, and spotting this week, which is every symptom I‚Äôve noticed before making the new profile! I am very hopeful that come the end of August I can take a test and it show positive! üòÅüòÅ

title: An amazing experience
body: I love this app since I have gotten pregnant I love the videos on pregnancy and it literally has an article on everything a pregnant woman wants to know about the daily life of pregnancy, plus little polls on ur pregnancy that everyone else takes so you don‚Äôt feel alone on the decision you have made with ur pregnancy... honestly truly an app that makes me excited every week on how big the baby is and what is going on in the womb love it !!!

title: Baby Center is the best pregnancy app!
body: Baby Center has been helpful throughout my pregnancy. The week to week guide plus the daily topics keep me on track. Because of this app I‚Äôm able to be involved with my pregnancy, being a first time mom. I‚Äôm learning so much information. And please take advantage of the Baby Center community. The message boards and birth clubs allow you to interact with women in similar situations. I love this app and would recommend it to any pregnant woman.

title: Love this app! Makes tracking the weeks FUN
body: I used this app last year during my pregnancy with my now 15 month old! I have also been using the app during my current pregnancy! It seems to help the pregnancy journey go by quicker as you tend to check daily/weekly the various updates. I especially enjoy tracking the growth by comparison to different fruits! Makes it fun to keep up with the weeks. Download the app! It‚Äôs worth it!

title: My first pregnancy!
body: So this is my first pregnancy, I am so glad I found this app to guide me through each week! It notify‚Äôs you each week, how many weeks you are with interesting paragraphs you‚Äôre going to want to know each week, as your baby grows. Inside & out. I hope other new moms can discover this app, it is truly very helpful. They also include birth class videos, inform you on what you need to know if you‚Äôre scared.

title: Good content but needs work
body: Good content but app needs work, especially videos.  Videos wouldn‚Äôt play for a while in the beginning. Then when they do and I hit done immediately, it plays the music in the background. Also, when I rewind to the beginning after listening to an ad, it replays the ad. The app also asks you to log in if the app is already open on your phone. So you have to go to your task manager and close it or open it from there. I just ‚Äúclear all‚Äù and then it wont ask you to log in if you reopen it.

title: Life saver
body: Baby Center has been such a life saver for me being a first time mom. Being able to get on the app and read what other moms are experiencing has given me peace of mind. I‚Äôm not big on posting but I enjoy reading other perspectives and making decisions based on all that I gather. Baby Center has been my go to and my favorite part is tracking my baby‚Äôs progress from day one. Basically, this app has been my best friend teaching me how to ‚Äúmom‚Äù.

title: Leana W
body: Very informative! Every time I would start getting certain symptoms, the app would have an article about that symptom and why it happens during pregnancy. Plus it‚Äôs always fun to know how big your baby is that week. Good app. Also a section to put photos in to see how big your belly is growing every week! It‚Äôs super fun to go back and see how big I grew every week.

title: Helpful
body: I love checking this every week. It‚Äôs been a fun way to connect with my little one and track his growth. Some of the fruit/ veggie comparisons surprise me, for example I‚Äôll sometimes think the food last week is generally bigger than the current week, but food varies of course. Overall I‚Äôm glad I went with this app. This is my second kiddo and it has been an efficient way to check in on his progress.

title: 1st Time Mom üòå
body: This app has been the best since the beginning of my pregnancy ü§∞ keeping track of everything while waiting on the big day was awesome & they have some much information to learn on the way .... & they still keep up with child after pregnancy with more updated information wish is cool ... Thanks BabyCenter continue to be grow & give mothers more ease ... when it‚Äôs come to being a mom it‚Äôs not so easy üòò

title: Keeps me in track
body: I like how I can track my baby‚Äôs growth weekly and I like how it gives little details about the baby when I press the plus sign. I‚Äôm glad I have this app, I when I used use to track my first pregnancy in 2005 and it was only online. I love that all I have to do is tap my app and everything I need to know is saved on this app. Oh and the fact that I was able to track my contractions is a plus for me

title: LOVE THE APP BUT IT KEEPS GLITCHING!
body: I love the app so far with my pregnancy, but the app keeps keeps glitching which is super frustrating. It will randomly sign me out, and then my log in information will not work when I try to sign back in. So after trying many, many times I will click the reset password link and when I click on the email it sends, it just takes me back to the same log in page on the app so I can‚Äôt create a new password. I‚Äôve had to make a whole new account twice now, which is really frustrating. Please fix this!

title: Positive correct information
body: I really appreciate this app it always guides me and give me good information, it basically like a book with out pages literally it‚Äôs helpful and has great videos and photos. You can do so many things with this app you can snap your baby bumps. It‚Äôs so cool it has baby name ideas just really helpful all the way around I love it !! I would recommend this to anyone especially for your first pregnancy!! üëçüèæüôÇüôÉüòâ.

title: Love this app!
body: I have been using this app since I got pregnant with my first son back in 2013. I have used it with each one of my pregnancies and continue to use it at my babies grow! Love all the information/advice you find with this app! Definitely would recommend downloading it, or using their website if you are trying to pregnant, planning to become pregnant or would like to track your baby‚Äôs growth once their born!

title: Love this app
body: From thinking of having a baby to the magic to conceiving, this app has everything! I love my groups and how open everyone is, and it‚Äôs so comforting that dads are welcome too! The medical information available helps me understand what‚Äôs happening to my body as I reach the perfect 9 month home for my new family member! It‚Äôs seriously a must have for parents starting out or a new couple learning more about themselves!

title: Tracking Pregnancy with BabyCenter
body: The BabyCenter app was the first app I downloaded after I learned I was pregnant. I wasn‚Äôt previously aware of BabyCenter but a quick search brought it to my attention. I‚Äôve found their articles very informative and timely. I‚Äôve learned a lot during the earliest weeks of my pregnancy and have found comfort in the consistent and thoughtful articles, tips, and BabyCenter community. Overall, I highly recommend!

title: Great App!
body: This app is perfect when you‚Äôre pregnant and postpartum! While you‚Äôre pregnant, it shows you the develop throughout each stage. When you give birth it switches and provides information about breastfeeding and bottle/formula feeding. Breastfeeding stories. Things you should do at certain stages, like tummy time! This answers a lot of great questions and concerns for the baby. I absolutely love this app. Especially keeping track of everything.

title: Stop
body: Don‚Äôt get this app its supposed to be an app you can go for to ask advice &talk to people but everyone is so negative childish & disrespectful it‚Äôs ridiculous. Literally deleted app off my phone because of it I‚Äôve asked to take my profile down but they refuse to & say I have to do it myself but doesn‚Äôt let me or they don‚Äôt give me instructions on how to do so, so I just deleted it. Giving a bad review & won‚Äôt be using this app anymore go with another one probably better off

title: Needs work
body: While this app is great to keep you up to date on your baby‚Äôs development, it is the little things that ruin it. I‚Äôm constantly having to sign in as the app doesn‚Äôt keep my information like it should. There are a lot of videos that hold information that I may need but since there are no captions, I‚Äôll never know. Not hearing impaired friendly at all. Ads play automatically, dominating the screen and blasting sound out of the speakers when I‚Äôm using a white noise app and my baby wakes up. I can‚Äôt browse the app when my baby is asleep and that is the only time I have to browse.

title: Great visualization info
body: I used that for my first son in 2014 and now I am using it again for my second pregnancy, the app is much more convenient before I used to only get weekly emails not as fun as the app, the information is very valuable to me, and my son really excited when I show him the size and pictures every week. Very important to me he understands the process, it is the best way to help him pictures the baby growth.

title: This app is extremely helpful and amazing!!!
body: Update: this is my 3rd pregnancy and I‚Äôve used this app for them all! I love it & find it slightly better and more informative than other apps.

title: Convenient and timely
body: Heard about BabyCenter from a friend and I love it. It couldn‚Äôt be easier to get the information I need exactly when I need it. I used/use it with my firstborn‚Äîwho is now 3‚Äìand with my 6-month-old. I‚Äôve used BabyCenter primarily to track my pregnancy and my children‚Äôs growth, in addition for reviews on strollers and car seats and other equipment. The articles and videos are short but still somehow cover all the bases.

title: Amazing!
body: This app is so helpful. I love the little updates they give about how your baby is progressing each week and all sorts of fact and myths of pregnancy. Even if there isn‚Äôt something directly on the app page you can search things in the search bar and it will send you to another page with multiple listings of answers! This is my first pregnancy, so I‚Äôve been googling everything under the sunüíÅüèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüòä

title: Great App!!
body: I started using baby center the second I found out I was pregnant and I feel in love with it the second I opened the app. From telling me the size of my unborn baby to all the informative information it has for you weekly and what to expect etc. I really enjoyed this app throughout my pregnancy and even now that my child is a month old. I found it very useful and definitely recommended it to both moms and dads.

title: I highly recommend this app !!!
body: I‚Äôve had this app since the beginning of my pregnancy and it was great with tips and teaching me a lot of things i didn‚Äôt know as I become a first time mom . My baby is now 4 months today and I still uses this app it has a lot of great features like updating on how many months/weeks my baby is and letting me keep tract of her weight ect. I recommend this especially to all first time moms !!!

title: Awesome
body: I don‚Äôt write reviews unless I love something or I hate it. I love this app! I love the fruit references and the day to day updates on the baby‚Äôs growth. The forums are good too to connect with others that are just as far along as you and have the same issues you do! I love the articles on lifestyle choices and other pregnancy related topics. It also has a lot of other good tools like baby name suggestions. Definitely recommend to any mom or dad!

title: The best guiding app for pregnancy I‚Äôve found and it‚Äôs free!
body: I love the short videos describing how far along you are, what to expect, etc. recent update rolled out making it more user friendly and pretty to use!

title: Love this app!
body: Being a mom to 2 kids can be hard especially if there a bit of a gap between them because things are constantly changing. This app has helped me with my firstborn and now my second born. There are tons of things that I didn‚Äôt learn the first time around or didn‚Äôt know that needed to do because babies are different. This app is great. I can always find whatever I have a question on in here.

title: The best app for Pregnancy
body: I love the bumpie photo gallery where I can keep track of my growing belly each week. Every week your baby is compared to the size of a vegetable or a fruit in the bumpie gallery. This app is fun and also has great articles to read that correlate to your specific week. Articles range from prenatal vitamins, what foods to eat each week, work outs & much more!  I definitely used this app more than the typical ‚Äúexpected‚Äù app. GREAT JOB!

title: Babycenter
body: This app offers a lot of important information on a variety of subjects that are vital for mothers to aid and guide in taking care of their new baby. I‚Äôm on my third baby and it‚Äôs still helpful to review the information. Having a newborn baby is never easy no matter how many times you‚Äôve done it. Having information on hand to help you know what‚Äôs normal and what to expect along with tips and solutions is so reassuring.

title: Great way to track while pregnant but not helpful after birth
body: I loved this app the whole time through two pregnancies but that‚Äôs all. After baby is born it really has no function. You go to the tools thinking they are actually function tools and all it is is helpful tips or articles. This app would be way better if you could use the tools to actually enter in weights and heights at every well child. Or track your feedings would be amazingly helpful.

title: Part of the family
body: I love using baby center. My first pregnancy, I hopped around different apps that were pretty good, until I stumbled across BabyCenter! It really helped me keep track, learn new things with being pregnant for the first time, a mommy to a new born for the first time. Giving me tips and super helpful videos with each milestone in my pregnancy. I am now pregnant with my second child and it was a no brainer to use BabyCenter again! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

title: Awesome!
body: Amazing way to keep track and see how others are dealing with their pregnancy. I‚Äôm a first time father with a first time mother and learned a lot! I enjoyed being able to track far beyond our current status and look at future symptoms she will have so we are not caught off guard. The only thing that would give it five stars to me is a live chat option with actual OBs or Nurses when questions arise. Thankfully my wife and I had the option for an on call nurse at our hospital.

title: Wonderful
body: Through both of my pregnancies one of my favorite things was getting weekly updates about my baby‚Äôs growth. Very informative with helpful tips and tricks for the many different symptoms and changes that come with pregnancy. My two and a half year old son also loved watching the videos and seeing where ‚Äúbaby sister‚Äù was at in her development. Thanks for being a joyful part of welcoming my babies, BabyCenter!

title: Best App!
body: I used this app every week! It‚Äôs one of the best. My top 2 for sure. I only wish they went on to the toddler years, at least until age 2. I know I can go to the normal site, but having it on the app would be amazing! Anyway- this app helps me through my pregnancy and 1 st year with my 3rd child, and when you are starting all over again at age 38 this was very needed! So much has changed since I had my 17 and 14 year old.

title: First time mom
body: This app along with what to expect when expecting helped during my first pregnancy giving me reality checked on being a first time mom. I actually learned most of what I know now from these apps rather than from my obgyn that‚Äôs how terrible they were lol this app helped me with what questions to ask my doctor ect. Because they do not tell or explain anything unless you ask specific questions

title: A bittersweet app
body: I love this app for many reasons and hate it for one! It‚Äôs soooo full of amazing articles and videos to keep you informed on your little one growing within BUT they get me too anxious the closer I get to giving birth! It‚Äôs such a cool thing to have a count down unless you‚Äôre like me and am so scared to go through the process of birth. Overall, my favorite app. I visit it everyday if not once then at least a couple of times a day!!

title: I love this app!!
body: I downloaded this app while I was pregnant and still have it after birth. It is was of the most accurate and informing apps for first times moms such as me who wants to know everything they can about their babies. I love that it notifies me every week about my baby  development and it‚Äôs always correct about what‚Äôs going on. If you‚Äôre  wanting to download this app, go ahead you won‚Äôt be disappointed!

title: Not working.
body: Just downloaded the app again. Had it with my first born and 4 years later (which is now) I tried downloading again but it won‚Äôt go past the ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre personalizing your daily tips‚Äù screen. It won‚Äôt load all the way. I closed the app and tried again, tried on WiFi, turned off my phone and tried again and still doesn‚Äôt go past that screen. Disappointed so I‚Äôm just going to uninstall and use a different app I guess. Was excited to use the same app I did with my first baby and sad that it‚Äôs not working for me.

title: Love this app!
body: I really wanted to find something that not only shows how baby is progressing but what your body was doing through it all. This app definitely does that and it‚Äôs super fun to see how it all works and helps you to better understand what your body is going through. It also connects you with a group on Facebook of other mothers for advice, encouragement, etc. I would definitely recommend!

title: Great Information
body: I can only rate what I have used. I have enjoyed the timely articles and reading my weekly updates. The content is very relevant and I feel it adds to my prep for this baby.

title: New mom
body: I have to say that as much as I try to do the right thing I always think I am wrong.  But baby center always has a great read or article that assures me I have done something right and gives me more tips. I love this app.  It‚Äôs puts my mind at ease especially when I get overwhelmed listening to soooo much advice from others.  This app lets me do it my way and guides me to what I feel is best for my baby (and my gut instinct). Thank you !

title: First time mom
body: I'm a first time mom, I spend my day reading articles but most group questions from other moms that are close to my questions. It's nice getting advice and answers from moms who have gone through what I'm living. This week I was put on bed rest due with a cerclage due to a short cervix and I can't tell y'all enough how this app has help me. So many advice and inspiration from moms it's amazing. I feel like I have a full support.

title: Excellent app!
body: This app helped me everyday throughout my pregnancy, I loved the little reminders of how far along I was throughout my pregnancy, I found myself excited to open to help and learn some new information about my growing bundle of joy. It still could have some improvements, such as keeping the exact progress of pregnancy as you skim through the app. But it always showed you your exact weeks when you reopened the app, hopefully I expressed that correctly. Still a superb app !

title: First time parents
body: Me and my husband are grateful for this app because it provided us insight about our growing baby and the information we need to know about the right care.

title: Great app for first time moms
body: Being a first time mom, and now finishing up my second trimester, this app has given me the chance to learn things I didn‚Äôt know. It has also given me a sense of closeness with my little one as I get to learn about her development weekly. I love knowing how she is doing in there, how big she is, and what she looks like throughout the 9 months. I‚Äôll continue to sing the praises of this app and encourage you to check it out!

title: Whole world of information
body: This is the best app out of all the other that I have been using.. the only thing I don‚Äôt like about this app is its user interface, other app that I have been using was surely the better if we compare the usability. But who cares for that when you get better and vast source of information with babycenter. Till now I never had a question whose answer is not available with babycenterüòÅ

title: Best app compared to others
body: Best app ever, you honestly know what to expect during your pregnancy and also when your baby is born! It lets you know what to expect during every month of pregnancy and also when your baby is finally born you know wheat to expect for every milestone. Best app. Used many other apps and this one is the best. Plus if you have any questions it literally has the answers for everything in regards.

title: Informative
body: I love reading the updates each week to see how baby is growing, developing and what‚Äôs going on with other my body! Sometimes it even reminds me I‚Äôm a week further along when it‚Äôs slipped my mind! :-D Like to see all the information given, like projected length and weight of baby to compare to my OB scans. Really enjoying this app while growing my third baby and never have a problem with it functioning.

title: I Love BabyCenter ü§ç
body: I am currently 35 weeks and i‚Äôve used this app since day one. It is always fun to hop on and track my milestones as I progress through my pregnancy. I love the little info bullets, they are always so accurate according to what I‚Äôm feeling each week. That is something that is really reassuring especially when it‚Äôs your first. The app is very easy to use and really informative. Would definitely recommend!

title: My favorite one stop app
body: I have like 3 baby app but this one is my favorite. While I was pregnant it did all the updates on how big baby is etc as soon as I had my son (put in the app that I had him) it switched to tracking baby‚Äôs development & showing what milestones are typical for age. It has mom groups and so much more. It‚Äôs literally a one stop app. I don‚Äôt even use my other app because this has everything I need.

title: The best app for pregnancy and after pregnancy.
body: It‚Äôs such a good app for you too follow during your pregnancy and its algo good after you have you baby. You can see how your belly and baby develops and also when he/she is already born. They give you so many tips and you can find almost everything related to you belly or baby. Very good app! I loved it with my first pregnancy and I‚Äôm still using it now that my baby is almost 4 months.

title: The Best
body: There is no there is no other baby and pregnancy tracker app out there. It helps you through every single stage in life covers over what seems like hundreds of topics. It does not bother you by asking if you would like to pay money to upgrade for more access and abilities. It seriously helped me through my twin pregnancy. Although the baby tracker portion is amazing, it would be nice to have the app be accessible to mothers of multiples.

title: Cute and informative
body: Fun app that keep you updated on some baby things that are happening and has a great community to ask questions. Over half the time I google something, a Babycenter response comes up. My only quip is that the pictures of the woman‚Äôs pregnant body, doesn‚Äôt look like she‚Äôs pregnant and I think it looks weird. The pictures in What to Expect When You‚Äôre Expecting are much more realistic and helps when it‚Äôs comes to ‚Äúhow should my body be looking‚Äù

title: Nothing but amazing!
body: I have been here thrice. It is an amazing app. Importantly the experiences shared by ladies going through same process as yours is beyond exceptional. It has helped me navigate the process when I was first time pregnant, second time when I had an unfortunate miscarriage, and third time when I was carrying high risk pregnancy. In each pregnancy the community support and tips has helped me immensely. I highly recommend this to new and to experienced moms.

title: Info is great, community is terrible
body: Don‚Äôt join birth clubs or groups‚Äîas a 4th time mom, I‚Äôve never been in a group that has been positive. They‚Äôre all judgy, toxic man-haters that will suggest you divorce or leave your partner over every little thing (ex. Someone asked for meal ideas for their picky kids and husband and people started attacking the husband for being a ‚Äúman-child‚Äù and the whole thread became about that). In my experience, usually the group owners are the most vocal and worst about it, so it is not the safe, supportive space pregnant women need. The info is great, but you can get that from a google search without the drama.

title: Baby center
body: Absolutely love this app!! I've been using it since I found out I was pregnant and now my daughter is 7 months old! I found it amazing that the app was telling me how big my baby was when she was growing in my stomach step by step what to expect and now it still telling me week by week what to expect from my baby. It's just absolutely an amazing and anyone that's becoming a new parent this is the app for you!!

title: Best baby app EVER ü¶ã
body: I have been using this app since I found out was pregnant with my now four year old back in 2015. Very informative, literally always head on with the updates, you can join other mommies in groups, have discussions, asks questions that you feel are not ‚Äúnormal‚Äù but they really are lol , all my mommies knows exactly what I‚Äôm talking about. Overall this app is simply amazing, would give it ten stars if I could!!

title: Nice
body: A compationate companion! Great especially for a first mom to be, and till now, that my daughter is 6 months old.

title: Great App and customer service!
body: I used this to follow my entire pregnancy and the first few months of my daughter‚Äôs life. It was amazing, has great advice, useful tools and charts. There seems to be a glitch right now (as per my edited review) but it‚Äôs being worked on, so I am rating this app how I would have prior to this issue! I am so happy they‚Äôre fixing it because it has really given me a wonderful follow-along of my first pregnancy/baby!

title: An amazing app!
body: This free application is very amazing, it's all what you need as a guide at home between your prenatal visits. It tells you everything about your baby on a weekly basis and it also gives you important information about what you should be doing right now. It gives you ideas about any opportunities you might be eligible for, for example: applying for a free breast pump. That's my first time to be pregnant and I really like this app! :)

title: Awesome
body: I love this app. My siblings are the ones who told me about it.  They loved using it. I love the baby size comparisons to the food, makes it easier to imagine. The videos of the growth of the baby are fantastic. All the articles are really helpful as well. I only give it four stars though because right now they don‚Äôt have a twin option and sometimes the app will shut down on me. But I still highly recommend this baby app compared to the others out there.

title: Not worth it
body: This app includes many articles, but they don‚Äôt give you articles on your feed that are necessarily relevant for the week you are in, although they seem to try. For example, when I was 12 weeks I got an article on ‚Äúflying tips‚Äù. I‚Äôm not even showing, and so I am perfectly comfortable on a flight. I was getting articles on maternity clothes from week 5!

title: Baby Center... My Guide
body: I downloaded the baby center app with my first child whose now 5yrs old. I like that I receive information about the age development. Especially the social emotional information. I just had my second child and I am on this every week. I love reading the growth updates and advice that other moms post on the site. I also love the search feature because I also find the information I need.

title: Helpful At Every Stage
body: This app has helped me from the beginning of my pregnancy and even now that my baby is almost 5 months. For my pregnancy it went through each stage and had plenty of articles that answered all my questions. My husband and I were able to tract each stage of growth the fetus was in. Now that my baby is here, I am able to track every milestone my child should be reaching. I enjoy using this app.

title: Trouble with the provided videos
body: Not a bad app I use it almost everyday to read new articles since I am a soon to be mother of my first child. But the videos provided never seem to work for me. I‚Äôm afraid if I delete and try again It‚Äôll mess up more...I‚Äôve read some of the reviews and that‚Äôs what happened to them I‚Äôll download another app along with keeping this one just in case but i would like to see the videos you provided as well....they seem really interesting!

title: Enjoy the Articles
body: Whether you are a new or seasoned parent checking out the articles can help to lead to forums where you can get any question answered.  I enjoy getting different points of view than what I might receive through family to make better educated decisions on what type of parent I am versus the parent I want to be.  I have signed both my children up so that I periodically get updates.  Then chose whether or not I want to read.  No pressure reading at my leisure.

title: Love this app!!
body: I have been using this app since I first found out I was pregnant. It has been a really valuable app in telling me what is happening every week from conception even past when my son was born. My son is almost 10 months old and it has been really valuable information keeping me updated as to what is coming up work possibly already be happening with my child. Highly recommend!

title: Like a pregnancy personal assistant
body: It‚Äôs really easy to use, sends useful reminders, and helps you stay connected to your baby especially during the stages where you can‚Äôt really feel them move and you don‚Äôt have morning sickness either or other symptoms (except maybe a growing waistline ü§ó)

title: Amazing app!!
body: Love using this app! It keeps me posted on weekly changes to my body and my baby (which is important to me since I sometimes struggle to remember which week I‚Äôm in! #pregnancybrain) and provides wonderful information on a variety of potential concerns. Being a first-time mom, I really appreciate those informative pieces. Definitely love using this BabyCenter! Plan on using it again, if I have another little oneüòä

title: Really good
body: I have several pregnancy tracking apps. Baby center is the best (or at least tied with WTE.) The articles are always great and the discussion forums for your birth month are a really helpful feature for connecting with other mamas going through the exact same stages. I used baby center 14 years ago, back before apps were a thing, with my first child. I used to look forward to the emails back then!

title: Trash
body: Update completely ruined the app and the tipping point that made me delete it was all the judgement. Some topics I get but something as simple as a name choice they will harass you for. It‚Äôs unbelievable this community is that toxic. I don‚Äôt know how this app is even still running. The rolled out the update to UK first and took no advice on it even though it was horrendous there too. So clearly shows the fact they have no care for their members. The group owners aren‚Äôt held accountable for their actions and will bully you along with other people. Just be careful app isn‚Äôt for sensitive people. Definitely not for conservative people either or anyone who goes against the grain.

title: This site has been indispensable to me!
body: I have a 7 year old, a 5 year old and a 4

title: Best App for first time mommy‚Äôs!!
body: In love with this app, a friend recommended since I found out I was pregnant! It gives great useful information each trimester you are in and weekly updates of baby growth! I still use it to keep up with my baby‚Äôs milestones and the information provided is great! Has helped me a lot ! Plus I love the tools provided such as the growth tracker and chatting with others who have same questions as you!

title: Awesome app
body: I love how this app shows your babies progress as he grows older. They also have links to tips and advice. You also have a community of moms who you can ask opinions or advice from if you need it. It‚Äôs a pretty wholesome app that tracks your child‚Äôs milestones. I‚Äôm using it for my second baby now. I would definitely recommend using this when you‚Äôre pregnant and even after birth! Best part, it‚Äôs totally free!

title: Love the weekly/monthly emails
body: Love the weekly/monthly emails I receive, it helps me understand what I should be expecting that week/month in growth, learning, development and gives great advice on maybe experiences I have been struggling with.  It‚Äôs crazy how sometimes the email is right ‚Äúon the nose‚Äù with what we were going through!  I don‚Äôt know how to get the email to say boy/he/his instead of referring to my child as a girl though?

title: Favorite Baby/Child App
body: Absolutely love this app.  I‚Äôve used it for my first 2 pregnancies and am using it again for my third.

title: Out of all baby apps, Baby Center is by far the best!

body: I love how the app keeps you updated not just on one thing but on multiple things. It lets you know how far along you are and the baby are. I appreciate how they even went ahead and got details on how the baby is growing week per week and also details on how the bump should be growing and symptoms the pregnant mom can be having. title: Choose this one first

Also, when I edit my bump selfies every week it kicks me out of the app. If these issues were fixed then it would be 5 stars for sure. It didn‚Äôt used to do this to me so I‚Äôm not sure if it was an update or what. My app says it‚Äôs completely up to date so I‚Äôm not sure what‚Äôs going on.

title: Use a different app for picture tracking
body: Camera frequently crashes right after taking a picture. Will make the ‚Äúcapture‚Äù sound and immediately crash the app & therefore doesn‚Äôt save the pic you assumed was taken. If you use your phone camera and then upload the pic into the app, there is a weird black bar to the right of your picture that doesn‚Äôt go away with editing (I tried every angle). Very frustrated since this didn‚Äôt happen until around week 22 of my pregnancy (by then too far for me to use a different app since I wanted a consistent time-lapse).

title: Tracking growth and all the extras
body: I downloaded this app so I could track the growth of my first son, and now on the second I appreciate all of the information at my fingertips. I also love being connected to other mothers. I cannot count the times I‚Äôve thought, ‚Äúis this normal?‚Äù Only to find another mother who ask the same question in a forum. title: SO ACCURATE!!!

title: Always need to log in
body: I just submitted to the app developers directly but since they may or may not read my feedback I figured I‚Äôd leave a review here as well.

title: LOVE!
body: I‚Äôve used baby center all throughout my pregnancy up until now my daughter is 6 months (which I absolutely love most baby apps end after your pregnancy baby center goes up to the first year). title: Changed my rating
body: I can see BabyCenter changed some glitches on the app, I wrote a review with 2 stars complaining about how the app had too many adds and whenever a video would play an add would pop up and disrupt the video and once finished the babycenter video would never load and continue to play, but this doesn‚Äôt happen anymore so that‚Äôs cool :) thanks babycenter for improving your app! Love it! üíñ

title: Great app for mommy to be‚Äôs

title: Love this app!!!

title: Best App for expecting mothers and for 1st time moms!!
body: This app has been a lifesaver for me as a 1st time expecting mom. This app followed my day to day pregnancy progression and provided all the necessary information to help me understand everything that was occurring and that was to come. I have now given birth to a gorgeous baby girl and the app is now providing all the need to know on newborns. I absolutely love this app and will continue to use it daily. Thank you BabyCenter!

title: Pointless
body: This app let me down so bad. I created an account because you can't use it unless you do. So, great I utilized the "bumpies" and began to really like the app. Well my phone gave out and I thought "well I'll lose everything but at least my bumpies and pregnancy memories will be saved in that app" so I logged in on another device and what do you Know, they're all gone. So tell me WHAT IS THE POINT OF HAVING AN ACCOUNT IF IT DOESNT SAVE ANYTHING. So now here I am 30 weeks with a phone that no longer works and no photos of the past 30 weeks. If Instagram and Facebook have the capability of keeping everything no matter where you log in this app should've too. I'm heartbroken.

title: 36-yr-old, first-time momma
body: Informational üëçüèΩ. Loved using this app, as I wanted to avoid information overload and wanted to have as stress-free pregnancy as I could. Instead of ordering a ton of books or signing up for a million blogs, I used this app. Perfect for letting you know what things you may want to/need to research further. I was surprised at the timing of the symptoms and informational bits. They were right on point with what I was experiencing week-by-week.

title: Love this app
body: This is our 3 child and I love this app more and more each kid!! All the info and suggestions are so helpful even to someone who has been through it all. Sometimes you think about calling the doctor for a small question but I‚Äôve found the info on the app and I don‚Äôt need to call the doctor and eating certain foods. My kids love checking the size of their In utero little brother! Oh the anticipation!!

title: Happy Grandma üíï
body: I love having this app I can keep track of all of my grandchildren as they grow including the one that is still my daughters womb mate LOL I loved seeing what vegetable or fruit my grandbabies were as they were growing in the womb and the ones that are out are now 6, 3 and 2 I used this app on all of them from the very beginning it has been a lot of fun thank you for this very fabulous and informative app.

title: Wonderful/Best app for all mom‚Äôs
body: I‚Äôve had this app for my first pregnancy. It was recommended to me by my OB and it is AWSOME!! You learn a lot about the process of your baby and the changes you are going through. Thank you üíØ fold to the creators of this app!!

title: Needs More Content Geared For Fathers
body: My wife and I barely found out we were pregnant and I immediately found this app and downloaded because I‚Äôm just super excited about the whole process! Overall I do really like the app and the information it provides, but it is obviously (and for good reason) more centered on the mother and the mothers perspective. I wish there was more content that speaks to the fathers experience throughout the pregnancy, what they can be doing to help, etc.

title: Love this app
body: My twins are almost 6yrs old, this is my 2nd time around and I feel like a new soon to be mommy all over again. This app is very helpful with making sure you are staying on track with everything that you can think of or even things that you would‚Äôve never thought of and there is a huge community to help you with any questions, concerns or just there to support.

title: Updates ruined the experience
body: The newest updates made the app difficult to navigate. It‚Äôs visually cluttered, not easy to find features anymore, and it is not intuitive at all. I also used to enjoy how the content was broken up into daily sections instead of by week, and the content didn‚Äôt used to be so repetitive. I used this app 4 years ago when I was pregnant with my daughter and have used it for 12 weeks for my current pregnancy, but the recent updates and lack of diverse content left me searching for a different app and I ended up deleting this one.

title: Great app
body: Very informative!!! Lot‚Äôs of information and advice on what to do while pregnant. It keeps you up to date with how far long you are and shows you what going on during the growing process of your baby. I like the feature where you can take weekly pics of your belly! I would highly recommend this app.. it was recommended to me by the OB nurse. Hope you enjoy it as much as my husband and I do üòÄ

title: Great App
body: I love this app! It provides all the info a new mom needs without scaring the cr*p out of you like some of the other apps do. Many other apps had a ton of articles and pop-ups about miscarriages and rare diseases, etc. Every time I spent more than 5 minutes on them, I‚Äôd end up with a panic attack. But this app is enjoyable while still giving you all the important information you maybe looking for.

title: Eh
body: The app has decent articles that aren‚Äôt updated enough and sometimes repeat, it‚Äôs awful to navigate, the members are awful, oh and once you make an account YOU CANT DELETE IT. Yeah that‚Äôs right you‚Äôre stuck in their system until the site dies off. There‚Äôs zero support and the groups are just cliques. Came here hoping to find someone to spend this pregnancy excited with and instead it made me feel like crap. Can‚Äôt even get my account taken down, don‚Äôt waste your time. ESPECIALLY if you‚Äôre a ftm looking for help because heaven forbid you ask the same question someone else already did that you didn‚Äôt see. Find a more supportive community.

title: Best app for soon to be mothers
body: I, like most new moms, was super excited to see how my baby was growing and didn‚Äôt know what to expect. Baby center really payed out the most common journeys babies go through and have tips such as questions about injuries/illnesses, tips on how to put the baby to sleep, foods for them, and so much more. My only complaint is that I have to set it to 1 child or the other- I think they should make it easier and quicker to view each child- like maybe in tab form at the top and you can click between each.

title: Constantly logs me out.. what happened to this app?
body: I‚Äôve used this app for the past 6 years and currently on my third pregnancy. This time around, I‚Äôm randomly logged out half the time I open the app on my phone. I don‚Äôt wanna have to enter my email and password every time I wanna use it. The weird part is sometimes I‚Äôll open it even after not logging in previous times and I‚Äôll be logged in. I really enjoy this app but this glitch alone is making me not even want to use it right now. I hope this gets fixed.

title: Have used this my last two pregnancies and just love it
body: Love getting updates every week. Makes me excited to learn what‚Äôs happening every week. How my baby is changing, what to expect with my body. I have to say it tells me what‚Äôs going on with me about a week in advance which is a shocker lol. Really cool tool for 1st time parents or experienced parents. This is my last pregnancy but, i‚Äôd recommend this tool to everyone!

title: Helpful for a first-time momüëç
body: Great app for a first time mother! This and ‚ÄúWhat to Expect When You‚Äôre Expecting‚Äù have been my Bible. title: Love this app!
body: I love the articles, pictures, and the community. I like the fact that I‚Äôm encouraged to start my own conversation thread and the ladies are so positive, caring, and supportive. Recommendation? I recommend a 3D view of the baby at each stage instead of still photo that I can only zoom in on. title: GET READY FOR THE BULLYING
body: This app is great for everything BUT the groups. In the groups you will have so many problems. People in the group feel empowered by their anonymity they feel it‚Äôs alright to gas light the crap out of an actual genuine question then continue to make personal attacks over and over and over. If your looking for groups that are helpful there‚Äôs a handful of them. The rest are like reliving high school if you were ‚Äúthe one kid left out‚Äù or bullied to crap. Honestly for first time moms I‚Äôd say use this app for everything else besides the boards and groups if you join a group I pray you get in one that‚Äôs actually helpful and not vile and full of hatred.

title: Love this app
body: Since my wife and I found out that we were pregnant, I have been tracking the baby‚Äôs growth and my wife‚Äôs body changes through this app. This app is wonderful. title: So Positive and Helpful

title: Awesome app.

title: Pregnancy apps

title: Great App

title: I can‚Äôt imagine myself without Baby center app

title: Love this app

title: Love this app!!

title: Why Not?
body: I ‚ù§Ô∏è it, highly recommend to Mothers ,Fathers, Sisters, Brothers, GrandMothers, You NAME IT!

title: Very informative!

title: So encouraging
body: Becoming pregnant isn‚Äôt always just a joy filled occasion. Sometimes it‚Äôs scary and difficult to navigate and too easy to isolate.

title: Everything you need to know
body: Baby center is very informative about your pregnancy. Step by step, week by week you get updates about your body and your growing baby. There were some things I thought I knew already but then baby center had a few other things to let me know. I am currently having my second child now and still using baby center for info.

title: I love this app
body: I experienced 16 years of secondary Infertility and Baby Center has seen me through those years! Any questions I had I was able to research them on baby Center! Trying to  conceive is hard but having a app to be with you in all phases of conception makes things a little easier! I

title: Most informative.
body: Becoming a first-time father at 43, I was most impressed with the extensive information and articles that not only encouraged me, but equipped me to be a more supportive husband during my wife‚Äôs pregnancy and understanding the growth of our baby.

title: Love all the articles!
body: I love all the articles about anything and everything baby related. Lastly, I love that the app works with multiple children. So I still get info and updates on my older child along with updates on my pregnancy. Great app!

title: Great Tool
body: I downloaded this while pregnant to track how big my baby was each week. I was pleasantly surprised with all the details this app gave me. Each week it explained what was going on in my body and why as well as what symptoms to expect with their possible remedies. Now, I still use this app as it helps me gauge growth with my infant. It helps guide me with what my baby should be doing/learning. I highly recommend it.

body: Babycenter has been a reliable source of information for many moms and moms-to-be. All you need to know is in one app. Not too overwhelming, but enough information to awake you from all things a woman goes through during pregnancy. Thanks to its team and advocates; hope they keep up the good work in updating and maintaining the knowledge shared as moms are really relying on this app.

title: BabyCenter is the Bomb
body: This is the most informative, in-depth pregnancy app I‚Äôve used! It has so many tools and informational videos for you to watch to prepare you for pregnancy and beyond. title: Great app to keep track and get tips!

title: Great Resource!

title: Perfect app for first time moms

title: A must have
body: This app has seriously helped me as a new mom. title: Best Pregnancy Partner
body: This is the best app for every pregnant woman.

title: Love this app... it makes me a little less stressed!
body: I loved getting the notification while I was pregnant and know how far along I was without even having to think about it. The app also tells you a lot about your baby and how it‚Äôs growing inside of you. Also after having my baby, it tells me how old he is. If you go to the app, it tells you what to expect from your kid at their age.

title: It could be better but it‚Äôs the best one!
body: This app has been so helpful when it comes to informing us about our growing babe! I love the videos and helpful tips. The forums are great too. But it‚Äôs a little disappointing when I‚Äôm having concerns about her movement and I start the timer but for whatever reason the app times out? title: wish I knew about this app for my first baby!
body: I have really enjoyed this app! I‚Äôm only 9 weeks along and I totally wish I would‚Äôve known about this before my first baby. title: Good app, needs a few updates.
body: Its a good app. I wish they could alter the weekly updates based on your baby‚Äôs gender. title: Amazing App
body: Being first time parents we have no idea what the hell we‚Äôre doing. title: Such a helpful app !

title: This app is essential!
body: This app has given me so much guidance as a first time mom! This is such a well put-together and beneficial app for anyone who has a baby or is pregnant!

title: Such a great support
body: I love this app. Even though I‚Äôm on baby number 2, I love reading the updates about the process and what steps he is in. My child would probably still be drinking milk only at 9 months. I recommend every mother whether it‚Äôs first time or second or third to use this a a general guide!!

title: Everything you need to know and more
body: I‚Äôm so happy I can have an all inclusive baby app!  I am at my second child so my time is very limited. With my first one I had enough time to search for various resources and ideas, to go deep with my research on different topics. With this app I‚Äôm confident that I have valuable and credible information, delivered in a way that saves a lot of time ( the printable menu ideas for mom&baby is Awesome).

title: Best pregnancy app
body: Amazing app I love the votes the extra information as well as the classes and everything else they provide. I would recommend this to every expecting mom. title: BabyCenter
body: Literally the best to have during your pregnancy! So much information for you and your unborn child and even after giving birth. It‚Äôs been EXTREMELY helpful with all the questions, worries, and curiosity I have while carrying my child. Each and every day I‚Äôm on this site to read about my little nugget from how many weeks/days he or she is to the growth transformation during each week!!!

title: Great info and resources
body: BabyCenter has been my go-to for all four of my children since my firstborn 8 years ago. The only fix I would suggest is to have more resources available for parents of multiples and preemies. Three of my four were premature and I have a set of twins.
