title: Perfect app for new moms...
body: I love this app... I used it during my pregnancy.. Its the perfect app to keep you updated in everything that is going on with your body in a weekly basis while you are expecting... specially if its your first pregnancy... all the tips that you get are unreal... and now that my baby is born I still using this app... I wish this app existed when I was pregnant with my other two kids... Specially with my first pregnancy...

title: Best pregnancy and beyond app
body: This is by far the second best thing that has happened to me since my little one was conceived!! The app is full of detailed info and fun facts about your pregnancy. It made me feel so much connected to my baby even before he was born!! All the worries and anxieties and questions  related to pregnancy where mostly answered through this app. I love the beyond pregnancy app as well!! It grows as your little one grows!! Best app ever!!!

title: First time mom
body: I had no idea what to expect but this app has gone above and beyond. For a first time mom, I have books and friends and family, but taking a little bit in each day, getting to talk to women going through pregnancy at the same time as me and being able to track my little nugget has been so wonderful. Everything can be overwhelming but this app helps keep it simpleüíï

title: First time mommy
body: I‚Äôm a first time mom with so many questions and this app is full of useful information. (I didn‚Äôt use the chat groups though). I love seeing what my baby looks like and the detailed stages it shows your baby is at, from what they‚Äôre able to do, hear, taste, and they‚Äôre whole growing process. It also helps with things your body is going through as well and ways to help!!

title: Great app from the beginning!
body: This app is awesome! It gives you tips and information from the beginning of your pregnancy and continues! It answers all questions! My baby is 6 months and I continue to use it daily. Given that all babies are different, this app gives you somewhat of a standard. It answers questions for the father as well! If you are pregnant or planning or have babies in general, DO NOT SLEEP ON THIS APP!

title: From my first day of pregnancy to now
body: From my first day of pregnancy to this day (with a 15 month old) baby center has helped me navigate the beautiful and bitter sweet of motherhood. It‚Äôs a great general database for new mothers needing to learn the ropes and a helpful community of support for those already in the swing of things. I‚Äôll keep baby center for my future pregnancies and beside it being very informative it‚Äôs also super fun to take photos of your belly bump and compare it‚Äôs size to produce in the mobile app. Yay Baby Center!

title: BabyCenter
body: I love this app! It helps bring up articles and thoughts on subjects you‚Äôre probably already thinking about throughout your pregnancy and even after your child is born. It has helped inform me, and raise questions that I didn‚Äôt even know to ask, and gave you the answers to those questions. I‚Äôm so glad this app exists, if your expecting I would definitely download this app, it‚Äôs worth it.

title: Freakishly correct
body: I sweat everything I‚Äôm going through they cover that week and explain the why. I even have a toddler and it tells me about him and his growth too and it‚Äôs always right. For example, he‚Äôll be throwing a lot of tantrums then I‚Äôll get an email that says your 14 month old is starting to find their voice tantrums are normal at this point. It has been very helpful with pregnancy too.

title: Couldn‚Äôt load
body: I have been having extreme pregnancy symptoms for a week or so now after a miscarriage, but it‚Äôs still too early for a test and have been wanting to talk to other moms to see if they have had the same experience.  I signed up, but tried loading it many, many times.  It said for me to check my internet connection each time and I did.  Everything was fine.  After trying for a few minutes, I decided to look at reviews and found that this app isn‚Äôt even good for supportive community.  I‚Äôm going to look for a different app. Thanks ladies for your honest reviews, they are so appreciated!

title: Great app to keep track
body: I‚Äôm a very forgetful person so this app cane in really handy and also gave great development information about the baby week by week. After delivery it also shows you new milestones the baby will be achieving and has a great chat room where you could ask other expecting parents questions or just look for support. I recommend downloading this app.

title: Great app for feeling apart of your Pregancy!
body: I am pregnant with my husband and my first child. It is very exciting but also so nerve wracking! Going to the OBGYN every month reassures me everything is going right but people don‚Äôt talk about the other 3 weeks that your waiting to be told everything is alright. This app gives me an update every week about what the baby is doing and how he‚Äôs growing and it has been great to ease my mind!

title: Awesome app
body: I love this app ! The updates that follow as your child grows and gives you tips and ideas on dealing with the ever changing volcano that is children lol. Being a mom to a five year old prior to having my now 3 month old son I thought I was on top of my mommy game but even though I‚Äôm confident in the level of love and care I give my kids this app allows me to not feel bad that I didn‚Äôt remember or know some things

title: I‚Äôm glad it‚Äôs around but...
body: The latest update for this app is terrible. Half the time I can‚Äôt get it to load past a certain point, especially in the birth club section of the app. I‚Äôve updated my phones software and and working to delete and re-ad the app. That being said I‚Äôm glad there‚Äôs an app available for tracking your pregnancy and your child‚Äôs development (would be nice if that part lasted longer than a year).

title: Like the app but keep having to login
body: This app is really great. I love the layout and find it really easy to follow. Unfortunately, I get really annoyed because almost all the time it logs me out and I keep having to log back in. This seems like a silly annoyance, but it is annoying. Has anyone else experienced this? There is no rhyme or reason. Sometimes I‚Äôm logged off three times in a week and sometimes I‚Äôm not logged of for a few weeks. It happens literally every time on my iPad version, so I stopped using on my iPad.

title: My favorite!
body: I‚Äôve tried different apps between my pregnancy but there‚Äôs nothing like this one! I just love being able to connect with others who are going through the same things I am at the same moment and just listening to their stories is awesome. I also really like seeing what my baby might be doing, how big he is or learning what I might be experiencing soon and why.

title: Ok for pregnancy, terrible for loss
body: The app itself was ok during my pregnancy. Ok information provided. Nothing fantastic. I was 10 weeks pregnant when I lost my baby. The other two apps I used offered support for women going through miscarriages. They immediately stopped pregnancy updates and emails. They also offered online support groups. I tried stopping pregnancy updates from baby center but they still came for 3 weeks. I tried to unsubscribe many times. It was so painful to continue to receive updates for weeks after. My husband and I will try again when cleared by my OB and I will not be downloading this app again.

title: Very helpful
body: I‚Äôve been tracking my pregnancy with this app and I‚Äôve feeling confident about everything related to my baby due to the many explanations on this app. Also I enjoy reading about the real experience with mothers on the community baby Center, where you can share or feelings or ask any questions or concerns. I like to receive a daily email to know what‚Äôs new with the baby, as well.

title: Diverse perspectives; medically accurate content
body: I have access to multiple baby-related sites and BabyCenter is the most reliable in terms of useful content that shares medically accurate and complete information. Every baby is different and each article shares a breadth of expectations in terms of how babies present (e.g., ranges of sleep expectations, eating, physical development). I find it particularly helpful to know that actual doctors are reviewing content.

title: Send terrible emails
body: This app allows members to argue, name-call, bully, and ‚Äúshare their opinions‚Äù in the rudest ways. Also, they send emails using fear tactics to scare you into doing what they think is best for your baby. I‚Äôve gotten emails that my baby will get measles, asthma, and allergies. They then gave me biased advice on how to protect my baby from these things- but yeah I wouldn‚Äôt say they researched much before giving their opinion.

title: Luv this app, just need to tweek some bugs
body: Love this app! Used it all through my pregnancy and was very useful and informative. Even now that my baby is born I use it and it keep me up to date with my baby‚Äôs milestones. It‚Äôs just that sometimes it asks me to sign in and even if I click forget password it doesn‚Äôt allow me to reset password, other times it just automatically signs me in without asking for any password...just need to sort out this bug

title: Love this app!
body: This app has given me a lot of confidence during this pregnancy. I love the ‚Äúis it safe?‚Äù And kick counts tools. Helps tremendously to know what to avoid during pregnancy and to have a record of my baby‚Äôs activity readily available to discuss with my doctor. The weekly videos showing baby‚Äôs development and pregnancy symptoms to expect have given me something to look forward to and have allowed me to prepare.

title: Pretty decent
body: It‚Äôs a very informative app I‚Äôm a male and I just like to read the articles. The app is pretty much gender based though. It makes me feel a little awkward. It just automatically assumes that I‚Äôm the mother. It doesn‚Äôt have a father option and if it does I‚Äôm not aware of it. It also just assumes that you‚Äôve had a daughter as well, using gender sensitive words like ‚Äúshe‚Äù even when I‚Äôve put in that I‚Äôm expecting a son or that I‚Äôve had a son. It‚Äôs a minor problem but it still made me fell like I shouldn‚Äôt be using this app.

title: LOVE THIS APP
body: When I got pregnant, I was literally clueless. Up until my friend told me about this app. It has helped get me information and give answers to so many of my questions. Plus, it has the cute weekly bump pictures that we see so frequently on Pinterest. You can put cute, little emojis by them and what week you‚Äôre at. I love it. If you are expecting or have a child, this seriously is the app for you.

title: Love the weekly reminders!
body: Working full time can somewhat take the joy and focus away from the preggers experience and so the weekly reminders of how far along you are or the updates on how your little one has changed and grown is such an awesome thing to receive! So much good information that you could search for and videos to keep you as informed as you wish to be.

title: Great App!!
body: I love this app. There is so much information available. The weekly updates are so helpful and fun to see how your pregnancy (and later new baby) is progressing. I‚Äôm always on here reading the articles and looking things up that I may have questions about. It‚Äôs easy to navigate and I haven‚Äôt had any issues with its performance. I would definitely recommend it to expecting mamas!

title: Ive had this app from period to baby love it
body: I had this app to keep track of my period it helped me know when not to get down in the bedroom but i stopped keeping track and then boom i got pregnant lol. But throughout my whole pregnancy from day 1 even to know i use it to help keep me updated on everything. It lets you know whats going on answers questions and concerns its amazing idk what id do without it.

title: Love it!
body: This app is the only one that has information that I actually trust. I love the tools although for some time the growth tracker wouldn‚Äôt show up and I lost all of my babies information from months üò© I didn‚Äôt have it anywhere else since this is my number 1 app but it seems like it‚Äôs back and I‚Äôm expecting another baby in a couple of weeks so I really hope it stays üòä.

title: Step by Step for First Time Moms
body: This app has given me all the answers I‚Äôve searched for so far. Each week is on point in the pregnancy process. I am a very organized and planning forward person- this app gives the tools and lists I need to properly prepare for the new edition to my family. I particularly love that each article read is reviewed and vetted by doctors, physicians and professionals who are experts of the topics.

title: Great App!!!!!
body: Im a first time mom and i got this app when I first found out I was pregnant. It‚Äôs great, very informative and you get weekly updates on your baby‚Äôs growth as well as daily little fun facts there‚Äôs also groups that you can join based on the month you‚Äôre due and you can post any questions and other moms can reply and give you advice I would definitely recommend you to download it.

title: If you‚Äôre a new mommy to be! Download this app ASAP
body: I love this app so much better than any other apps I found. This is my first pregnancy and I love how the app has so much information and tips on what to do or if you have any questions you can get together with other mommy to be‚Äôs that are due around the same time as you. You can ask questions if you feel lost or alone. This app is so helpful I love it üíï

title: Amazing for all stages
body: This app has been wonder during my pregnancy and afterwards. I have a 10 year that I have used this app from my pregnancy with her and with my other two younger children. It gives this most accurate information down to the tee. I really enjoy all the daily reads as well. And updates per age of all three children. I would recommend this app to anyone

title: 100% Recommended
body: Such great information, and it‚Äôs not too overwhelming since it goes week by week and day by day. I love all the tools available, including the Bumpie and the Labor Tools that I have used in my prior pregnancies.

title: Most have app
body: Once I decided to have a baby last yr I found this awesome application, it helps you to track your fertility days using the test strips accordingly. And now that after a yr of trying it, is helping me to track my days of pregnancy and give me tips of what to look for on a daily basis and make me feel special, if you know how to use this app it will change your life

title: On it daily - sometimes for hours
body: FTM here - I truly love and appreciate this app. I find myself on it daily and sometimes for hours. There are message boards, videos, tools, and just an abundance of information someone like me needs. I have loved the visuals examples of how my baby changes week by week. I would recommend this app to anyone expecting a little one. Thank you for this app!

title: Great week by week details
body: The app provides detailed images of each week of pregnancy as well as what to expect, and additional articles covering many pregnancy topics. I highly recommend it.

title: Very Informational and easy to use
body: Me and my husband love this app we learn sooo much about our new baby girl everytime we open it, it‚Äôs Super exciting to hear all the wonderful things about our baby girl and her growth while we can‚Äôt yet physically see her I‚Äôm so much more knowledgeable since using this app and will continue to use it throughout the duration of my pregnancy and maybe even after birthü•∞ü•∞ü•∞

title: Accurate
body: I love this app I have been using it since I was pregnant with my first baby girl in 2016. The milestones are always accurate timing and keeps me updated. If I ever have any concerns I can always check here before asking my doctor (if it‚Äôs minor concerns).

title: Love love love this app
body: This review has been a long time coming. I absolutely LOVE this app. It was sooo helpful during my pregnancy but ESPECIALLY after. The community board available is amazing. There are so many helpful topics they cover from babies born the same month to finances to helping with marriage/divorce issues. It has replaced social media for me, because I actually benefit from its use. Highly recommend!!! Thank you babycenter!

title: Best App Ever
body: I loved keeping track of my baby‚Äôs development using Baby Center. The app is informative about my body as well, and the suggested articles made me feel informed week by week. I also appreciated the section of safe vs warning vs unsafe activities/products to help me make good decisions! I felt more connected to my baby and my changing body than I would have ever! Specially being a first time mom.

title: Terrible, catty women, unsupportive
body: There are a good number of women in these blogs that are nothing but rude, dismissive, and condescending. There are a few who post simply for reactions and inciting drama. It leaves other users feeling too afraid to post for fear of negative backlash. It‚Äôs really a shame that a FTM seeking advice can‚Äôt bring themselves to post or discuss because she would rather not risk being ganged up on.

title: Baby Center Review
body: I enjoy having this app on my phone because you have quick easy access to search different kinds of information.  I like receiving articles  via email and every week is a milestone and you learn about your growing baby.

title: Great App for parents
body: Babycenter got me through both pregnancy. If I had any concerns I can communicate with other moms and connect with them too. I also get email updates about my 3 month old every month and I still get updates on my 7 year old each month since he was worn! I highly recommend this app to not just moms but ANY parent! Thank you babycenter and all the people there! üòÑüôÇ

title: Handy tool for moms of all stages!

I especially enjoyed the weekly bump pictures, and learning about my baby girl‚Äôs development each week!

title: Love!!
body: I love that this app has not only a tracker for your baby, however seeing your body change as well to use pretty incredible. Especially because my obgyn isn‚Äôt taking appointments until 12 weeks so this app provides a lot of clarity behind what is going on! Thank you!

title: Helpful for Moms of all Stages
body: This app has developed quite a bit over the years. There‚Äôs so much to explore and learn. I love that no matter if you‚Äôre a young mom, a new mom, a mom of 5, or a high risk mom, there‚Äôs something for you! The videos are high quality, the pictures is bright, and there are ways to customize app information for your personal needs. Definitely my favorite of the pregnancy apps!

title: Would be better if all the features worked
body: The app crashes EVERY SINGLE TIME I use the bumpie feature. Whether I am uploading a new pic or trying to view my older pics, it crashes without fail. Also, the newer version layout is nice but hardly ever works. When I click on the icons from the home page, it links to a blank white screen. If I go to Baby Center‚Äôs website, the links work there and I can view the videos and see the weekly progress updates, but not it the app.

title: Love this app
body: Gives amazing in-detail week by week descriptions of how you‚Äôll feel during and pregnancy to make sure your baby is healthy and on the right track. I thought this app was done being amazing after birth but no, they also give you week by week description on how your baby should be developing every week. This saves me from so much anxiety, I absolutely love it!

title: Love love love it
body: This app is amazing !! I just found out I was pregnant two weeks ago with my first child so I couldn‚Äôt be anymore confused on how this whole pregnancy thing works and this app has narrowed everything down for me down to what I can eat and not eat, which prenatals are best, how big my baby looks each day etc. Wouldn‚Äôt change a thing about this app definitely recommend.

title: Outstanding!
body: This app is filled with so much helpful information! Any questions I have had they were completely answered through the week by week breakdown!

title: Too many jerks
body: I would love this app and recommend it to other moms if it weren‚Äôt for the serious lack of guidelines in their birth groups. There are some awful people on there that continue to harass and bully and belittle etc. nothing gets done and it just continues. You can‚Äôt ask a single question without someone being incredibly snarky and rude. Don‚Äôt even get me started on if you try to defend yourself. It‚Äôs you against the internet at that point.

title: I like this app!
body: I like this app because its reliable. It‚Äôs like a guide that helps you through the tough time. If your expecting this app to account for everything then your wrong. Thank you all for this app!.

title: From the heart broken mommy to be...
body: I just lost all of my baby bump pictures because your app doesn‚Äôt save any of the bumpies to your profile if the app gets removed from your phone even though you set a log in. I‚Äôm in tears... why would you guys set it up this way...

title: Love This App!
body: It‚Äôs nice to be able to know exactly where your baby is growth wise as you go through the weeks of pregnancy. I love also that you can share in the experiences of others as well as explain your experiences and ask questions with things you may going through. title: Baby
body: Love the app, overall it‚Äôs great to see he growth of my baby and be able to be in groups of people that are in the same trimester going through all the same things at the same time. title: So great!
body: This App is amazing. Being a first time mom I had loads of questions and many times o would forget said questions with all the hustle and bustle. title: Great information
body: I download the app when I got pregnant and it was amazing to track the baby‚Äôs development. title: Love it!!!
body: I‚Äôve been using this app sense I got pregnant. It has such great educational articles to read. title: Great informative app
body: No matter how I‚Äôm feeling or what questions I have in all occasions I‚Äôve been able to find some answers on the BabyCenter app. I love it, it always gives me updates on my baby‚Äôs developing and size, as well as, questions and concerns I may have. title: App not updating info
body: App has great helpful information and videos but the backend functionality isn‚Äôt working, there appears to be a bug in the coding on both the app and the website (the html and or JavaScript of form field of the day isn‚Äôt reading correctly-check the console, there are errors) not allowing the due dates the birthday to update correctly even when saved and refreshed it still doesn‚Äôt update correctly making the pregnancy tracker week show up incorrectly.

title: Loved it since I was pregnant

title: Mommy relief

title: I love this app!
body: I have found answers to all of the questions that I‚Äôve had during my pregnancy in this app, the week count and description of what‚Äôs going on with the baby and your body as the weeks go by is great and helps you understand more what you are going through. title: Happy Experience!

title: Falsifying vaccine safety
body: Vaccines do cause autism...there is overwhelming studies to prove this in Europe as well as private practices conducting their own unbiased studies.

body: Im a mother of two and had this app since my first pregnancy and till this day I still continue to use the baby center app like I couldn‚Äôt be any more happier‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏è  with this app!! title: There‚Äôs SJW‚Äôs on here
body: There‚Äôs a mommy baby month due date club and you‚Äôd assume it would be great right? No. It‚Äôs also not as fun as it used to, they allow people who don‚Äôt align with your beliefs to delete your comment without review. When they become unbiased I‚Äôll download again but until then I just plan to never use it again.

title: Great app
body: It has everything.. from support groups to community posts for things you may be curious or have questions about. title: New update is bad
body: I used this app when I was pregnant with my first child and I loved it, the majority of my pregnancy was in 2018 and you guys didn‚Äôt update it till about a month or so (give or take, ive started using it again for my second pregnancy) and with this new update when I click on one of the four tabs I‚Äôm taken to a blank page. title: Paid ads
body: The signet (Zales and Kay‚Äôs) and lightbox ads and placements are obnoxious. title: A small suggestion
body: I love this app. It keeps In informed how far along I am, along w/ new daily information. title: First time mom.. love it!! üíïüíï

title: Love it.
body: I love this app bc I can find all information I need. If you have a question in your mind you can ask and the other mom-to-be will answer. In addition, the app give you information related to your baby each week.

title: Great App
body: It constantly keeps you updated and gives you consistent updates as well as all kinds of new information in different ways such as articles or videos. This app is especially good for new mothers when you want to know something or never knew something at all that you probably should, it keeps you informed without even asking.

title: Favorite app so far!
body: I‚Äôm new to this whole ‚Äúmom‚Äù thing! I have downloaded a ton of apps regarding pregnancy and info articles. Some are okay, some are full of info, and some are terrible. title: Size comparison is jacked up.
body: Although there is some good information, there are other things that make me stop and say "huh?" Spaghetti squash are bigger than any mango I've seen. Limes are bigger than pea pods. Avocados, and apples are about the same size most of the year. As are green peppers and heirloom tomatoes. And comparing a baby to a banana or carrot is completely subjective because those can range from 4 inches to 14 long depending on the variety. If they want to give you an idea of the size of the baby, they need a better system.

title: Great app-but makes me sign in all the time

The other pregnancy apps I use don‚Äôt do this, and I‚Äôm usually more inclined to just look at those since I don‚Äôt have to keep signing in.

title: What To Expect?

title: Helpfull

title: I love this app

title: Very educated and interesting

title: I LOVE Baby Center!!
body: I have been using Baby Center as my go to since my pregnancy with my daughter 7 years ago. Now going through my second pregnancy I am reminded just why I stuck with it the first time. I still get emails about what my 7 year old might be going through at school or at home and it‚Äôs always been an awesome resource for me! Thank you Baby Center!

title: Baby Center
body: Baby Center is a nice app that I really enjoy having! It shows you what your baby looks like inside your stomach and how tall and big your baby is depending on how far along you are. It also has a question and answers section where you can ask other women questions and answer questions about anything you want and more!

title: Friendly reminder
body: I have been using your app and receiving your emails for over a year now and I have noticed that in every article/post/email you use ‚Äúher‚Äù ‚Äúshe‚Äù ‚Äúgirl‚Äù... males are still being born and my husband and I find it offensive that everything is in the direction of females. In today‚Äôs day and age there shouldn‚Äôt be any sexism. Thinking about everything being directed towards females I find very sexist. Maybe using ‚Äúlittle one‚Äù ‚Äúbaby‚Äù or ‚Äúmini me‚Äù  might be safer if you don‚Äôt want to use male terms. Just a friendly reminder from a BOY Mom.

title: Perfect guide
body: This app has been awesome guide for the first time mom like me. Since the time we found out pregnant and till the date now ( baby‚Äôs 3 months old) , this app helped a lot. Everyday is exciting and this app gives a lot of idea how the things are needed to be done. I absolutely love this app and recommend every parents, whether first time baby or multiple.

title: Love this app-answers all my questions
body: I have enjoyed this app. Anytime I have a question-I find the answer here. Even to questions I think must be random and off the wall, to my surprise the answer is always on baby center. I also find confidence that the answers are majority of the time backed by a physician or scientific evidence. I recommend this app to all my friends.

title: Amazing
body: This app has been great my whole pregnancy! It counts down the days and tells you about changes you and baby go through each week. It‚Äôs my 4th baby and I wish I knew about this app with all the other ones. Plus you can save your ‚Äúbumpies‚Äù and watch your stomach grow from start to finish! Highly recommend using this app.

title: Helpful for a first timer
body: This is my first pregnancy and I‚Äôve been able to rely on this app to predict and warn me about what to expect each week. It‚Äôs been dead right which has been comforting to know what I‚Äôm experiencing is normal. It‚Äôs also so fun taking bumpies and seeing my baby‚Äôs growth from the inside with each weeks updates about what‚Äôs happening in my body.

title: The only baby app you will need
body: Love this app. They are packed with helpful articles not just for myself but for my husband as well! He downloaded it and keeps tracking everything I am going through. I can‚Äôt tell you how sweet and comforting it is to hear him come home and give me useful tips about things like foods to avoid or ways to overcome morning sickness.

title: Perfect!
body: I love this app i got it as soon as i got pregnant and I absolutely fell in love with it. It has everything you need to prepare yourself to be a mom and sends you cute little tips every now and then. Keeps track of how far along are you and tells you what to expect week by week! It has so many cool features like the kick counter and the bumpie to track your growing bump :)

title: Pregnancy app
body: I used this app when I was pregnant with my first and I love how they sent weekly/monthly notifications/emails about his growth and milestones. I‚Äôm using the app this time for my 2nd pregnancy and love receiving notifications about my sons growth and facts/tips about which week of pregnancy I‚Äôm at. The app is informative and there‚Äôs groups you can join and talk to other moms. Highly recommend!

title: Very accurate
body: I am using the app postpartum. It provides weekly updates based on baby's age and has been very accurate so far. Helps be proactive as well as reactive to a situation. It also has useful videos and articles to educate a first time mom like me. Daddy too has this app and it helps him catch up to baby's progress inspite of spending most of the time at work.

title: Great resource
body: I have thoroughly enjoyed this app throughout my pregnancy and now as a mom to a newborn. My colleagues and I realy enjoyed tracking baby‚Äôs growth every week as she was compared to a new fruit/veggie. The app has a wealth of information on what to expect and I found the baby boards as far as symptoms and symptom management. Wish this was around when I had my first 19 years ago.

title: Great app!
body: I‚Äôve used this app daily throughout my pregnancy. It‚Äôs been reliable and helps me to understand where I‚Äôm at and not to worry when I felt uneasy about something. I like that it has extra tools like a contraction counter and the ‚Äúis it safe‚Äù tab to see what‚Äôs safe or unsafe to do, eat, be around, and what‚Äôs products to stay away from during pregnancy.

title: Keeping track is the best
body: My son is 8 months and this app has helped me keep up to date with all the questions that comes with having a child. Even while I was pregnant I really enjoyed keeping track of my what the baby could look like month by month and how my body was changing through the process.

title: Great pregnancy app!
body: I get on this app daily. I look forward to the quick daily updates, as well as the longer weekly updates. The weight tracker is great! I started using it at the beginning of my 2nd trimester and update it after every doctor‚Äôs appointment. The weekly reads are helpful too!

title: Love this App!!!
body: I love the update reminders and worry-free of what is going on with my daughter every week. She will progress before a reminder of her age suppose to do that week or month, or like ‚Äúnot to worry your child has not progress to this stage, she will soon‚Äù type of articles. It makes mine and my husband‚Äôs first-time-parenting. A lot easier!! Thank you so much!!!

title: I love it üòä
body: I absolutely love how I can connect with other Soon To Be Mothers, and experience such organization while getting information on the growth of my baby! Keep it up Baby Center, your the best. I highly recommend this app for any Soon To Be Mothers and women/Couples that are trying to conceive! The information they give is totally 100 percent perfect and you understand easily!

title: Amazing information to take the worries away!
body: I really like all of the information and how easy it is to access everything. Notifications are amazing!! We were excited to see what‚Äôs coming next. It was also helpful when talking to our doctor.  I really recommend this app for everyone. Especially grandparents like us!!

title: Great app!
body: Easy to use and super informative. I'm currently expecting my second baby and have learned so much from this app. Every week is related to where you are in your pregnancy and maybe answer some questions you have or even bring attention to something you haven't thought about. I would highly recommend.

title: Would have been 5 stars...
body: Until just now, Baby Center was our favorite and go-to app for keeping up with our growing baby. Tonight, however, when we pulled up the video to cheerfully explain our 30th week of pregnancy, the ad that started to run before it was for a horror movie. Horror is right. The last thing this expectant couple wants to see before a sweet informative and animated baby video is a movie trailer about a possessed and evil doll. Please rethink your advertising choices.

title: Best app for pregnancy I have!!
body: I have a couple apps for pregnancy, and this is my favorite. I love being able to look ahead to see how big the baby will be, what my body can be doing, etc. in the next couple weeks. I also love the ‚Äúis it safe?‚Äù portion!! It eases my mind so much to be able to look up common things and see what‚Äôs generally safe or not.

title: Recommended
body: Very informative! I am a first time mom and all information available is overwhelming, this app give you what you need to know at the right time in your pregnancy and after your baby is born with reliable sources of information. I did not look much into other apps available but I found this one gave me a lot of pertinent details

title: Best App!
body: All around super fun and extremely informative. I look forward to my weekly updates! Answers a ton of first mom questions and has so many cute features!! Would highly recommend this app to anyone having a baby, whether it‚Äôs your first and fifth baby, it‚Äôs always fun to keep track of their growth and check out if your symptoms are normal.

title: Rate
body: This app is so informative I love it, my children are 28 , 24 and 22 years old, back then I did not have access to this kind of information, I am getting ready for my 2nd grandchild the first is only 10 months old and was adopted by my oldest and is truly the love of this granny‚Äôs life , now my middle is pregnant 13 weeks and 5 days along , she is the reason I have this app.

title: FIX ISSUES
body: i LOVED this app, used it they my entire pregnancy, took weekly pictures, read all the helpful articles, wonderful. After i had my babe, i started using the other part of the app. now every time i go back to the pregnancy side ( to look at my pictures, etc.) the app crashes. i‚Äôve sent checked for updates, restarted the app, send emails to find help, still doesn‚Äôt work. app crashes every time.... ‚òπÔ∏è i would love to give it a 5 star. please fix!!

title: Amazing app
body: Had all the tools I needed with my first pregnancy, unfortunately I ended up having a miscarriage but this app provided me with helpful information for both my fianc√© & I on how to cope.. Now 4 months after im pregnant once again! Thank you baby center, you guys are changing a lot of family lives & giving a lot of helpful tools, information, & support!

title: Very helpful
body: I have been using baby center for all four of my pregnancies and I love it. They are very informative and helpful. Even after pregnancy! I still use the app to look at the developmental stages of each of my children as they grow older and I use it faithfully to read about different challenges with each age and stage. It‚Äôs like having a handheld parenting advisor

title: Very useful and really informative!
body: I am a first time mom, I had my son January 2018ü§±üèªüëºüèª Throughout my entire pregnancy I have used the Baby Center App and have loved it from day one! I love how it tracks your pregnancy and gives you day by day information, during pregnancy and after! I have honestly learned a lot since using the app. Will definitely have to give two thumbs up üëçüèªüëçüèª and keep recommending this app to future mothers.

title: Accuracy
body: I am an ObGyn Physician and I find this app pry 98-99% accurate. I tell all my patients to use it to answer their questions and reassure themselves that what they are feeling / experiencing is normal. And I used it myself in both pregnancies for fun reads, tracking my bump, and ideas of what information is trending (topic wise and baby-item wise) to discuss with my patients, family, and friends.

title: Amazing pregnancy app!
body: This app is not only great for all the information they give you week by week on your pregnancy, but it also has discussion boards that you can chat with other expecting moms about anything and everything! I will definitely keep this app throughout the rest of this pregnancy and all other pregnancies I might have!

title: Love Baby Center
body: This app is a great place to start for welcoming your baby into the world. From start to finish I spend less time reading about my symptoms and more time asking women who are in the same state as me about my symptoms! There‚Äôs also all kinds of tools like the kick tracker and daily reminders to help you stay on track. I highly recommend this app!!

title: Frequently logs out and doesn‚Äôt allow you to log back in
body: This is probably my favorite pregnancy app, I have two others, but one issue is making me very unhappy with this app. The app frequently will for some reason sign out, and when I try to sign back in it says that account doesn‚Äôt exist. A day later it is usually back to normal, but until it fixes itself I can‚Äôt use the app.

title: Love it!!
body: I‚Äôve used this app with both of my children (8 and 11 months) I am currently using it with my 11 month old. I love the tracking and articles on development as they are always on point with things that I‚Äôm experiencing. The app is great, doesn‚Äôt take up too much space on my phone, and I actually get excited when new info pops up!

title: 5 Star App
body: I absolutely loved this app during my pregnancy. It tells you any and everything you need to know and you also get to interact with other mothers so you can ask questions and get all kinds of different stories. This app is amazing and I will use this app for my next pregnancy and also recommend this app to every new mom. Thanks BabyCenter ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Favorite app so far
body: Very simple and easy to use. I enjoy the step by step illustration of my pregnancy and the amazing animated videos they create to show and explain the stages of pregnancy. It‚Äôs a lot of information to take in at once for a new mom so I appreciate the fact that it‚Äôs step by step, and comes with all of the helpful tips you could possibly think of- whether for nutrition, medical needs, social needs, etc

title: On point
body: This app has just about anything and everything you could think of. I love reading the suggested articles and they almost always correlate to what I‚Äôm going through at that time with baby. And I enjoy seeing the Anonymous polls and being able to type and look things up as well. Great app! Would recommend.

title: Best pregnancy app
body: I love everything about this app. It's made my pregnancy even more fun with all the information it provides along with letting me know how my babies grow week to week. You can ask questions to other Momma's and read questions that other people have asked and had answered. I check it every day and love it more and more!

title: Glitches
body: The app is great but it glitches horribly when navigating the forums. Frequently, it will freeze while loading and you‚Äôre left with a blank white page, and other times the forum shows the same 3-4 posts repeatedly listed multiple times in a row as you scroll down the forum. It really is quite aggravating I have to close out the app and restart it every time it freezes or crashes (about every 5 or so minutes).

title: If you‚Äôre getting this app to connect with others- DON‚ÄôT
body: The birth month groups are honestly littered with trolls and snarky, negative participants with way too much time on their hands. The mods don‚Äôt do anything about participants treating other disrespectfully and ridiculing people who ask questions. You will NOT get the support you are looking for through BabyCenter.

title: Best app to use during pregnancy and child care
body: Best app for a new time mother like myself. I learned so much during while I was pregnant with my first born. I was so nervous about how to take care of a baby and this app provides so much information. After my son was born, I still use this app to read about his developmental milestones and other articles as well. Wonderful app!

title: Great app!
body: The baby center app has a fantastic layout that easy to read and suggests articles and facts that are appropriately timed during pregnancy as well as when your child grows. There is a little discrepancy between the day that each new week cycles depending on whether your looking at the app or the email notification, but it‚Äôs not a super big deal. Definitely would recommend to other moms and dads.

title: Second time using app
body: I used this app during my first pregnancy and now 4 years later seeing all the new updates. I love it even more. What I like most about it, is that it will send you chats with other moms that had kids around the same time you did to talk about stuff you might be going through with your kids.

title: The Best App Ever!
body: I‚Äôm so Glad, I downloaded the BabyCenter app. This was my first time being pregnant and this app help me go through different stages of my pregnancy week by week. After I had my baby , I still use this app. It comes in handy . It let me know my baby progress and what he should be doing as the months go on. Download this app now, I promise you will not regret it.....

title: App works well, but webpage does not
body: App works well but anytime you want to read an article or watch a video, the webpage often reloads every few seconds due to the amount of ads that are trying to load, which causes the page to consistently crash.  This is very frustrating and I often just give up watching the videos or reading the articles which is a shame because they do provide very good information

title: My go to Mamma app
body: This app literally has changed my life and the way I look at things! It was recommended by a friend for my first and now with my second child I SWEAR and stand with this app!

title: Love this app!
body: I have used this app with all 5 of my babies and I love it! Every week I am excited to learn something new about my pregnancy, my favorite feature is the little surveys that ask you questions and shows you how many women answered the same or different. It‚Äôs fun to know how many women are feeling the same way during their pregnancy to!

title: So far so good. Enjoying it
body: Only 11 weeks pregnant, will see how it goes, but I like it this far

title: Enjoyable
body: I had a friend refer me to this app, being a new expecting mother I felt I was way in over my head. This app has great articles and helps keep track of your trimesters with informative updates on the baby‚Äôs growth over the weeks. It‚Äôs helped me be a bit more informed than just searching around on the Internet. I‚Äôve really been enjoying it.

title: Everything I need
body: I love all the information and the regular updates I get during pregnancy. I miscarried last year and was going through such a difficult time but it was so easy and respectful to stop the pregnancy updates and emails right away. Now that I am pregnant again, I am signed up for updates again and hoping for the best!

title: You lose your pictures and notes
body: I loved this app when I was pregnant, but after my baby came and I was ready to put my bump pictures in a album I looked and all my bump pictures and pregnancy notes were gone! Customer service apologized, but said there was nothing they could do to retrieve them. How horrible to offer this and not protect the data or have it properly stored. If I would have known my pictures wouldn‚Äôt be safe I would have never used this app. Luckily I had some pictures on my phone, but I am missing weeks and all my notes are gone.

title: Good App for TTC and pregnancy/baby advice
body: this app has helped me through the trying to conceive process, the loss of a pregnancy, and now I‚Äôm at the halfway point of what will hopefully be my first take home baby! there are some women who genuinely give helpful advice, you just have to sift through those that have no clue what they‚Äôre talking about! this is a good place to find information and to join the communities that pertain to your baby situation.

title: Love love love
body: As an upcoming new mom, this app is awesome. It has so much information, insight and graphics of how my bundle is growing. It also connects you with a group of women whose babies are due within the same month as yours. You can talk to these women, encourage each other and share info. It gives awesome advice, has videos, teachings, and things to help prepare you for the big day.  I love this app

title: Too many ads, not good kick counter
body: I downloaded this for the kick counter. There is no way to log kicks that happened while you were away from your phone so the time-stamp is wrong (goodbye 2 hour guidelines, hello confusion).

title: Absolutely love this app!
body: I would say this app is about 98% always on point if not higher. I compare this app to actual appointments I go to and it‚Äôs amazing how extremely close this app is to your pregnancy. Of course everyone‚Äôs situation with pregnancy is different that‚Äôs why I didn‚Äôt give it 100% on my personal feedback. I love it tho it makes everything so easy!

title: Love the appp!!!!
body: I downloaded this app when I was 4 weeks pregnant, every week they will send articles about the baby‚Äôs development and changes in your body. My baby is already 2 months now and I still use the app to track his growth and they still sending me reading about how the baby‚Äôs growing and my body after birth. I really love this app

title: Helpful
body: Instead of google (which I TRY to avoid) if I have silly questions or weird things I will go on the baby center app to see the forums or articles about other women. I have found it very helpful knowing what‚Äôs changing in your body each week. I still remember downloading the app when I was in the ‚Äúpoppy seed‚Äù week and now I‚Äôm 31 weeks. Enjoy!

title: Fun and useful
body: I used this app all during pregnancy and it was a great way to keep track of the changes with the baby and myself! Only problem was that it would freeze every now and then, and wouldn't update to the current day. The tools like the contraction timer were helpful, but the others not so much. I wish there was more info geared toward at home/birth center births; Not everyone uses a hospital.

title: Love it!
body: I love getting my weekly update on my little man's progress! I get to keep track of my growing belly with my bumpies and i am always able to find answers to my questions about how I'm feeling. I like to be able to see how other mothers are dealing with pregnancy also. I've used BabyCenter to track all 3 of my pregnancies and the app just made it easier.

title: Perfect for any mom to be!
body: I am pregnant with my first child, and felt like I was walking into a mysterious new world until I found this app. It gives you day by day updates, advice and fun information throughout your pregnancy to help guide you through the process. This app has been an amazing tool for this first time mom and I will certainly use it for my second!

title: MAJOR mobile issues
body: I love the info and community on this website. I used it with my first pregnancy seven years ago and was happy to rejoin this time. However, the mobile app is extremely glitchy. I can‚Äôt load posts on the birth board, and when I try to comment or post, the keyboard freezes up and it takes me ten minutes or more to type a short paragraph, and sometimes it crashes before I can even post it. I cannot participate in the community because of the poor quality of the app on iPhone. I am so disappointed because I really enjoyed it before.

title: Baby app is amazing
body: This app gives me some sort of relieve as a first time dad. It tells me step by step what to expect. Yes, every baby is different but it‚Äôs a good feeling to know what‚Äôs coming your way and how your baby is changing or if your baby is falling behind on certain things so you can bring it up to the doctors and get a professional opinion. I love the app!

title: Review by Jane Madeline
body: This program is so full of important information that I cannot thank you enough. I wish it had been available when I was pregnant with my children now 3 decades ago.

title: Uplifting
body: Second child and second time using this app. I really enjoy getting the notification of a new week of information on our baby girls growth. During our first pregnancy it was nice to know what was going on as a first time father. This second time around it‚Äôs still just as great but I have a bit of experience this time.

title: Love love love
body: This app has helped me through my entire pregnancy and has given very very good information and tips for being a new parent. I love that you can read articles about your baby‚Äôs age and what to expect. It really helps when you have no clue what to do. I‚Äôve recommended this app to my other expecting friends. Highly recommend ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Accurate tracker and very informative
body: It‚Äôs really amazing being able to track your pregnancy the whole way through and watch the journey of growth between ultrasounds. There‚Äôs a lot of information about the stages of development as well as what‚Äôs going on in mom‚Äôs body too. Overall, extremely pleased with this service!

title: Love this app!
body: This app is very informational and gives me weekly updates on baby and your pregnancy as well as steps you can take and different options to think of- especially for first time parents! Used it all the time during my pregnancy and now I can track the baby with it after giving birth too !

title: Amazing app!!
body: I have been using this app since I found out I was pregnant, my daughter is now 6 months and 4 weeks old! It has given me weekly updates on what milestones and developmental changes my daughter is going through! I also love the community tab where I can all other parents questions. Highly recommend this app!

title: Had this app about 3 years I AM NOT SWITCHING
body: I had this app since my first daughter was born , she is 2 years old it helped me a lot during my pregnancy. I am now pregnant with my second daughter & it still helps a lot & keeps me updated with the changes I'm going to go through with my body & helps me interact with other mothers when I have questions .

title: The companion and guide you need throughout pregnancy and beyond!
body: Baby Center has been an incredible guide throughout my previous pregnancy  and current one. Even beyond pregnancy, it provides useful, practical guide for raising smart and confident children who feel loved and haves strong sense of belonging.

title: Fabulous and Informative
body: The fruits/veggies size comparisons are accurate. The app provides great information and pictures of how the baby looks in the womb with details week-by-week! Also provides illustrations of how big the baby looks in comparison to the body week-by-week. This app is by far my favorite that I‚Äôve used during my pregnancy.

title: Great App
body: I have been using BabyCenter since I found out I was pregnant. This one and another app were my favorites! I found and still find it very informative and educational, and now that my baby has been born I love that I still continue to get everything I got while pregnant. I know my other mom friends also really enjoy this app! Thank you!

title: Love this app
body: This app has answered so many of my questions, helped me relax about certain concerns, given me so much knowledge about my baby and i, helped me stay organized, and helped me gather the right questions for my doctor. i love that they have different tools like the registers help and baby trackers. Thank you so much to the founders and team of BabyCenter! You are MUCH appreciated!

title: What a good resource for a new mom!
body: As first time mom, I have loads questions about baby development day to day, week to week. This app provide a good platform for moms to learn about developmental phases and what to expect in future weeks. Not all babies are the same, so you have to pick and choose information that is helpful for you. Overall, it is a good app.

title: So friendly, informative, and practical
body: As a ‚ÄúGrandma to Be‚Äù I love that this Ap keeps me in touch w what my daughter and grandbaby are experiencing in this ‚Äúintimate world of the womb‚Äù for ‚Äúgrandbaby-in-the-making‚Äù and for the wonder of transformation as my daughter and her body responds to the needs of nurturing a life in the process of being creation. Thank you! It‚Äôs all ‚Äúmagical‚Äù and complicated. But the ap makes it v friendly.

title: Why the Update?
body: I have a 10 month old and I‚Äôve been using this app since I found out I was pregnant with him. It‚Äôs been the best app for pregnancy and baby up until the most recent update. YIKES! It‚Äôs so buggy, it‚Äôs almost unusable. Can‚Äôt click on links, sometimes pages show up without content, and the user experience is actually worse and less attractive. Not sure why it wasn‚Äôt tested before the release because it‚Äôs awful. Such a bummer.

title: Satisfied
body: This app is great! It keeps you on track with what to expect at doctor‚Äôs visits and even after baby is born it helps ease your anxious mind with constant facts and tips that are perfect for the age of your baby. The little community blogs let you know you‚Äôre not crazy by reading about other moms going through the same things as you. Great Job!

title: Great App with awesome tips
body: I love this app, it keeps up with your pregnancy weekly and informs you about any changes as well as how your baby grows. I do love the comparison of how big the baby gets. There‚Äôs also great tips such as exercises, foods that are safe and not safe, and other healthful tools. You can also be a part of parenting club to keep in touch with other moms and moms to be.

title: Awesome app!
body: During my pregnancy, I used several different apps to track all the changes related to pregnancy and get all information that I get ... But, I love this the most because of the overall content and the convenience to keep up with my individual diary! It is very helpful by making this awesome experience as smooth as possible üíï

title: Already Sad
body: I recall using this App with my first child and how I felt when I stopped getting emails as she became older. I  was thrilled to re-install it when I got pregnant with my second child. I love learning about how my baby grows so much and am already dreading when I‚Äôll stop getting emails about her knowing this is my last hoo-rah. Great information and great app. Thank you!!

title: Community is not safe, fun, intelligent or welcoming
body: As a new mom I thought there might be a good community of other new moms who would be interested in sharing activities and other things that help advance their baby‚Äôs development. I was wrong and this is not a great place to share productive conversations with other intelligent moms. This is a good community if you want to complain about some of the challenges of being a mom, brag about things like your body after baby, or ask questions that you could‚Äôve just Googled (or call your doc) to get way better advice faster.

title: Amazing App!!!
body: I love this app, I‚Äôve learned so much in my second pregnancy that I wished I‚Äôd learned the first time around. It Kept me up to date on every step from 4 weeks of pregnancy to now that my baby‚Äôs 10 months. A must have for moms. Beside learning about your child, you‚Äôre also learning about your body, mental health relaxation tips, exercise and so much more.

title: Great App! Used it both pregnancies!
body: I have used BabyCenter for both of my pregnancies and loved it! My first pregnancy was unexpected, and BabyCenter helped me track it week by week while also offering amazing insight and advice! With my second, it helped me track my cycle on the journey to conceiving. The community is also great! I recommend it for anyone trying to conceive or who is pregnant!

title: Install Immediately!
body: Great way to track your pregnancy, get information, and so much more!! I love participating in the polls to see what other moms are thinking. All the tools they offer let me have everything I need on one app! I‚Äôm 39 weeks today and will be using the contraction timer soon‚Äî if you‚Äôre expecting than I expect you to get this app!

title: Won‚Äôt save updates
body: I like this app. I‚Äôve used it with 2 children and loved how much information it gives me. However, when I try to give it information like updating the name, gender, and uploading pictures, it doesn't remember what I tell it. This is supposed to be a two way relationship but I‚Äôm only getting one side from it and I feel like I‚Äôm doing all the work for nothing.

title: Great pregnancy tool
body: This app has been a huge lifesaver for me during pregnancy. It has so many features, updates, and tools within the app that were easy to access at any time when I had questions or wanted to know how my baby was progressing each week. title: Very informative

body: So I‚Äôm new to all this and I just typed like a really long post about what‚Äôs been going on and needing advice and when I pressed create post it deleted everything! title: Heteronormative
body: I was excited to begin tracking my pregnancy but from my first encounter with this app I have been struck by how heteronormative it is. I started by completing the "Am I pregnant?" quiz and the first question was "have you had sex since your last period?". As a married lesbian using home insemination with a known donor I did not become pregnant by having sex. In fact, many straight women become pregnant through alternative methods these days. It's time to get with the times and update the app to reflect the diversity of pregnancy in 2018.

title: Love this app!

title: Love It!!!
body: Easy to use, tracks your pregnancy and gives you lots of information related to your pregnancy stage, there is tons of advice and the ease of chatting with other moms is great! Most moms, especially experienced ones are willing to help or give advice on any questions you have as a first, second, third...time mom.

title: Started out informative...
body: BabyCenter was my go to place for all things as a brand new mom to be. However I miscarried early in my pregnancy. Unlike most pregnancy apps there is no miscarriage mode. I am left with weekly updates about a baby that I am longer carrying, along with my email being sold to many other baby vendors soliciting goods I do not need right now. It would be great to have a miscarriage mode like Flo or PreMom where the content and information changes to grieving a loss and TTC again.

title: Love it!
body: I love this app. It has a lot of interesting short videos, shows you what‚Äôs happening week by week of your pregnancy. My wife and I can‚Äôt wait to read the new one every week!  Also has a handy countdown of days you can see at all times. Tons more too, highly recommend!

title: V informative
body: I have the Bump and What to Expect which are good but can be use silly/flip language for such a spectacular and overwhelming life event. The Baby Center has more in-depth insights that are matter of fact without being alarming.  There‚Äôs a reassurance in the information is presented. Even more than my dang doctor!

title: Love this app
body: I started using it as soon as I found it, I think I was was 2 months pregnant and I look forward to the weekly updates on my babies growth and development. I also really enjoy the articles, they include such helpful, like how to get your baby to sleep at night, feeding tips, and more.

title: Pregnancy
body: I love baby center, they help me throughout my pregnancy with all the information I need.. from my baby growth to giving birth and still

title: Excellent resource
body: I joined your site as a grandparent to follow the weekly gestation of my first grandchild nearly 4 years ago.

title: Great site!
body: My daughter had a baby one week ago. She and I both used your app to keep up to date with each step of her pregnancy. The questions we were asking, you answered and helped us both with peace of mind as she carried her son....my grandson! Thank you! And blessings to all the new and expectant moms out there!!

title: Informative and Fun
body: The weekly updates are informative and I look forward it learning about the progress of my pregnancy. The articles and videos are great. The polls are fun and being able to look things up is also helpful. Truly a one stop shop for all things pregnancy

title: The app is fine. The people aren‚Äôt
body: The articles and tracking part of the app is great. But when it comes to the discussion groups, the place people are coming for help, most of the posters are cruel and/or condescending to each other. If you think this is supposed to be a supportive group, it apparently isn‚Äôt. The site really needs to get more moderators out there, unless the purpose of the app is to make expectant and new mothers feel like they are alone in this... then I guess it‚Äôs spot on.

title: All the Rage!!
body: Seriously though, as a young mom without too many friends or acquaintances to Help me know what the green stuff is, or if whatever is coming out of this child today is normal or life threatening, this app (and accompanying website) have been life savers to me!! Highly recommended to anyone who has a tiny human roaming their world!!!

title: Not great if you have a tragedy.
body: NOVEMBER 2017 UPDATE:

title: Great app !
body: Keeps you updated on baby and his/her progress and I absolutely love the birth clubs and being able to ask embarrassing questions without judgement ! Tons of help I check it multiple times a day and feel way better knowing other moms experience the same things !

title: Baby Center status
body: I love how it tracks everything for you and keeps you knowledgeable about the whole process. I have used this App for both kids before and after pregnancy and I don‚Äôt have anything to complain about. The App answers a lot of questions I may have.

title: Chinese calendar got the gender right.
body: Just for fun, the app early on used a Chinese calendar to predict gender and they were right. The app gives good information in the right amount, without feeling overwhelming, or like you are forced to do things. It‚Äôs been a very good experience so far. We will let you know in 19 weeks.

title: Bumpie tool doesn‚Äôt work

There is a black band running down the side of any picture I upload, no matter if it‚Äôs edited or unedited. It totally ruins the image. I have reached out to customer support several times and still have not had a resolution. It‚Äôs the reason I downloaded the app in the first place and now it‚Äôs not even working!

title: Greatness

title: Great

title: My experience

title: Love it

title: In love

title: Great

title: As soon as I signed up the email spam started

title: Great Until Baby is 1 Year Old‚Äîupdate!
body: This app is awesome for expectant parents and post preggo parents up to a year old. The advice is sage and well researched, and the app has been my go-to for most things. My one complaint is that it doesn‚Äôt follow you after your baby turns 1. Why is that? I still receive all the same helpful emails about my now 15 month, 3 week old‚Äôs development and timeline, and when I click on an article in the email it takes me to that article-in the app. Where are the weekly updates in the app itself after a year? Where do I find all the valuable stuff in the email on the app? Right now the app is just stuck on the last week of my 11 month, week 4‚Äôs development (again, he‚Äôs really 15 months), with no way to search the app for other advice and articles appropriate to his age. Those highlights are still an important resource even after a kid turns one, folks. It‚Äôs not like parents suddenly need less advice at that one year mark. ;) When I try to go into the settings to see if I can change anything on my end (like if there‚Äôs a toggle I need to switch saying my baby is now over a year old), the app just crashes. If you ever do add an option where there are weekly articles and suggested reads after a year, could you also please add a function where the app can follow two kids? My husband and I have been talking about baby 2, and it would be great to get advice, reminders and articles about BOTH kids: baby 1 alongside updates about what my pregnancy/new baby should be doing, and what I should be up to. For now, I‚Äôll for sure be resetting the app with baby 2‚Äôs due date once the time comes to keep up with all the good pregnancy advice again.

title: Horrible user experience
body: The app could be great if the developers can fix all the annoying horrible issues that are driving me nuts. It consistently makes me login over and over again. When I first downloaded the app months ago, every single time I clicked in the app it would make me enter both my email and password again and it didn‚Äôt even attempt to auto fill my email. Finally, after having to type in my email and password daily for weeks, it retained the info but I was using it less frequently as a result. After some time with no issue logging in (finally), it just happened again. I couldn‚Äôt remember my password and had to reset it... and the link to reset would not work at first because the cookies appear to have remembered where I left off so I had to go back and close the app in order for the reset to work. Right Before it logged me out for no reason I had a great birthing video up that I wanted to show my husband when he returned from work. The app does not allow you to share or forward videos so my only choice was to wait for my husband to come home to show him this video and then this whole password reset made the placeholder I left disappear and the video lost. I am so frustrated with this experience... the ‚Äú What to Expect‚Äù app is way better as I have never had to reset my password and I am able to easily forward videos on it if I want to. This app has a few cool features but all these issues make it super frustrating to use otherwise.... this was my last straw. I have given this app plenty of chances and I‚Äôm done being frustrated for no reason when this should be a pleasant experience looking at a baby app...
